(set: $picP11 to true) [[Listen to the details -> P10]] ]Jyumon steps forward, handing you a series of small capsules. “These are nano-fiber synthesizers and molecular recombiners. Able to generate clothing, tools, and basic equipment within seconds. I’ve already taken the liberty of programming them based on your outfits and weapons compliment.” You nod your head in thanks. “That’ll help. Funny how the perils on alien planets always seem to destroy your clothing, isn’t it?” “You call it ‘funny’, I call it ‘infuriating’. I had to go on a mission in a spider-filled jungle once, and got stripped naked more times than I can count. Which is why I never leave home without at least a few dozen of these, just in case.” After slipping them into your pocket, Lumina walks up to you next. “I’ve spent the last few weeks imbuing these stones with Celestial healing magic,” she explains. “Hold it up to your body and it will cure you of most wounds… and revert any unwanted transformations.” You nod and accept the handful of beautifully glowing diamonds - every single one sparkles as if a star were trapped within its prism. These will be useful. Perhaps the only thing more common than spiders on your adventures are things that want to petrify, gild, vitrify, encase, solidify, harden, congeal, or otherwise immobilize you. The angel gives you a warm, but worried smile. “But don’t get too careless - if both of you get transformed at the same time there won’t be anyone around to restore you. Based on Vhaja’s analysis, it doesn’t look like anything on the planet will be able to petrify you permanently… but that doesn’t do you much good if no one can find your statues…” “Which is where I come in!” says Krysta. She hops forward and hands to you what looks like a small, individually wrapped hard candy. “This is a Star Scout Tracking Gumdrop,” she explains. “Cherry flavor, of course. Once you eat it, you’ll give off a magical aura that is detectable on most Star Scout comm frequencies. If you feel particularly imperiled, it will basically send out a distress beacon that can be used to track you down for a rescue.” You palm it quickly. “Not that I’ll need it, of course.” “Hey, you never know,” your friend says with a shrug. “Just make sure you finish the whole thing, or it won’t work.” Finally, Vhaja approaches you, bearing two small packages wrapped in cloth. “And these are from me.” You take one and uncover it, revealing what appears to be a small, rune-covered dagger. “If you find yourself thoroughly restrained with materials made out of ghost matter, your raw strength probably isn’t going to be much help in getting you free - but this is enchanted to allow you to sever even spectral substances. Without this, getting captured probably means you’d be staying that way until someone else arrives to rescue you. So… try not to have both of you get restrained at the same time.” “No promises,” you say with a smirk. “Because the only thing hotter than being bound and gagged and at the mercy of a sexy evil lady is having your wife bound up right beside you.” Vhaja gives Revissa a stern look. “Please do not indulge her fetishes while on an important mission.” Your wife snickers and gives you a quick peck on the cheek. “You have my word - if she tries to surrender herself to a sexy villain, I’ll make sure to tie her up first instead.” “How… reassuring,” the Elvaan mutters. But with that, it appears all the details have been thoroughly explained. And a helpful chime from the ship’s computer tells you that you’re nearing the restricted area of space around the planet. It looks like it’s time to finally get this mission underway! [[Head to the bridge -> P12]] As soon as you arrive at the bridge, you instruct the ship’s computer to activate a signal jammer to make sure no nearby ships notice your approach. The entire reason for bringing you in on this mission is to avoid the diplomatic incident that would arise if a Kemomi ship breached the Neutral Zone, so you don’t wanna anyone to know you’re here - even the local Kemomi patrols. Once that is done, you bring the Lucky Break out of its hyper-jump, leaving you about twenty minutes of sub-light flight away from your destination. Vhaja makes a motion for you to draw near. “Now then, for the most important part of the mission. Please take these data synthesizers. They are specially made to gather information from Spectra I.” A strange device that seems to be comprised of concentric rectangular frames with a brightly colored sphere in the center begins to hover above her hand. “And they are also one of a kind,” says Jyumon. “Or at least, three-of-a-kind. And quite sensitive." (link:"Accept the synthesizer")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1065839654215106680/P28_JyumonVhajaArt_by_Erdjie.png " style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ERDJIE(click-replace: "Art by ERDJIE")[https://www.deviantart.com/erdjie]] “It has bio-gel circuitry, and is powered by tiny, living insects which inhabit the inner frames. Each segment has a different scanning function, and must be set up within a triangulated distance from one another, about a mile apart.” You carefully take the object from her hands and slip it into your bag. Vhaja looks at you sternly. “Please do not lose it, drop it, or delay too long in setting it up. Once properly aligned, the segments will attune to the planet’s thaumic field, but if it runs out of battery before then it will be rendered inert.” “So basically, if we get incapacitated for too long, the mission’s a bust,” you observe. “Exactly. Please distribute the pieces at the proper locations as quickly as possible, and we will perform remote calibrations from orbit on the ship. However, transmission signals must otherwise be kept to an absolute minimum, both because we are not supposed to be here in the first place, but also because they will impact the synthesizer’s calibration settings. The only messages you should send are for each time you reach one of the destinations and set up the device to let us know to begin searching for its data stream. Once you’re finished, rendezvous with Krysta and Lumina at the Knottie camp, then head back to the landing site for extraction.” You nod in understanding. “Got it. So, maintain radio silence except after each successful installation.” At this point, you feel like you’ve gone over everything you needed to. You and Revissa just go over your equipment (and maybe do a bit of light canoodling), until you hear Krysta call out from in front of the helm. “Hey, looks like the planet is coming into view!” (set: $picP28 to true) [[Check it out -> P13]] ] Spectra I looks like - well, a planet. Green landmasses, blue oceans, a perfectly breathable atmosphere. Not that different from Fuwafuwa Prime, or any other habitable, life-supporting world. “So… what’s the big deal?” says Krysta, saying aloud what you were thinking. “Looks pretty boring to me.” Jyumon begins fiddling with the viewscreen controls. “Well, for one thing, the ectoplasmic discharge that builds up in the stratosphere creates a perpetual aurora borealis. At any time of year, any time of day, in any part of the continent, not localized to any particular region.” “Can I see it?” Revissa asks. “Yes, of course.” And with a press of a button, a display of the sky above the landing sight sends shivers down your spine as a kaleidoscopic array of fantastic colors swirls in a constant celestial tango. The display becomes only more vibrant as the ship breaches the planet’s atmosphere, quickly passing through clouds as it descends to the designated landing coordinates. From this high up, the trek to the three targets doesn’t look like it will be that bad at all, but you know from experience how dicey missions can get in the blink of an eye. To your relief, the Lucky Break’s landing struts properly deploy without any additional coaxing, despite not having been serviced since before the end of the war. And they hold their weight as the ship touches ground, giving nothing more than a few protesting creaks as the engines power down. [[Disembark -> P14]]The Lucky Break’s exit is via the loading ramp in the cargo bay, and, like always, the bay doors get stuck as they try to roll down, forcing you to take time to manually pull the emergency override lever to get it moving. Someday you’ll get it properly repaired. Probably. As soon as the ramp lowers, you are struck by a whiff of some of the freshest air you’ve ever breathed, and a dazzling light show twisting in the sky above you. To the west is a thriving, verdant forest, to the east are the ruins of long-gone civilization, and south are towering cliffs that nearly reach the aurora. For a supposedly dead planet, it certainly feels more alive than most industrialized worlds you’ve visited. Though, when you pay closer attention, you do get a sense of… wrongness to the place. You can’t really put a finger on why, because nothing your eyes, ears, or even nose tells you seems incorrect, yet the fur on the end of your tail still stands on end. *Fwump!* Speaking of fur, your oldest friend suddenly sprouts some as she takes in the view. (link:"SQUIRREL!")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1065846731910160444/P29_SquirrelKrystaArt_by_ViciousTrunk.jpg " style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ViciousTrunk(click-replace: "Art by ViciousTrunk")[https://www.deviantart.com/vicioustrunk https://twitter.com/vicioustrunk]] (set: $picP29 to true) You still don’t quite understand the process by which it happened - some kind of ancient magic that ‘unlocks true potential’ or something, but whatever the reason, Krysta now suffers from a ‘curse’ that randomly changes her from Yearthling to Squira. You always knew she was half Kemomi, but it seems the curse activated her recessive genes - and this was the result. While poofy-tailed she is faster and more nimble, and is able to scamper up trees and steep inclines, but is also more skittish and excitable, racing away at the slightest provocation. “Oooh… look at all those high branches!” she yells, eyes darting to the west. She starts to high-tail it over there, but a chiding voice from above calls her back before she gets too far.] |drink1)[(link:"Heaven help us")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1065846732275073084/P30_LuminaArt_by_ViciousTrunk.jpg " style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ViciousTrunk(click-replace: "Art by ViciousTrunk")[https://www.deviantart.com/vicioustrunk https://twitter.com/vicioustrunk]] Though it’s been a few years, Lumina’s heavenly curves haven’t diminished an inch. If she’s gotten rounder since then, it’s been in all the right places. Her wings flutter behind her as she takes to the air, catching Krysta by the scruff and pulling her in the proper direction. “*Our* job is to be diplomats - remember?” “Right! Bondage!” Krysta says, her big, poofy tail swaying wildly behind her. You’re totally not jealous of how much floofier she is than you when she’s like this. Nope. Not at all. She scampers back towards you and smiles. “Alright, time for us to head out! You can find us with all the sexy tentacle-head ladies - just listen for the sound of ropes and leather,” she says with a smirk. For you, bondage is a fun way to pass the time with a girlfriend (or a sexy villain). For Krysta - and for Knotties - it’s a way of life. An art form. You have every confidence she’ll be able to win them over with her skills. And then she’s off in the proper direction. Lumina waves one last time, before soaring after her in the air. Though, before she gets out of sight, Krysta turns and calls out to you. “Make sure to eat that candy!” she yells. Right. The Star Scout Tracking Gumdrop. Apparently it’ll send out a distress signal if you get trapped. You fish around in your pocket, peel off the wrapper, and pop it in your mouth. …and immediately wish you hadn’t. It tastes *rancid*. Does this thing come with an expiration date? Or did Krysta just let it ferment in pickle juice and fish oil? (set: $picP30 to true) [[Spit it out - no amount of safety is worth suffering through this -> P14A]] [[Suck it up and suck it down - you could use the reassurance -> P14B]] ] *Ptooey!* You spit the expired gumdrop out onto the dirt. If you had to guess, Krysta was supposed to keep it refrigerated and just forgot. You don’t even want to imagine what gross things it was rubbing up against in her pocket all this time. Either way, it’s time to get on with your mission. (set: $candy to false) [[Get your bearings -> P15]] (css: "color: red;font-size: 90%" )[**Author’s Note: By selecting this option, you are entering “Bad End Mode”. Without Krysta’s failsafe, if you get yourself captured, trapped, or rendered inanimate, no one will be able to find and rescue you. If you’re not comfortable with the prospect of being stuck forever in whatever perils you might stumble into, go back and choose the other option. This choice otherwise has no impact on the game, and will not offer or take away any exploration paths, artwork opportunities, or content.**]As gross as this thing tastes, you know better than to throw away a lifeline. Though by the stars, you wish Krysta was better at keeping track of these things. If you had to guess, she was supposed to keep it refrigerated and just forgot. You don’t even want to imagine what gross things it was rubbing up against in her pocket all this time. For the next few minutes, your taste buds are assaulted in the most violent ways imaginable, but eventually your saliva manages to dissolve the whole thing. You don’t *feel* any different afterwards, but hopefully your sacrifice will be worth it when it matters most. Either way, it’s time to get on with your mission. (set: $candy to true) [[Get your bearings -> P15]] (css: "color: red;font-size: 90%" )[**Author’s Note: By selecting this option, you are entering “Safety Mode”. With Krysta’s failsafe, even if you get yourself captured, trapped, or rendered inanimate, you will, eventually, be discovered and restored to normal - though it may take a long time, and will almost certainly mean failing your mission. At least, however, you won’t be doomed forever if you mess up. If you prefer permanent Bad Ends for your mistakes, go back and choose the other option. This choice otherwise has no impact on the game, and will not offer or take away any exploration paths, artwork opportunities, or content.**]As you take a moment to take in your surroundings, you see the loading ramp retract behind you, and hear the Lucky Break’s engines start to fire up (with a slight sputter, since it takes the old girl a bit of time to get going). You and Revissa take safe cover being a nearby boulder, then look up as your ship flies high up into the sky, becoming a tiny speck before disappearing entirely. “Welp, guess it’s back to just the two of us,” you say to your darling wife. Revissa smiles, leans in for a kiss, then pulls out her staff. You draw your sword and grin, standing beside her with the ruins to the west looming in the horizon. (link:"Strike a pose")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1065846732820316190/P31_MelfyRevissaArt_by_Erdjie.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ERDJIE(click-replace: "Art by ERDJIE")[https://www.deviantart.com/erdjie]] So this is it - the start of your mission. Until you place one of the three data gathering devices, you’ve been instructed not to contact Vhaja back on the Lucky Break. Based on the map, the sites you need to head towards are within the ruins, deep in the spider forest to the east, and within the cave system to the south. And Krysta has gone off to negotiate with the Knotties at their encampment to the southeast. It’s time to go on an adventure! Where will you head first? (set: $picP31 to true) (set: $ProgressLevelSelect to true) [[Explore the Ruins -> RA01]] [[Plunge into the Spider Forest -> FA01]] [[Delve into the Caverns -> CA01]] [[Check up on Krysta at the Knottie Camp -> KA01]] [[Start Over->A0X]] (css: "color: red;font-size: 90%" )[**Author’s Note: This game is still under development! Currently, there is only content available in the Spider Forest. Please stay tuned for more in future updates!**] ] Under Construction! Hit the back button to return to the place you came from.{ (if: $stagecomplete is '1')[ You bring up a map of the area on your comm device, noting that your next destination is a few hours walk from the landing site. <br /><br /> With one success already under your belt, you’re feeling pretty good. Good enough to tackle what is surely the most difficult task of the adventure - making it through a forest full of spiders. On every planet you visit, there always seems to be something that wants to snag you in webs - be it massive arachnids, adorable moths, or, your favorite, gorgeous ladies with silk-spinning abilities. And while there is no promise there are actually any spiders in the ‘spider forest’ (and if there are, that any of them are hot-lady-shaped) you certainly walk with a spring in your step as you imagine how much fun it will be if there are. ](else-if: $stagecomplete is '2')[ So this is it, the last leg of the adventure. You just need to plant one more data collection device and you’ll be done. It’s been a rough time so far, but you’re feeling confident as you bring up the map of the area on your comm device. Only a few hour’s walk to the outskirts of the forest area. <br /><br /> “Saving the best for last, are we?” says Revissa with a knowing smirk. <br /><br /> You raise an eyebrow at her, but she points to your backside - where your tail has been steadily wagging back and forth. Okay, fine, so it’s true. You’ve always been turned on by the idea of getting tangled up in webs - especially when it’s a gorgeous lady spinning the silk. And while there is no guarantee that the ‘spider forest’ has spiders (or that they are lady-shaped spiders if there are), you won’t deny you kind of hope there will be. ](else: )[Your tail flicks behind you eagerly as you bring up the map of the local area on your comm device. From the landing site, it’s maybe an hour’s walk to reach the edge of the forest area, and then a significantly more difficult trek to get to the location where you need to place the data device. <br /><br /> Revissa rolls her eyes. “Of course you would want to check out the forest first. What, is my shapeshifting not enough to indulge your spider obsession?” <br /><br /> You cough awkwardly, and try to make excuses, but your wagging tail is a dead giveaway. Fine, so it’s true. You have a thing specifically for sexy spider ladies wrapping you up. Is that so wrong? It’s not like there’s any guarantee that the ‘spider forest’ actually has spiders in it, or, if there are, that the spiders come in hot lady form - though you’d be lying if you said you weren’t hoping they were. ]} Fetishistic thoughts aside, the walk to the woods is otherwise uneventful. The aurora gleams brightly overhead, causing your shadows to form gleaming, rainbow-colored silhouettes against the ground as you travel. For a ghost planet, everything feels incredibly alive, beautifully vibrant, delightfully engaging - maybe even supernaturally so. You wonder if this world was so breathtaking before it was destroyed, or if its inexplicable resurrection is responsible for all the wonders you’ve witnessed as you’ve explored it. Either way, the two of you eventually reach the edge of the trees without incident. The forest stretches endlessly ahead of you, the trees climbing high into the air. From a distance, you had thought it must be autumn, because all the leaves were brightly colored, but this close you can see that it’s something far more fantastic. You’re no botanist, but you know enough about nature to be aware that plants feed on sunlight, that chlorophyll in their leaves drinks in solar rays. But the aurora must be somehow filtering the sunlight, changing its properties, which in turn imbues every leaf on every tree with a glittery sheen that refracts into rainbow prisms in pools of light on the ground. It is, to be honest, breathtaking. “I’ve never seen something so beautiful…” says your wife, spellbound, beside you. You give her a roguish smile. “Have you never looked in a mirror?” That gets you an elbow jab between the ribs. Revissa chides you for thinking any mere mortal could outstrip the beauty of the natural world. Looks like chivalry is as dead here as the rest of the planet. Or maybe you just don’t have as much game as you used to - lines like that used to work all the time when you first started dating! However, a soft smile from your wife gives you some validation, as she holds out a hand. And once you take it, she leads you into the trees, her eyes bright and eager to experience the wonders of the forest ahead of you. You wisely decide not to ask her to keep an eye out for gorgeous spider ladies. [[Into the Woods->FA02]] Under Construction! Hit the back button to return to the place you came from.Under Construction! Hit the back button to return to the place you came from.Welcome to The Perils of Spectra I. (if: $ProgressGameStart is true)[[[Start a new game->A0X]]](else: )[[[Start a new game->P01]]] (link:"Save game")[ (if:(save-game:"Slot A"))[ Game saved! ](else: )[ Sorry, I couldn't save your game. ] ] (link-goto: "Resume Game", $lastPassage) Disclaimer: This is a fetish-themed choose-your-own-adventure story that features scenarios and imagery that may be erotic, disturbing, or both. Content includes nudity, sexual themes, non-consenting sexual intercourse, bondage, transformation, and perilous fates. [[How to Play->A01]] [[Image Gallery->AI00]] [[Challenges->A03]] [[About the Setting->A02]] [[Options->A06]] (if: $debug is true)[[[Debug Menu->A05]]](else: )[[[Activate Debug Mode->A04]]] (css: "color: green;font-size: 70%")[Version 0.4]The Perils of Spectra I runs on Twine, a free-to-use interactive story-making program. To advance between story chapters, you simply need to click the blue links, which will either reveal new parts of the current passage or take you to the next one. On occasion, you will have more than one option, giving the story branching paths. Sometimes, the paths will eventually reconvene, but the game ‘remembers’ the choices you made, which might influence future events. It is also possible to encounter ‘Bad Ends’, a series of choices which makes the heroines unable to complete their mission. When you reach Game Over screen, you will either need to retrace your steps with the back arrow (see below), or start the game over to try again. When starting your game over, you can begin from certain checkpoints in the story. This is useful to avoid repeating segments you have already seen, but keep in mind that many branches in the game depend on choices you have made or secrets you have discovered in earlier sections, so jumping right ahead to a checkpoint may lock you out of some secret paths. If you hover over the upper left portion of your screen, a curly white ‘back’ arrow will appear, taking you back to the previous passage. If you do this, any progress made, triggers activated, options chosen, etc, will be ‘forgotten’ by the game. This is important to keep in mind if you are trying to unlock all of the images for the image gallery, available from the main menu. At the bottom of every page is a link to return to the Main Menu. However, if you return to the menu, then resume your current game, your 'back' arrow will take you back to the menu and not the previous passage within the game. There is also a Save Game feature. When choosing to save your game, information about the game’s current state is stored as a cookie in the browser you are using. Make sure that cookies are enabled or you will be unable to save your progress. Your game will automatically load whenever you start it up. Please note that there is only one save file, though thanks to the checkpoint system it should never be too difficult to backtrack to a story segment you enjoy. Unfortunately, there is not currently any way to transfer save files between different computers, devices, or browsers. This means if you change your device you will need to start the game over again. [[Back to the Main Menu->A00]] Welcome to the Image Gallery! Every time you encounter an image in the story, it will be unlocked here for future viewing. Just make sure not to back out using Twine’s previous page function, and instead manually exit back to the main menu. [[Prologue Images->AIP]] [[Ruins Images->AIR]] [[Spider Forest Images->AIF]] [[Caverns Images->AIC]] [[Knottie Camp Images->AIK]] [[Other Images->AIA]] [[Back to Main Menu->A00]]<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1066082999147438232/A03_StarphoriaPoster_by_Dvega.jpg " style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] Starphoria is a universe created by Sekikumo and TheAmberBub, used as a setting for many stories, roleplaying sessions, and tabletop campaigns. It features a galaxy full of magic, technology, and adventure! There are hundreds of different species scattered throughout the worlds of Starphoria, many of them strange, grotesque, monstrous, or even non-organic. However, all humanoid species are purely female in shape and form. Everyone in Starphoria who isn’t a weird slug creature, a rock monster, a robot, or some other unusual critter is a gorgeous woman. And on top of that, those gorgeous women always seem to run afoul of kinky perils. Clothing gets shredded or destroyed at the slightest touch, entire cultures are built around bondage, petrification, or transformation, and most people seem quick to jump into bed with each other without much pretense. It’s a playground for the strange predilections of its authors, and it doesn’t pretend to be anything else. While the history and lore of Starphoria is expansive and ever-evolving, for the purposes of this game, knowing about these factions should be enough to get you up to speed. **The Kemomi Empire** The Kemomi are animal-eared women with the traits of cats, foxes, and wolves, with centuries of inter-breeding making them essentially a single species (though usually with dominant features of one of the three). Within the Empire’s sphere of influence are also the bunny-eared Usami, the aquatic Pescans, and the bushy-tailed Squira. **The Elvaan Federation** Long-eared, lithe-bodied Elvaans are graced with lifespans that are measured in centuries, a fact that often leads to them feeling they are superior to other races. Far from unified, the Federation is a loose coalition among different subraces of the species, which are roughly grouped into the Blanche and Noire. Fiercely hierarchical with a powerful class of nobility, the Elvaans were known for enslaving members of other species or transforming them into decorative statues - especially Kemomi. Tensions over this practice eventually exploded into a bloody, years-long war, which has only recently ended with a tentative truce. **Knotties** A relatively minor species of women on the galactic stage, who have tendril-like growths on their heads instead of hair. Their entire culture is centered around the art of bondage and restraint. **Spider Queens** A race of war-like conquerors, bearing the upper torso of a powerfully built woman, and the lower body of a monstrous spider. The only reason they aren’t a major galactic power is that queens are fiercely territorial and constantly battle each other for supremacy, limiting their ability to mobilize on a scale that can threaten the major powers - though isolated or remote colonies often prove tempting targets for individual queens. **Tsunojians** A species of horned women who were once aggressive and war-like, until they restructured their culture to focus on sports and other non-violent forms of competition. Known for hosting the galaxy’s most intense and elaborate game shows. **The Shackled Sisters** A fanatical cult of Knottie monks who believe the ideal state of existence is to be in permanent, inescapable bondage - and who wish to forcibly ‘convert’ other beings to sharing in that joy. **Star Scouts** A galaxy-wide peace-keeping organization of magical girls. Anyone, from any species can become a Star Scout, so long as they have a pure heart and a desire to do good. "font-size: 60%")[Art by JamminSam(click-replace: "Art by JamminSam")[https://twitter.com/JamminSamArt]] ] (else: )[<img Select the "undo" button at the top right of your page to return to the menu if you do not want to lose all progress in your current game. $ShinySprings is true)[(link:"Complete!")[(show:?PC06)]] |PC06)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1066607984765046824/PC06_HotspringsStoned_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] ] Elf For Your Self *See Vhaja get out-drunk Cangkulretak(click-replace: "Art by Cangkulretak")[https://www.deviantart.com/cangkulretak https://twitter.com/dinnerhaver]] ] Turned-On Elvaan *Let Vhaja reveal her repressed feelings* (if: $VKiss is true)[(link:"Complete!")[(show:?PC08)]] |PC08)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1066607985524228137/PC08_VhajaPlanted_by_Cangkulretak.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Cangkulretak(click-replace: "Art by Cangkulretak")[https://www.deviantart.com/cangkulretak https://twitter.com/dinnerhaver]] ] Prologue Complete! *Unlock all Prologue Pictures* (if: ($picP01 is true) and ($picP11 is true) and ($picP13 is true) and ($picP15 is true) and ($picP18 is true) and ($picP20 is true) and ($picP25 is true) and ($picP27 is true) and ($picP31 is true))[(link:"Complete!")[(show:?PC09)]] |PC09)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1066607987109662751/PC09_StatueParty_by_Kawanmushi.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Kawanmushi(click-replace: "Art by Kawanmushi")[https://www.deviantart.com/kawanmushi https://twitter.com/Kawanmushi]] ] [[Back to the Main Menu->A00]]After only a few minutes of walking, you find yourself totally enmeshed in nature. The trees close in around you, concealing the rest of the planet’s scenery from view. Leaves crunch and crack beneath your feet as you walk, each one letting out little sparks of iridescence as you release whatever energy remains trapped within them after falling from their branches. All around you, you hear the chattering of birds, see the motion of scurrying insects, and can even smell the pollen of blooming flora filling the air around you. It would be easy to forget you’re here for a reason. In fact, for a short while, you do. But eventually you pull out your comm device and bring out a topological map of the area, trying to pick the best way forward. (set: $FBStart to false)(set: $FCStart to false)(set: $FDStart to false) [[Plan your route->FA03]] (set: $foreststart to true) Though Revissa loves nature, she finds maps of it artificial and uninteresting. So as you pore over the readout on your device, she wanders off to inspect some local flora. But you don’t mind - it’s a perfect opportunity to put your wilderness survival skills to the test! You might have gotten rusty cooped up in a spaceship for most of your adult life, but you’ve still got the in-born talent of a kemomi to fall back on. After some deliberation, you pick out three viable trails through the woods. The first is the low road, taking you along the path of a river cutting through a winding ravine. The second is the high road, taking you in a curved arc alongside the trajectory of the steep cliffs that encircle the western reaches of the forest. Finally, you could take the middle road, the shortest in distance, but with no discernible landmarks to follow. You’d basically be wandering blind through the thickest tangle of forest. All the options have their benefits and drawbacks, but after considering from every angle, you make your decision. Revissa really only seems interested in the local plants, so it seems like you’re free to go in whatever direction you want. [[Take the high road->FB01]] [[Take the low road->FC01]] [[Take the middle road->FD01]] [[Take an interest in what Revissa is looking at first->FA04]] (set: $lewdpollen to false)(set: $FBStart to true) In the end, you opt for the high road. It might be the longest of the three choices, but it’s also, in your opinion, the safest. Moving along the side of the cliff will give you a vantage point from which you can overlook the entire forest area, allowing you to spot any obvious signs of danger. Not to mention you can get the lay of the land, and pick out the best route to reach the destination from afar. Maybe even figure out why this place is called the Spider Forest. And so you follow the plan. Heading west, you find a ridge overlooking the area and head across it, always trying to keep to the higher ground. The forest is still thick here, but now whenever you climb a tree you are treated to an amazing view of not just the entire forest, but also the landscape beyond it. You can see the landing site, the scattered tents of the Knottie camp, and the sprawl of ancient ruins just past it. But… still no spiders. Not that you were hoping for spiders, or anything… but at the same time, you are a bit upset at the lack of truth in advertising. Who even named it that, anyway? “Jyumon did,” Revissa informs you when you ask her. “She had a bad experience with a jungle expedition once, and from then onwards just assumed every forest was a Spider Forest.” Fair enough. And in her defense, most forests the galaxy over are teeming with spiders. This one seems to be the exception. Noting your annoyance, Revissa wanders off into the trees for a moment, searching for something. After a while, she calls you over. “There you go!” she says proudly. “Spiders! In the forest!” You follow her finger… and sure enough, there is, indeed, a whole nest of tiny arachnids scurrying about in a dead, hollowed-out tree. Each one is about the size of your fingernail. They’re covered in bright pink fuzz, and seem to have a whole little society built here, more like a colony of ants than anything else. Adorable, to be sure, but nothing sexy about it. Where are the gorgeous spider babes here to wrap you up?! Revissa just rolls her eyes, even though you didn’t say that out loud. You grin sheepishly and motion to a log a few meters away. Good place to take a rest. She agrees, and the two of you sit down and set down your gear. (if: $lewdpollen is true)[And then… you take off more than that. A strange warmth suddenly grips you, and you find yourself peeling off your boots. And your pants. Your shirt, your underwear. What’s happening? Why are you suddenly so… horny? “The pollen from earlier,” Revissa remarks between heavy breaths. “From that flower you disturbed. It must have had… aphrodisiac properties…” Her face flushes as she reaches over and takes your hand. The two of you lock eyes, expressions of desire evident on both of your faces. Triggering that pollen was a mistake to be sure, but… you see no reason whatsoever why you shouldn’t capitalize on that mistake right now.] (if: $lewdpollen is false)[[[Take a load off->FB02]]] (if: $lewdpollen is true)[[[Have some fun->FB03]]] (set: $FCStart to true) After careful consideration, you decide on taking the low road. According to your map, simply following the river’s path will eventually take you a mere half-mile from the destination point, minimizing your chances of getting lost or distracted. And so you head to the side of the river. From one bank to the other it is maybe 30 feet across, though looking over the edge you can see that it gets reasonably deep in places, deep enough that you couldn’t just wade across it. Thankfully, it is flowing at a pretty manageable pace, though sadly your location is upstream from the direction of the current, so you won’t just be able to sail your way there. Either way, you make quite good progress following the river’s meandering trail, deciding to stick to the bank instead of venturing off into the trees. Revissa remarks at all the fascinating plants springing up in the mineral-rich silt at the sides of the stream, happily collecting leaf and seed samples from the ones she finds most interesting and stowing them in her pack. It is, altogether, a rather uneventful journey, though after about an hour of walking you come across something that surprises you. Poking out of a tree is a metal spigot, standing out like a sore thumb in the otherwise pristine environment unmarred by the intervention of civilization. The faucet at the end of the spigot is dripping with the residue of a clear amber liquid, which has piled up in a small puddle at the ground beneath it. An overwhelming sweet, honey-like scent wafts from the liquid, suggesting it’s some kind of tree nectar rich in natural sugars. But what’s it doing here, and who’s collecting it? “I can’t believe it!” Revissa remarks. “This forest is so beautiful! Who would dare spoil it by harvesting its resources?” That is actually an excellent question. Looking around, you do see a path leading through the trees that looks like it was worn down not by local wildlife, but humanoid feet. Has someone made an outpost here? It bears investigating… but poking around could be dangerous if the culprits were smugglers of some sort - not to mention you’d be taking time away from your mission objectives. (if: $lewdpollen is true)[And yet, as you ponder the choice, you can’t help but take notice of your wife. The defiant look in her eyes, the slight curl of annoyance on her lips, the adorable way her little deer tail flicks to the side when she’s upset at something. She’s always the most beautiful when she’s mad. You can’t help yourself but feel massively turned on. In fact, your body is completely gripped by a warmth that defies explanation, and as soon as you register the desire it becomes impossible to ignore, demanding that you act on your impulses immediately. [[Act on your desires->FC01A]] ](else: )[[[Investigate the area->FC02]] [[Continue on with the mission->FC03]]] (set: $FDStart to true) At the end of the day, you’re just here to plant the data device and leave. So the direct route seems the best option for the job. Sure, it’s a thick, impenetrable tangle of trees and foliage, but you’re not some primeval hunter fighting her way through an ancient forest. You come from a galaxy-spanning civilization with access to tech that would be inconceivable to your distant ancestors. Technology like a wrist-mounted comm device that can access the scanners back on the Lucky Break in orbit to display a holographic map of the topography. How could you possibly get lost with something like that? …an hour of walking later, you find out. You were so certain you were heading the right way, yet every time you check the map, it displays your position as farther and farther off course. “Maybe it’s busted,” Revissa suggests after a while. “It’s not busted!” you protest. “See? The location data is updating properly. If there was an uplink error it would tell me!” Your wife shrugs. “Then maybe you’re just bad at reading it.” Your pride does not allow you to even entertain that option. Surely there’s something else at play here. But what? And… even if you knew what it was, what, exactly, are you planning on doing about it? “Let’s just stop and ask for directions,” Revissa eventually suggests. You raise an eyebrow at the absurdity of the statement. “What? I’m a druid, remember? I can talk to plants!” For some reason, some sort of stubborn, primal part of your psyche feels opposed to that plan. You can figure it out, you just need more time! If anything, Revissa is the one being unreasonable, doubting your pathfinding skills! Surely you’ll reach your destination eventually. The forest isn’t *that* big! Though… maybe she would be happier with you if you just went along with her idea anyway. Wives can be like that sometimes. Or you could just give up entirely and head back the way you came in defeat. (if: $lewdpollen is true)[And… come to think about it. All of this walking has made you surprisingly… hot and bothered. In fact, just looking at your gorgeous wife makes you bite your lower lip in desire. Maybe what everyone needs right now is a bit of… relaxation. [[Kiss and make up->FD05]] ](else: )[ [[Keep stubbornly pressing on->FD02]] [[Give up and retrace your steps->FD03]] [[Let Revissa ask for directions->FD04]] ] The adventure can wait. Revissa is clearly interested in the local plants, and she deserves the chance to investigate them to her heart’s content. What kind of wife would you be if you pulled her away from that? Especially considering how much she has given up, living with you in a cramped, broken-down starship. She’s a student of nature, an animist, a druid, someone who loves the outdoors even more than you do - and, given her life’s history, has considerably more first-hand experience living in it. And so, in deference to this, you don’t interrupt her as she studies the fantastical flora of this strange world. Instead, you just quietly walk up beside her, laying a gentle hand on her shoulder as she looks into the bulb of some sort of pink-ish colored blossom. “What’cha lookin’ at?” you begin to say, but you don’t even get two syllables in before the unexpected pressure of your hand causes Revissa to yelp in surprise! You should have known better. Despite all her training and experience, she still has the instincts of a deer - a prey animal. She practically leaps into the air from your startling presence, losing all concentration over whatever ritual she was conducting with the plant. As a result, the bulbous bulb opens and lets out a pungent puff of pollen, filling the air around the two of you and making you both sneeze. And so, your only reward for trying to be a conscientious and accommodating spouse is a dirty look and a painful jab in the shin with the butt of her staff. Chivalry really *is* dead. In no further mood to talk, she just sullenly follows after you as you proceed with your adventure. As before, there are three paths before you. (set: $lewdpollen to true) [[Take the high road->FB01]] [[Take the low road->FC01]] [[Take the middle road->FD01]] You take a deep breath, enjoying the crisp freshness of the clear forest air. It seems even cleaner this high up, perhaps fortified by some winds blowing in from the cliffs up above. Revissa seems happy as well, even going so far to shrug off her clothing and stand naked amongst the trees, drinking in the beauty of the world around her. Though if you’re being perfectly honest, the most beautiful thing here is her. Your heart races as you watch the wind flick her long hair braid around behind her, and an errant beam of sunlight filters through the trees to highlight the ritual tattoos on her gorgeous body. It’s all so perfect… but you can think of a way to make it even better… [[Pounce on her and have some kinky forest fun->FB02A]] [[Sit back and enjoy the show->FB02B]] Despite being the predator among the two of you, it is often Revissa who makes the first move in situations like this. But today, you’re feeling guilty for messing up her flower studies, so you decide your lovely wife deserves a treat. A treat in the form of you pouncing on her and rolling her onto her back, pressing up against her as you press her with kisses. (if: $candy is false)[[[Hang Around->FB02X]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Hang Around->FB02BY]]] ]Your plan agreed upon, the two of you split up. You fall prone and begin crawling along the edge of the cliff, waiting for an opportunity to slide down back to the forest. And behind you, Revissa makes use of shapeshifting magic to transform. “Oook! Grak-grak-grak — ook! Ook!” comes a screeching voice from where you left. Over your shoulder, you see Revissa has morphed herself into a bright green chimpanzee, hooting and hollering and rolling around while screeching wildly. Despite it being your own plan, you still flatten your ears against your head in annoyance at the sound. But it does seem to do the trick. Both spider-ladies immediately pick up on the noise and sling themselves up to the cliff area to investigate, giving you the chance to climb down in their wake. “What is this thing?” one of the spider women asks. “I don’t know - other than that it’s annoying!” says the other. So far, so good. You make excellent progress, quietly slinking to your pack. All you need to do is scoop everything up and get out of here, and you and Revissa can meet up later. At least… that’s what you hoped. “Well whatever it is, I’m going to shut it up!” You hear the *thwap* of silk firing from spinnerets, followed by something slamming against a rock wall. And then Revissa’s surprised voice groaning in pain. “Woah - it turned into a cutie!” “Well… don’t just stand there! Wrap her up!” Crap crap crap! You scramble to pick up your things, even as you can hear Revissa being made short work of as silk spins around her. It looks like you’re going to need to rescue her! But at least you’ve got your gear now– *Splort* You get slammed to the ground as a sticky glob of webbing gloms onto your back. Not good! For a few moments you flail about lamely, trying to get free… before a many-legged shadow looms above you. “Found another cutie!” a spider-woman announces, as she presses down against your body. The subsequent attempt to spin around and face her is met with more pressure, pinning you in place. Followed by spindly legs picking you up and starting to twirl you round and round. In the space of a few seconds, your limbs are pressed tightly against your body, and your skin vanishes beneath the tight embrace of reams of expertly woven webbing, stretching from your feet all the way to your lips. [[Reunite with your wife->FB02BD]] ] Your plan agreed upon, the two of you split up. You fall prone and begin crawling along the edge of the cliff, waiting for an opportunity to slide down back to the forest. And behind you, Revissa makes use of shapeshifting magic to transform. Suddenly, your eyes become assaulted by a dazzling brilliance. Something has begun shining like a beacon, forcing you to squint and hold your hand in front of your face to look over your shoulder. Behind you, you see that Revissa has changed herself into a solar phoenix-wren, a tiny bird with feathers coated with ultra-reflective gloss that magnifies the intensity of the sun tenfold as a defensive mechanism. It’s so bright you can barely see where you’re going as you shimmy towards the end of the ledge. But it does seem to do the trick. Both spider-ladies immediately notice the lightshow and sling themselves up to the cliff area to investigate, giving you the chance to climb down in their wake. “Gah! What the heck is that thing!” one of them asks. “I don’t know, other than it’s blinding me!” says the other. So far, so good. You make excellent progress, quietly slinking towards your pack. All you need to do is scoop everything up and get out of here, and you and Revissa can meet up later. At least… that’s what you hope. “Well whatever it is, I’m going to wrap it up!” You hear the *thwap* of silk firing from spinnerets, followed by globs of silk slamming against a rock wall. “Did you get it?” “I… I don’t know! I can barely see a damn thing!” More sounds of inexpertly aimed web snares missing their target echo through the forest, allowing you to get to your pile of gear unmolested. But as you start scooping things up, a thought occurs to you. If the equipment were to all vanish, the spider-ladies would obviously notice and realize their prey had escaped. But what if you were to leave the most obvious stuff behind? After all, replacement clothing and weapons could be manifested using the molecular recombiner capsules Jyumon gave you. Though that would mean you wouldn’t have access to those capsules if you needed them later. (link: "Leave the gear and replace it later")[ (set: $takeclothes to false) (go-to: "FB06") ] (link: "Take everything with you")[ (set: $takeclothes to true) (go-to: "FB06") ] (if: $placeholder is true)[[[Go to->FB06]]]Your plan agreed upon, the two of you split up. You fall prone and begin crawling along the edge of the cliff, waiting for an opportunity to slide down back to the forest. And behind you, Revissa makes use of shapeshifting magic to transform. A terrible smell begins to waft towards you on the breeze. Looking over your shoulder, you see that Revissa has transformed into a giant subterranean stink-mole, known across the galaxy for their particularly pungent aroma. It’s all you can do not to gag and give away your position as you clamp down tightly on your nose. But it does seem to do the trick. Both spider-ladies immediately notice the smell and sling themselves up to the cliff area to investigate, giving you the chance to climb down in their wake. “What is that smell?” one of the spider women asks. “Is it coming from this thing? What is it?” “I don’t know - other than that it smells… amazing!” says the other. Well… that was unexpected. But every nose is different, you suppose. Moving forward as quickly as possible, you quietly start slinking towards your pack. All you need to do is scoop everything up and get out of here, and you and Revissa can meet up later. At least… that’s what you hoped. “Well whatever it is, we definitely need to bring it back with us! I’m gonna catch it!” You hear the *thwap* of silk firing from spinnerets, followed by something slamming against a rock wall. [[Reunite with your wife->FB02BD]] ] (if: $takeclothes is true)[You quickly gather up your gear and run off, leaving the two chattering spider-women behind. After a while you reach the agreed upon point, and shortly thereafter Revissa appears, having (hopefully) given them the slip. You hand her back her equipment and you both get dressed quickly.](if: $takeclothes is false)[You decide to ditch the gear to leave as evidence to throw the spider-ladies off your trail, running off into the forest. After a while you reach the agreed upon point, and shortly thereafter Revissa appears, having (hopefully) given your pursuers the slip. With a flick of your wrist, you activate the molecular recombiners, providing you both a spare set of clothing and weapons, though in so doing your supply of them is substantially decreased. But at least you’ve got clothing again now.] “Well, that was close,” you whisper, keeping your voice low in case the women are still on the prowl. Revissa just nods as she adjusts her scarf and gives her staff a few practice swings. Now that you have a moment to yourself, you check the map readout on your comm device. Not too much farther to the forest’s center. But now you’ve seen that those spider ladies prowl the clifftop area. Trying to get further using this path might attract them towards you. Perhaps it would be better to double back to the entrance to the forest and try taking a different route. When you voice your concerns to Revissa, she says she’ll follow you whichever choice you make. [[Double back to the start->FB06A]] [[Keep pressing forward->FB06B]] The spider ladies do come back the next day. And the day after that. And the next one, too. Over the next few years, they visit you religiously, making it part of their daily routine to grope and fondle you to their heart’s content. With nothing else to keep you occupied, it becomes the highlight of your day, the only distraction from the tedium of being a web-wrapped damsel hidden away from all prying eyes. You never manage to escape. The webs are too tight, too well-woven. Towards the beginning you would spend hours, thrashing and squirming, but despite your strength you never made so much as a single tear. After the first few weeks, you stop trying. The only small consolation is that the ‘ghost matter’ properties described in your briefing seem to apply to the webbing used to restrain you. You never feel hungry or thirsty, despite being left alone for, sometimes, days on end, and, as the months give way to years, and then centuries, you never age a day. No rescue ever comes for you. You have no idea what happened to Vhaja and the rest of your crew. It’s entirely possible they were also captured by spider ladies, or by something else on the planet. Or maybe they spent some time looking for you but eventually were forced to leave. Either way, it leaves the two of you here, as nothing but helpless playthings to be enjoyed by your captors. And here is where you will spend the rest of your life, never knowing the taste of freedom again. GAME OVER [[Start Over->A0X]]The spider ladies do come back the next day. And the day after that. And the next one, too. Over the next few weeks, they visit you religiously, making it part of their daily routine to grope and fondle you to their heart’s content. With nothing else to keep you occupied, it becomes the highlight of your day, the only distraction from the tedium of being a web-wrapped damsel hidden away from all prying eyes. You never manage to escape. The webs are too tight, too well-woven. Towards the beginning you would spend hours, thrashing and squirming, but despite your strength you never make so much as a single tear. After the first few days, you stop trying. The only small consolation is that the ‘ghost matter’ properties described in your briefing seem to apply to the webbing used to restrain you. You never feel hungry or thirsty, despite being left alone for, sometimes, days on end. It’s only thanks to the Star Scout tracking beacon that help ever comes for you. One day, shortly after your daily groping session, you hear a rustling from the ground beneath you, as Krysta scurries up and slices away the webbing tethering you in place. Then she and Lumina carry you back to your ship, parked on a nearby rock outcropping. They make it in just as the spider ladies return, and narrowly avoid getting captured themselves. Sadly, there was no time to recover the data collection devices, and so the research mission is a bust. But at least you escaped with your freedom. Maybe next time, you won’t wish so hard for a steamy encounter with a sexy spider lady. Because while you got your wish, it came at the expense of the mission’s success. GAME OVER [[Start Over->A0X]]It’s clear these women are attempting to capture you - which means there’s no option but to fight! Watching the spider lady drop through the air towards you, your hand reaches for the blaster pistol at your side. Though you’re better in melee than at range, you get the sense this lady isn’t going to give you the chance to close the distance to her. Unfortunately, she’s moving too fast for you to get a good bead on her either. Maybe it’s a shot Krysta could have pulled off, but your aim has never been anywhere near as good as hers. The blaster’s energy discharge goes wide, leaving scorching holes in a nearb tree and causing birds to flutter away in a chorus of wingbeats. Plenty of damage done - but not to your target. That missed opportunity proves to be the last one you get. As she lands, her back legs twitch, sending out a half-dozen lines of webbing hurtling towards you with far better precision than you had just shown. One catches your wrist, glomming up the gun in your hand, and another strikes your face, locking your lips beneath a layer of warm webbing. A third wraps around your waist, giving your opponent a perfect piece of leverage to yank you into her waiting grip. Thrown off balance, all you can do is make a surprised ‘mmph’ sound as the lady uses the sharp points of her legs as a knife to slice away every inch of your clothing. You try to squirm from her grip, but she doesn’t let you keep your balance long enough to accomplish much of anything. Instead, she just starts spinning you round and round, winding layers of warm, wet silk over your defenseless body. And by the time the dizziness abates, you find yourself totally wrapped from your feet to just below your nose. (link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1083448751529660576/F04_MelfyWebbed1_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF04 to true) “Gotcha!” the spider lady says brightly, leaning in to give you a quick kiss on the cheek. You can do nothing but squirm helplessly in her grip. Sensing her prey is thoroughly restrained, she gives you one last friendly squeeze on the rump then slings you over her shoulder, heading back up to the cliff face she descended from. [[Reunite with your wife->FB02BD]] ] Revissa’s been snagged, and you don’t know the first thing about these women’s offensive capabilities. As embarrassing as it is to admit, your best choice is to make a run for it. Once you’ve put some distance between them, maybe you can find a way to sneak up on them and regain the advantage. It’s not the best plan, but it’s the only one you’ve got. Leaving your rest spot behind, you rush into the trees, not even bothering to look back as you plunge recklessly into the forest. Right now, the most important thing is to just not get caught yourself. Only once you’re sure you’re safe can you figure out where to go from there. You duck under branches, leap through bushes, and barrel past confused wildlife, making a lot of noise, but hopefully going fast enough that your pursuer won’t be able to follow. Though, after a while, you slow your steps and proceed with more caution, doing your best to cover your tracks and thoroughly give the spider-lady the slip. In the back of your mind, you realize in your haste you’ve also completely lost your bearings, meaning that getting back to where Revissa was is going to be a huge pain. Luckily, you still have the map on your comm device - but as you glance down at it, the readings don’t seem to make any sense. Have you gotten even more lost than you thought? Or is there something supernatural at play here messing with your navigation? Maybe you’d have a better chance of understanding it if you’d explored this part of the forest before rushing blindly though it. Either way, you finally decide you’ve gone far enough, and slump down against the trunk of a tree to catch your breath. Your heart is pounding, pulse racing, body both tense and exhausted from the chase. And now that you finally have a moment to close your eyes and think, you have the time to regret abandoning your wife to whatever fate those dangerous (though also undeniably sexy) spider ladies have for her. Were you wrong? Should you have stood and fought? What if you never see her again? You might have been plagued by self-doubt for much longer than that, but thankfully, the next few minutes leave the point moot. Because as you lay there, trying to calm yourself, you suddenly feel a pressure on the back of your head, a hand pulling you forward so that your lips meet a woman’s tender kiss. “Mmmph?” Opening your eyes, you see the spider lady who was chasing you suspended upside down on a length of webbing. Instantly, you try to pull away, but several globs of webbing rain down to restrain your ankles and wrists against the tree behind you. This gives her the chance to enjoy every instant of her long, passionate kiss, saliva dripping from her mouth as she finally pulls away. You look up at her with terror and confusion, but she just smiles and pokes your nose. “I figured you deserved a little reward for giving me such a good workout,” she says brightly. “But now, let’s get you wrapped up and back together with your cute little friend.” Stuck and exhausted, you are unable to put up anything even resembling a fight. A slash from the sharp point of one of her back legs cuts away your clothing, then a gentle spin from her humanoid arms sends you whirling round and round as the silk emerging from her body coils you up nice and tight. Soon you’re bundled up completely, from the feet to just below the nose, bound, gagged, and totally at your pursuer’s mercy. [[Reunite with your wife->FB02BD]] ] You quickly take stock of the situation. They were able to snag Revissa and pull her in from several yards away, hoisting her easily through the air. That suggests they are both physically strong and dangerously accurate with their web shooters. Which means fighting is a dangerous proposition - but running is too. More likely than not, all you’d manage to do is tire yourself out before getting overpowered and wrapped up anyway. Better, then, to try the diplomatic solution. You’ve always thought of yourself as having something of a silver tongue. Or, at least, a tongue good enough at other things that women who have you at their mercy decide to let their guards down around you. Hopefully you’ll be able to maintain that streak of luck. As the spider woman drops down in front of you, you make a motion of raising your hands above your head, trying to communicate non-violent intent. “Now hold on… let’s just talk this out,” you say to the lady as she lands about twenty feet away from where you’re standing. She tilts her head to the side. “Oh? And what exactly do we have to talk about?” “Well… rather than just kidnapping both of us straight away, don’t you think you should find out who we are and why we’re here?” The lady considers for a moment. “I suppose so. But I want some assurance you won’t try to pull one over on me while we chat. Toss away your weapons.” Your body tenses. Without weapons, you’ll be at a severe disadvantage. But you were already at that point anyway. Might as well fully commit to talking things over. With a nod, you pull your sword from your back and your blaster from its holster, and throw both off to the side. “Hmm… but how do I know you’re not hiding something else on you? I think you’d better strip down entirely.” You suppress the urge to smile. This is actually exactly what you wanted. Once she sees how fit and sexy you are, she’ll probably want to get intimate. And if she’s getting intimate, she’s letting down her guard. A perfect opportunity for you to get the drop on her. Or, worst case scenario, at least she’ll take a liking to you. And so, with careful movements, you begin peeling off your clothes. Boots and pants, cape and shirt. You make a bit of a show out of it, swaying your hips and flexing your muscles to really give her a sense of what you’ve got to offer. And from the looks in her eyes, she likes what she sees. Once you finally wiggle out of your panties and drop them to the floor, you cock an eyebrow in her direction, letting her dictate the next move. “Now then… walk towards me. Slowly. No sudden moves.” Excellent. Looks like she’s eager to sample the goods after all. You do as you’re told, swishing your tail enticingly as you slowly draw near. Her eyes never leave your body as you advance. “Now then,” she says as you stop right in front of her. “Hold perfectly still.” From this distance, you can see that she is a bit shorter than you, at least in terms of her humanoid frame, but she can still tower over you when she uses her back legs to lift herself up. She does just that as she casts an appraising eye over your naked body. “Yes… you’ll make a lovely toy…” she says, leaning her face in close. You don’t resist as her lips meet yours and you share a long, greedy kiss with her. “Oh… I can do much more than be a toy,” you say with a smirk when she pulls away. She smirks as well. “Maybe so… but a toy is all I want you for.” And then everything becomes a blur. You feel her tackle you to the ground. You feel your wrists get snagged by silk, then your arms forced behind your back. The ground pulls away from your legs as your body spins round and round, faster than your mind can keep up with. A glob of silk forced over your lips, and a taut cocoon woven expertly around your naked form. By the time she lets you go, webbing has covered your figure from the tips of your feet to just below the nose, leaving you completely bound and entirely at her mercy. She just chuckles and gives you an affectionate squeeze on the butt, before hoisting your wiggling body up and slinging it over a shoulder. Then with a graceful leap, she slings back towards the cliff face, her new package in tow. [[Reunite with your wife->FB02BD]] ] You don’t know what’s come over you. It had started as a tiny ember of desire, but as you walked it has grown and grown, until it’s fully progressed into a raging inferno. You can’t hold it back any longer - your needs simply must be satisfied! Luckily, Revissa seems just as on board with the plan as you are. But mostly they just serve as a distraction from you getting what you want, so you solve the problem by covering her lips with your own. (link:"Kiiissss")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1083283948748144660/F03_MelfyRevissaLoving2_by_KrimsonKarma.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by KrimsonKarma(click-replace: "Art by KrimsonKarma")[https://twitter.com/hentaikarma https://www.deviantart.com/krimsonkarma]] (set: $picF03 to true) She makes no protest as your bodies become one, your cries of euphoria echoing between the forest trees. It is a moment of pure passion, of deepest desires fulfilled, of raw ecstasy, of absolute pleasure, and the two of you lose yourselves in each other’s embrace for what feels like hours. But eventually, the effect of the pollen begins to wear off, allowing your senses to return - which is when Revissa notices something amiss. “We’re being watched,” she says. You humor her by looking around, but all you see is more forest. But from the way she’s suddenly become tense, you can tell this isn’t something she’s just going to drop. Which means, regrettably, no post love-making cuddles in your immediate future. “There!” she says, pointing at a neary tree. You raise an eyebrow. As far as you can tell, there isn’t anything unusual about it. “Ugh, you wouldn’t understand. But I can tell that it’s watching us. And I’m going to ask it what it wants.” A hoarse, craggly voice suddenly cuts through the quiet of the forest, as apertures open in the tree’s bark in rough approximation of eyes and a mouth. “No need to ask,” the tree says. “Besides… I’ve already gotten what I want. What a lovely show that was. I haven’t seen such passion in years!” You’re not prone to embarrassment, but your cheeks still color at the realization someone had been watching your raunchy love-making session. You cough awkwardly, then glance towards Revissa, who seems just as tense as ever, even though her mysterious audience has been revealed. [[Bark up the wrong tree->FD05A]] ] (if: $forestfae is true)[ After the incident with the fae, Revissa seems less upset with you than she had been previously over getting lost. It’s entirely possible the mysterious trickster had a hand in it. At the very least, you’re not entirely to blame. Though it doesn’t change the fact you still have no idea where to go. This time, however, you and Revissa work together as a team to try and pick your way though, with you keeping an eye glued to your comm’s map display while she picks out signs from the natural world around you. ](else-if: $predstory is true)[ Armed with the knowledge from Revissa’s story, you push forward even more stubbornly than before, heading in the direction you think to be north, even when the map on your comm tells you that you’ve been turned around. If there’s some kind of psychic monster trying to trip you up, you’re not going going to give it the time of day. Eventually you stop looking at the map entirely, relying on nothing more than your innate sense of direction to help you advance. ](else-if: $faewin is true)[ You’re not going to back out now - not after you fought so hard against the mysterious trickster to get this far. And so, you lead Revissa deeper into the woods, trying your best to navigate towards the destination on your map. But once again, try as you might, the readings you are viewing on the comm screen and the surroundings you see with your eyes don’t add up. Is that woman still messing with you? Or is there something else in this forest trying to misdirect you. That thought weighs heavily on your mind as you keep stubbornly pushing forward. ](else: )[ Revissa is obviously annoyed at you for ignoring her perfectly reasonable solution to the problem, but she doesn’t protest all that much. Maybe just because she realizes your pride has been wounded. She’s mature enough to let *you* be immature without much fuss. Which… only makes you feel more frustrated, which in turn makes you push forward all the more brazenly. You really want to prove to her you know what you’re doing. ] Unfortunately, after another hour, you still haven’t made any progress. Nothing you do seems to work, almost as if the forest itself has willed itself to resist understanding. Your annoyance grows, and a voice in the back of your head says you need to stop and reassess the situation, but you tell yourself you’ll pause after you circle around the next thich tangle of trees. Which is when you feel the ground give out from beneath you. A sickening *splort* fills your ears as your feet sink into the earth, your legs suddenly enmeshed in gooey, viscous liquid. Looking around, you find that somehow you have walked right into the center of a pit of sticky black tar, laying in a pool smack dab in the middle of a wide clearing. How you got that far into it before you started sinking defies explanation, but the fact remains that you are here. “Ack… what is this stuff!” Revissa yells, stuck right alongside you. Maybe sticking close together wasn’t such a good call, because now both you and your wife find yourselves buried past your shins in gooey tar. Trying to lift your legs only results in the sticky mire snapping you back down in place, making you sink down even further. “I think I’m stuck…” you murmur, your strength useless in pulling you free. You turn to Revissa. “What about you? Can you think of any magic that can help” “Maybe if I transform into a bird, I can flutter out of here,” your wife suggests. “Then I can find something to help you.” You nod in agreement at the plan, even as the suction from the swamp pulls you down past the knees. Revissa closes her eyes, raising her staff as high as she can while chanting the spell to change her form. But then… something beneath you reacts. An unnatural suction force tugs powerfully at your bodies, ripping her staff from her hands and drawing it deep into the muck beneath you. Both of your clothes are taken with it, as you sink all the way down to your waists. “What the heck was that?” you yell. “I… don’t know,” Revissa says grimly. “This must be something more than a mere swamp. It has… a consciousness to it, a willpower. And… it wants us inside of it.” Well that’s not good news. Looking around, you find that the wave of suction pulled loose an overhanging vine from a nearby tree, giving you something to hold on to. You motion for Revissa to grab onto your arm as you tug… but then, as the end of the vine falls into the mire, that same suction force pulls down and snaps it apart. (link:"Glorp")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1084213961081225326/F12_MelfyReivssaSink_by_FrostSandshifter.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;"> (css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by FrostSandshifter(click-replace: "Art by FrostSandshifter")[https://www.deviantart.com/shiftingsandman https://twitter.com/FSandshifter - Account Defunct]] (set: $picF12 to true) Naked and half-submerged, the two of you are running out of options. How can you get yourselves out of this mess? [[Call for help->FD02A]] [[Use the broken vine like a lasso->FD02B]] [[Sacrifice yourself to boost Revissa out->FD02C]] ] “Forget it!” you snap irritably. “It’s clearly impossible! Maybe it’s… magical, or cursed, or something!” Revissa raises an eyebrow. “Well, asking the plants would confirm it, if that’s what you think.” You wave her away. You don’t want to talk to any plants. You just want to double back and start over, maybe pick a different path this time. Clearly this one isn’t working out. Revissa simply shrugs in resignation, following after you as you try to retrace your steps. A tense half hour passes as you try to return to the spot where you started, and, interestingly, when moving away from the forest’s center you actually seem able to maintain your bearings. Almost as if there really *was* something supernatural at play confounding your navigation. Revissa eventually chimes in with a thought. “Actually… I’ve heard about something similar to this before. During my time in the Bolg Resistance, some guerrillas that specialized in deep forest missions would report getting lost - even in locations they should have known like the back of their hands. It turned out there was some kind of predator that sent out a sort of … psychic pulse that confused their pathfinding skills and led them into traps. Maybe there’s something similar happening here as well.” You consider that information thoughtfully. On the one hand, if that’s what’s going on here, it would exonerate your lack of directional awareness - so long as you found some way to overcome it. On the other, at this point you’ve been wandering aimlessly for hours, so it might just be best to cut your losses. [[Turn around and try again to get through->FD03A]] [[Keep heading back to the start->FD03B]] You pout and you fume, but eventually you have no choice but to admit that Revissa is right. Unfortunately, all you’ve managed to accomplish in the past hour is prove your wilderness skills are not up to stuff - aided by modern technology or not. Deflated, you nod and ask her to go through with the ritual. Revissa smiles in that infuriating way where she is pretending not to be pleased with this development, but quite obviously is. Which on the surface suggests she is trying to preserve your wounded pride, but in truth is an even more subtle jab at your ego, because she *knows* you know what she is thinking, and she *knows* you’d be much less ticked off if she gloated about being right rather than just letting you stew in your own failure. Love is… complicated in that way. Because it doesn’t make you angry. It just makes you start thinking about how you might get back at her later. An effort you know is futile, since any time you start a feud Revissa ends up winning it - for no better reason than she knows you’re hornier than she is, so the denial of sex is always an ultimatum that you have no choice but to surrender to. To be honest, that’s part of what makes you love her so much. There’s something incredibly sexy about a woman who can play you like a fiddle. Either way, now that the die has been cast, all you can do is plop down on the floor and watch as she performs her signature nature magic, closing her eyes and spinning her staff to tap into the leylines of nature flowing all around her. It’s not something you can see with your eyes, but your senses are sharp enough that you can still pick up on the changes around you - a susurrus of animal noises, a sharp pang of earthy aroma filling your nostrils, a sort of energy in the air that makes the fur of your tail bristle. When she is done, she directs that nature energy towards a nearby tree, causing the rough bark on its surface to shift into the shape of a vaguely humanoid face. As it slowly opens its eyes, Revissa bows respectfully and delivers a traditional greeting in some ancient druidic tongue. [[Bark up the wrong tree->FD04A]] (if: $forestfae is true)[ You look desperately towards the edge of the tar pit. There’s not anyone nearby that you can see, but you can’t think of anything else that will get you out of this. “Help!” you shout above the sound of bubbling goop. “Anyone!” Your voice echoes between the trees, unanswered. But you *know* there’s someone out there. Watching, waiting. And so, as your body sinks lower with another sickening *splort*, you try again. “I know you can hear me!” you say. “And I know you can help.” Revissa glares at you. “No, absolutely not. We’re not getting tangled up with any fae.” “What other choice do we have?” you plead. “It’s that or sink.” “Then we should sink,” she says firmly. Another tug from the mire, and your arms get sucked under, leaving the two of you submerged halfway past the chest. At this point there’s no way you’re escaping under your own power. But maybe Revissa’s right - better the devil you know, as the saying goes. [[Accept your fate and sink->FD02D]] [[Call out again->FD06]] ](else: )[ You look desperately towards the edge of the tar pit. There’s not anyone nearby that you can see, but you can’t think of anything else that will get you out of this. “Help!” you shout above the sound of bubbling goop. “Anyone!” Your voice echoes between the trees, but you get no answer. Why did you think you would? And before you get the chance to try out any other ideas, another pull of suction tugs to downwards once more, forcing both your and Revissa’s arms beneath the surface. Now buried halfway past your chests, you are unable to work up the strength to free your limbs against the powerful grip of the mire. At this point, there’s nothing left you can do but [[Sink->FD02D]] ](if: $predstory is true)[ If life gives you lemons, you make lemonade, and if a tar pit gives you a broken vine, you turn it into a lasso. Moving quickly, you fashion the leafy rope into a serviceable snare, creating a loop that you’re hopeful will be sturdy enough to support your weight. You know you’re working against time, and you can feel your body dipping further and further into the sludge, but finally, you think you’re ready to give it a toss. But there’s one problem - you don’t see anywhere nearby to anchor it. The vine simply isn’t long enough to catch onto any of the trees outside of the pit… which makes you wonder how it even ended up here in the first place. Maybe Revissa’s right - there’s some kind of consciousness associated with this swamp, and it has a cruel sense of humor. And that’s when it hits you. What was it she had said - the predator she was talking about could disrupt the senses, make you believe something that wasn’t actually real. Well, nothing about this swamp makes any sense. You somehow fell right into its center while walking, never noticing the edges. A vine dropped down from nowhere, even though there wasn’t a nearby tree for it to hang from. The forest itself has been defying your every effort to keep track of where you were going. Nothing about this is natural. So maybe… the solution you need to escape is equally unnatural. [[Escape the swamp->FD02E]] ](else: )[ If life gives you lemons, you make lemonade, and if a tar pit gives you a broken vine, you turn it into a lasso. Moving quickly, you fashion the leafy rope into a serviceable snare, creating a loop that you’re hopeful will be sturdy enough to support your weight. You know you’re working against time, and you can feel your body dipping further and further into the sludge, but finally, you think you’re ready to give it a toss. But there’s one problem - you don’t see anywhere nearby to anchor it.
