It’s both a relief, knowing that your friends escaped the same fate, but also a source of regret. You’ll probably never see any of them again, after all. Eventually, the fae woman tires of you, and she allows one of her visitors to take you home. But to your new owner, you and Revissa have even less emotional significance than you did for the original woman who caught you. And so you end up changing hands many times over the years. Sometimes you’re loved and cherished, kept clean and dust-free in a place of prominence, and other times you’re shoved in a corner, lost in a back room, or forgotten entirely. The one thing you never are is freed. And you never will be. They say diamonds are forever - but apparently glossy statuettes are as well. Next time, maybe you’ll be more careful about accepting help from a fae. GAME OVER [[Start Over->A0X]]The life of a collectable figurine is not particularly eventful. You stand around, you gleam in the light, and you occasionally spark a conversation between one of the rare visitors and your owner. The fae woman seems to regret the fact that she didn’t collect the full set when she had the chance, that only you were foolish enough to stumble into her clutches. It’s both a relief, knowing that your friends escaped the same fate, but also a source of regret. You’ll probably never see any of them again, after all. Eventually, the fae woman tires of you, and she allows one of her visitors to take you home. But to your new owner, you and Revissa have even less emotional significance than you did for the original woman who caught you. And so you end up changing hands many times over the years. Sometimes you’re loved and cherished, kept clean and dust-free in a place of prominence, and other times you’re shoved in a corner, lost in a back room, or forgotten entirely. It’s not until many years later that a retired Star Scout happens to be browsing an estate sale and notices that a pair of glossy figures are somehow transmitting signals corresponding to an old distress frequency. She purchases the items and manages to get the two of you restored - though it’s been hundreds of years since you were first transformed. And so you find yourself stepping into a galaxy that has changed immensely since you were last a part of it. An exciting new adventure, to be sure, but also rather outside the scope of this one. And, of course, it goes without saying, but you failed the mission you were initially hired to complete. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]“Well, if you enjoyed the show, maybe you can give us something in return?” you ask to the tree. “We’re… uh, kind of lost. Do you know the way to this spot on the map?” You bring up the holo-image from your comm device, pointing at the location where you need to deposit the data collection device. “Oh-ho… yes, I could show you the way…” says the tree. “No trouble at all. A fair trade for revitalizing these old roots of mine with your show.” Well, at least something good has come from your mistake earlier with the pollen. You’re about to agree to the trade, but then you get a soft elbow to the side from your wife. With a sigh, you turn to her to see what the issue is. “Something seems wrong…” Revissa says, looking towards you but with eyes darting suspiciously towards the tree. “Weren’t *you* the one who wanted to ask the plants for help?” “Yes… but… ugh, I don’t know. Something just seems wrong to me. I can’t put my finger on it, but I’m getting bad vibes from this whole thing.” Well, bad vibes or no, you still have a mission to do. And after losing several hours to aimless wandering and intense lovemaking, you really should be getting back to it. [[Accept the tree’s guidance->FD05B]] [[Interrogate the tree further->FD05C]] On the one hand, you trust Revissa’s instincts implicitly. If she thinks there’s something fishy here, she’s probably right. But on the other hand, you can’t just turn down the opportunity to get things back on track. Vhaja is counting on you to install these data devices. “Alright… please show us the way,” you ask to the tree. Revissa gives you a disapproving look. You shrug your shoulders apologetically. “Very well…” says the tree, in its creaking, wooden voice. “All you need do is follow the sound of my voice. This portion of the forest can be quite confusing. Your senses cannot always be relied upon. But my voice will ring true, and serve as a beacon.” So there *was* something unnatural about the forest! No wonder you were getting lost. You puff out your chest proudly. If you hadn’t triggered that pollen, the two of you wouldn’t have gotten frisky, and the tree wouldn’t have been there to get you out of this mess. Sometimes the correct choice is to make a bunch of mistakes and get lucky right at the end. Revissa rolls her eyes at you, but you maintain a bounce in your step as you head out into the woods once again. As promised, the helpful tree guides you along the path, helping you overcome the otherwise distracting and disorienting twists and turns of this portion of the forest. And eventually, you get far enough away from whatever the disturbance was that the map on your comm device seems to be working again, allowing you to navigate the rest of the way with your own skills. Before long, you find yourself entering the very deepest part of the woods, a short distance from your destination. (set: $treetalk to true) [[Head inside->FE01]] You haven’t gotten as far as you have in life without trusting in Revissa’s instincts. The mission is obviously important, but *because* it’s important you need to avoid walking yourself into any traps that might trip you up. “Look,” you say to the tree. “I get you’re offering to help, but you’ve gotta see this from our perspective. We’re in unfamiliar territory, and we’ve only just met you. What proof do we have that you’re not, say, just going to lead us right into the grasp of a sexy spider-babe who’ll web us up and carry us away to her love-making nook?” Revissa gives you the stink-eye. You give her a shrug back. Look, you’re still a bit horny, so you can’t be blamed if your thoughts are leaning towards the fetishistic. A low, raspy, grating laugh creaks out from the tree’s ‘mouth’. It’s the sound of wood on wood, a disorienting scraping noise that doesn’t sound the least bit mirthful. “You haven’t been reading ahead, have you?” says the tree. “Picking the obvious Bad End path to get your jollies on before doubling back to try and actually win?” You raise your eyebrow in confusion. You’re not really sure what the tree is saying… but also it almost feels like it's talking to someone else other than you. But who could that be? It’s not like there’s anyone here but yourself and Revissa. But as you spare your wife a glance, you notice she has become even more tense than earlier. She narrows her eyes as she looks at the face etched into the wood in front of you. “We… are not talking to a tree,” she eventually says. “It is… some kind of fey spirit, I have to assume. A trickster, playing a bit of a joke. Making us think it’s a tree as a jape.” Now the caution in her posture makes sense. You haven’t really had much dealing with the fair folk - not exactly your department. Vhaja has before, you know, together with an unlikely companion she had made, the half-fey daughter of the Winter Queen. And you’re pretty sure Revissa has spoken about making deals with fairykind during her days in the Bolg Resistance. But you’ve been fortunate enough to avoid that realm up until now, though even you know that fae are fickle, capricious, and potentially very dangerous “How delightfully droll,” comes a voice. It’s warm and soft and playful, the polar opposite of the sounds that had been emanating from the ‘mouth’ of the tree-face. “Figured it out so soon, did you?” Suddenly, there is a rush of sound, like sparkling firecrackers popping all around you, then a flash of motion as the leaves behind Revissa’s feet swirl in a multi-colored vortex. You back away instinctively, reaching towards your sword, watching as a figure emerges from the storm and claps its hands. A figure that… is oddly familiar. (link:"Behold My Magnifence, Dear Reader")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1092815491233501304/F16_FaeThrone_by_Izra.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Izra(click-replace: "Art by Izra")[https://twitter.com/IZRART https://picarto.tv/IZRA]] (set: $picF16 to true) You recognize the gorgeous woman standing in front of you now. In fact, you were just thinking about her. Skadi, the Winter Witch, the half-fae princess that Vhaja sometimes works with. But… that’s impossible, isn’t it? “The form she is showing is not her true one!” Revissa warns. “She… must be gazing into our memories to construct an image for herself.” The woman who is not Skadi smiles and runs a finger playfully along Revissa’s arm. “And why would you say something like that, my little dear? Or should I say deer? Ho, how clever I can be!” “Because… to me, you look like Un-Rama, the great Guardian Moth, and I know you are not her.” The fey entity throws up her arms. “Guilty as charged! But what’s a little illusion between friends, no? Because… we *are* friends… right?” “That remains to be seen,” Revissa murmurs. “Well, for your sake I hope we are friends. Because you two are lost, and I know the way home.” Suddenly, things start to make sense. Hah! So it wasn’t that you were reading the map poorly. It’s that a trickster spirit was manipulating the terrain around you to make sure you ended up losing your way. There is a pop and not-Skadi is behind you, gently stroking the fluff inside your left ear. “No, my lost little doggie, you got yourself lost all on your own. Though once you *were* lost… I might have bent things around a bit to make sure you stayed that way.” “Why?!” Revissa demands. “Because that way, I can make sure you play my game!” You feel a shiver run down your spine… despite the warm (and not entirely unwelcome) presence of not-Skadi’s bosom compressed against your back. It seems like things have just become very… interesting. [[Find out exactly how interesting->FD05D]] ] “What kind of game?” you ask suspiciously. Revissa kicks you in the shin. “No, don’t even think about playing along. Don’t interact, don’t entertain. Never indulge the whims of a fae, or they’ll just take it as an invitation to keep on bothering you.” “But don’t you worship Un-Rama?” you ask. “She’s a fae spirit.” “She’s different! Un-Rama is a guardian and protector. But this woman… is a trickster. I can tell just by looking at her. She wants nothing more than to lead us into a trap for her own entertainment.” “You wound me!” not-Skadi says, miming being shot through the heart and falling backwards. “And if I wasn’t in such a good mood after watching you two have sex, I’d probably turn you into a frog or something. Which I *could* do, you know. You wouldn’t have any defense against it. Like it or not, I’m much more powerful than either of you, so really it’s in your best interest to entertain me.” You step forward. “Alright… let’s say I did want to entertain you. What’s so special about us that someone as powerful as you has taken an interest?” “Oh, it’s not the *us* so much as the *you*, my darling wolfie. Or actually, your crew. The Rabbit’s Foot Guild! Erm, sorry, wrong universe. The Rabbit’s Foot *Company*, as your merry little band of mercs is called. Right? You’re kind of a big deal. Some might say the biggest deal in this universe.” Okay, now you know she’s pulling your leg. “Big deal? I mean, sure, we had some adventures. Maybe even helped save the galaxy once or twice. But we’re still less famous than the knock-off cartoon series Icewing made based on us” The fae woman giggles. “Ooh, I love you throwing in a reference to the campaign that casual readers wouldn’t recognize. But no, I don’t mean *in-universe* fame, I mean at the meta level. The four of you are probably the most famous characters from this neck of the woods - other than the Demon Queen, I guess.” “By the four of us… you mean me, Krysta, Vhaja, and Lumina?” She claps her hands. “Exactly! Not gonna lie, I’m kind of disappointed you partnered up with the wifey here for the adventure - I prefer classic foursome perils, myself. Which is why, to be perfectly honest, I don’t care for the deer girl - other than as a supporting character in your life. So she really shouldn’t get a say in what happens next in our little tete-a-tete.” Your head is spinning trying to wrap your mind around all of this, but there’s one thing you know for certain. Despite the occasional butting of heads, you love Revissa with all your heart. So you’re not going to just let her be sidelined in this discussion. Instead you’re going to– The fae woman snaps her fingers… and then Revissa is gone. Not teleported, not carried away. Like the frame containing her in the film reel was severed completely. “I’m serious about this,” the woman says, pressing herself up against you. “You’re the main character here, not her. That’s why all the big important, plot-branching decisions always hinge on *your* choices. I mean, seriously, have you noticed that some of the artwork is using older versions of her design? Big pointy ears, no horns, that kind of stuff? What shamelessly lazy production values. Just commission new art if she’s so important, right?” You’re not sure if you want to feel terrified or furious at this woman. Or, to be fair, aroused. She is still incredibly attractive, and her chest is nicely squishing itself against your arm. But whatever she is, it is abundantly clear that she is far too powerful to confront directly. And that you very well might need to play her game if you ever want to see your wife again. (set: $faecycle to 0) [[Play along->FD05E]] [[Run away->FD05DA]] [[Fight her->FD05DB]] [[Seduce her->FD05DC]] (if: $faecycle >5)[You’re not really sure what’s happened. Everything had become a blur, and you felt like you were repeating yourself over and over again, trapped in a never-ending loop. Your head is spinning as you finally bring yourself out of your funk, looking up with bleary eyes towards the fae woman.](else: )[You sigh in defeat. Try as you might, you can’t think of any way to escape this woman’s influence. So as much as it pains you to admit it, your only option is to play along with her game.] “Fine… I guess I have no choice,” you say. “I’ll play your damn game. So what is it you want me to do?” The fae woman throws her hands up into the air theatrically. “Oh, I thought you’d never ask!” She snaps her fingers, and a structure appears with a pop in the center of the clearing you’ve been standing in. It’s some kind of brightly colored, open-air tent, circular in construction with strangely shaped seats arranged around its circumference. You narrow your eyes. “What is this?” “Our game, silly!” You shake your head. “Before we play any games, I want you to tell me what you did with Revissa.” “Oh, but that’s just the thing - she’s already here!” Her eyes dart towards the tent-like structure. You follow where they are looking, and, after a moment of shocked revelation, have to stifle a gasp. (link:"I think she looks cute like this. Don't you, reader?")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1093432336177172610/F18_RevissaGoRound_by_Dreamons.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dreamons(click-replace: "Art by Dreamons")[https://www.deviantart.com/dreamons2]] (set: $picF18 to true) What you thought was a tent was actually an old-timey mechanized merry-go-round, the kind you might find at a carnival, or at Floofyland™. But the seats on the ride are all hybridized female figures, half animal, half person. Revissa, of course, often takes the form of what you lovingly call a deer-taur, a quadrupedal cervid with a humanoid torso. And she’s taking that form now, but her body is stiff and glossy, with a pole through her midsection and a saddle painted onto her back. “Wh… what the hell have you done to her!” you yell, as your arm subconsciously reaches for the sword on your back. The fae woman chuckles. "I’ve done to her something I could just as easily could do to you, if I wanted to. And something I *will* do if your hand gets any closer to that sword.” She vanishes in a puff of smoke, then reappears right beside you, pressing her bosom against your side. “Need I remind you, I control her fate. She’s become a glossy little prop, a background element of your story. And she’ll stay that way unless you agree to play along.” Her voice has become frighteningly ominous, and you can’t help but shiver with anxiety. “Okay… fine. It’s not like I have a choice. I’ll play whatever game you have in mind. But if’s a game, there *are* rules, right? Rules that you’ll follow?” “Of course! I am a woman of my word, after all. The rules are even quite simple. We’re going to have a race! You and I choose a mount, and whichever one makes three laps around the merry-go-round first is the winner!” You narrow your eyes. “And if I win, you’ll restore Revissa and let us go?” “If you win you get a prize,” she says. “Getting your wife back can be that prize, if you wish.” This is why Revissa says not to trust the fae. You can *feel* the way she is arranging her words, deliberately leaving wiggle room in any condition she agrees to. If you were a smarter woman, you would try to parse where in her statement she might trip you up. But you’re no lawyer, and you were never particularly good at riddles. So all you can do is play along and hope your instincts kick in before you fall into one of her semantic traps. But there is at least one thing you can confirm. “Alright… so obviously I’m going to pick Revissa. But I’ll only agree if you play fair. Whichever mount you choose as your racer has to go at the same speed as Revissa does.” “Done!” the fae says quickly. *Too* quickly. If she’s planning on cheating, clearly altering the speed of the racers isn’t how she’s going to do it. But you can’t think of any more obvious hacks she could use. With no other ideas left, you trundle off to the merry-go-round and plop your butt down on Revissa’s smooth, glossy backside - something that requires a bit of maneuvering, given her long hair braid is stiffly protruding behind her, poking into your arm as you try to settle in. Clearly this ride wasn’t built for comfort. You wonder idly if she’s still conscious, if behind that placid smile frozen on her face she’s screaming at you to back out, or trying to tell you about the obvious trick you’re walking right into. But if there are any words on her mind, they don’t escape her lips. All you can do is wrap your arms around her smooth shoulders and hold on, as the ride whirs to life. [[Off to the races->FD06B]] ] (set: $faecycle to it + 1) You’re not going to play this woman’s game. But you know you can’t beat her in a fight, either. Which means the best option is a tactical retreat. You peel away from her and dash into the trees, running as fast as your legs can carry you. And yet, after a minute of effort, the path opens up right back into the clearing you had just fled from. (if: $faecycle is 5)["This is getting old!” the fae woman says, sitting herself down on a nearby tree stump. “You’re just repeating yourself now. Please just pick the first option so we can get on with things.”](else-if: $faecycle is 10)["Really? Ten times now? At this point I have to guess that you’re just wasting your time, trying to see if anything else will change. Well, fine. Do it ten more times and I’ll give you another option.”](else-if: $faecycle is 20)["Wow, you really did it! Okay, there you go, another option, like I promised. Go on, click it. You know you want to!"](else-if: $faecycle >20)[“That’s it for now. No more secret options for being annoying. At least not yet. Come back in the full version and I might have more to say. Now stop wasting time and pick something!”](else: )[“All-powerful fae, remember?” not-Skadi says, finishing the hand motion for the spell that pulled you back here. “Now can we just get on with things?”] [[Play along->FD05E]] [[Fight her->FD05DB]] [[Seduce her->FD05DC]] (if: $faecycle >= 20)[[[Become a collectable action figure->FD05F]]] (set: $faecycle to it + 1) You’re not going to play this woman’s game. It’s a long shot, but maybe if you can get in a lucky hit you might be able to disorient her. Reaching to your belt, you pull out your trusty blaster pistol and take aim, trying to shoot down the branch above the fae woman’s head. However, when the energy bolt leaves the muzzle of your gun, it somehow arcs around and reverses course, dislodging a branch over your *own* head. It strikes your noggin with a painful bump, making you dizzy for a moment. (if: $faecycle is 5)["This is getting old!” the fae woman says, sitting herself down on a nearby tree stump. “You’re just repeating yourself now. Please just pick the first option so we can get on with things.”](else-if: $faecycle is 10)["Really? Ten times now? At this point I have to guess that you’re just wasting your time, trying to see if anything else will change. Well, fine. Do it ten more times and I’ll give you another option.”](else-if: $faecycle is 20)["Wow, you really did it! Okay, there you go, another option, like I promised. Go on, click it. You know you want to!"](else-if: $faecycle >20)[“That’s it for now. No more secret options for being annoying. At least not yet. Come back in the full version and I might have more to say. Now stop wasting time and pick something!”](else: )[“All-powerful fae, remember?” not-Skadi says, finishing the hand motion for the spell that redirected your attack. “Now can we just get on with things?”] [[Play along->FD05E]] [[Run away->FD05DA]] [[Seduce her->FD05DC]] (if: $faecycle >= 20)[[[Become a collectable action figure->FD05F]]] (set: $faecycle to it + 1) You’re not going to play this game. But you’re also not really sure what you can do to beat her. Though maybe you’re thinking about this the wrong way - it’s better to make love, not war, right? So, flashing her your best smile, you prepare to turn up the charm. Except, before you do, you find yourself being swept off your feet. The fae woman takes you in her arms and presses in close, stealing a lusty kiss from your warm, eager lips. (if: $faecycle is 5)["This is getting old!” the fae woman says, sitting herself down on a nearby tree stump. “You’re just repeating yourself now. Please just pick the first option so we can get on with things.”](else-if: $faecycle is 10)["Really? Ten times now? At this point I have to guess that you’re just wasting your time, trying to see if anything else will change. Well, fine. Do it ten more times and I’ll give you another option.”](else-if: $faecycle is 20)["Wow, you really did it! Okay, there you go, another option, like I promised. Go on, click it. You know you want to!"](else-if: $faecycle >20)[“That’s it for now. No more secret options for being annoying. At least not yet. Come back in the full version and I might have more to say. Now stop wasting time and pick something!”](else: )[“All-powerful fae, remember?” not-Skadi says, returning you to your feet. “I know what you’re going to do before you do it. And I assure you, I’m better at seduction than you’ll ever be. Now, can we just get on with things?”] [[Play along->FD05E]] [[Run away->FD05DA]] [[Fight her->FD05DB]] (if: $faecycle >= 20)[[[Become a collectable action figure->FD05F]]] You’re not really sure what’s happened. Everything had become a blur, and you felt like you were repeating yourself over and over again, trapped in a never-ending loop. Your head is spinning as you finally bring yourself out of your funk, looking up with bleary eyes towards the fae woman. “I… what?” you ask weakly. “Yes, yes, I’m sure you’re quite exhausted, being led around in circles by the invisible hand of some higher power. But luckily for you, there’s a light at the end of the tunnel. Or rather, a nice piece of plastic packaging.” Through the fog of memory, you vaguely recall agreeing to something. But… was that you? It must have been… and yet, at the same time, it doesn’t add up. Why would you ask to be– But then the fae woman snaps her fingers, and the world falls out from under you again. Everything spins, the scenery shifts, the world melts away… and now you’re somewhere else. And you’re naked, too. “Hey, what gives!” And you’re not alone. To your surprise, you find Krysta sitting next to you. “I… do not… my mind, my thoughts, so muddled…” Vhaja as well. “This… is… oof… why do I feel so dizzy…” Even Lumina. Just the four of you, you realize. Revissa is still nowhere in sight. Nor is Jyumon. Though your head is throbbing, you remember the fae woman saying something to you… that she didn’t consider your wife a part of the crew. That she liked things when it was just the four of you. Is this an extension of that? Has she kidnapped you all for some sick purpose? “Whatever is going on… it’s clear we have to get out of here,” you say. But where exactly is here? It appears to be… a factory of some kind? You see conveyors belts, assembly lines, machinery of unknown make and purpose. What is this place? And what had the woman said… something about… packaging? There is the sudden sound of rumbling movement, mechanisms whirring to life, and then a metal arm clamps down around your waist. You’re hoisted into the air before you have a chance to resist it, and by the time you regain your bearings you’re already falling. You land with a thud onto the surface of a conveyor belt, pulled onwards towards the interior of a processing booth of some kind. You think about trying to roll off the platform, but are distracted from various cries of distress from beneath you. Looking down, you see the rest of your friends are being ferried around in the same way you were. But just as you prepare yourself to jump down to help them, more metal arms shoot out and clamp down around your wrists and ankles, dragging you through the mouth of the machine. Suddenly there is darkness, as you feel yourself being manipulated. You’re pushed backwards against a solid surface, and feel something jam a gag into your mouth. A muffled grunt of confusion escapes your bound lips as you try to reach and pull it out, but more metal grabbers snap around your limbs and force them into place. You feel restraints loop around you, snagging your ankles, your shins and thighs, then your wrists and elbows, around your waist, your neck, even two pressing in against your tail! Once you’re secured, a blaring light switches on, making you blink in confusion as you see various items getting dragged in next to you. They seem like bits of leather armor, some pants, a metal breastplate, clothing and equipment that you get the sense could fit your body, and seems oddly familiar… yet which you’re sure you’ve never worn before. Each item is snapped in place, before a clear plastic barrier is dragged over and fitted over your body, an aperture in its side cut in the perfect shape to snap around your silhouette. Only after you are finally carted out of the processing booth along the conveyor do you catch your reflection in a piece of machinery, and realize what has been done to you. (link:"Look at you, so collectible! I love it!")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1093436855963361280/F20_MelfyPackaged_by_Ankhrono.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Ankhrono(click-replace: "Art by Ankhrono")[https://www.deviantart.com/ankhrono https://twitter.com/ankhrono]] (set: $picF20 to true) It’s… like you’ve been made up to look like an action figure! Bound up in place, your clothing and weapon and gear slotted neatly into little holes specifically made to contain them. What kind of bizarre trap is this? You wriggle and squirm against the tight bindings, but you are helplessly anchored, unable to find any point of articulation to generate enough force to get free. You feel a pit form in your stomach as you realize how completely powerless you now are. [[Exit the assembly line->FD05FA]] ] (set: $merryround to true)(set: $FDStart to true)(if: $racewin is true)[[[Jump to the end of the race->FD07F]]] Only once the ride starts does it occur to you to ask how, exactly, you’re supposed to have a race on a merry-go-round in the first place. Isn’t the whole thing literally on rails? Your opponent doesn’t seem to mind, however, having settled down on the back of a purple bunny-taur seat that seems oddly familiar to you for some reason. (link:"Her name's Tamara! Say hi, Tamara! Sorry... she's a bit stiff at the moment.")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1093432336445624451/F19_TamaraGoRound_by_Dreamons.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dreamons(click-replace: "Art by Dreamons")[https://www.deviantart.com/dreamons2]] (set: $picF19 to true) She gives you a wave as the ride starts spinning and… her seat starts pulling ahead of yours after a quarter-turn around the center. “What the hell?!” you yell, “you agreed we’d go the same speed!” “Ah, but we are, my deer-riding dear, we are.” In a panic, you inspect the ride more closely. The ‘horses’ are arranged in a circle around the circumference of the central pillar in two concentric rings - an inner and an outer one. Revissa is situated on the one farther from the center, whereas not-Skadi is in the inner circle. You’re no mathematician, but you still grasp the issue. Even if both circles are rotating at the same speed, the inner one has less distance to cross, which means it’s going to start pulling ahead in a relative sense once the ride gets going. A pit forms in your stomach as you realize by demanding both mounts move at the same speed you were actually giving yourself a handicap. Your opponent notices the change on your face and gives you a wink as she happily sails forward. If you don’t do something, you’re going to lose! [[Leap and tackle her off her mount->FD06C]] [[Lasso your mount to hers->FD06D]] [[Jam the ride’s mechanisms->FD06E]] ] Well if the ride is rigged against you, that just means you need to target the rider instead. Perching up on your seat, you spend a moment to calculate your trajectory, then make a diving lunge towards the shapely fae’s body. To be honest, it’s a fairly desperate ploy - which is why it surprises you when it works. You feel soft flesh against your skin as you collide with your opponent, knocking her from her perch and slamming her against the central rotating pillar. Now you have her pinned beneath you, your powerful arms pressed down on her shoulders to prevent her from regaining her position. And yet… she does not seem the least bit perturbed. “Oh… so forward. And here I thought I’d only give you a kiss if you won.” There’s only time for you to blink in confusion before she leans in against you and warmly locks lips. And then… your world falls into a pleasant blur. You have a vague recollection of hands and teeth and exposed nipples on milky white skin, of dark, silken hair swishing against your back, of hands roughly stroking the fur on your ears and tail. It feels like it lasts for an eternity, and yet, at the same time, that it is over too soon. What breaks the reverie is the sound of a victory fanfare blaring from the merry-go-round’s tinny speakers, announcing that a winner has crossed the finish line first. You look at the fae woman in confusion as she lustily strokes the inner fuzz on your ear with a hand. “Oh, silly girl. The rule was whose mount crossed first, not which rider. And since I was ahead when we started, it means I’m still ahead when you’ve finished.” A wicked smile crosses her lips as she stands up. “And you *are* finished, my dear.” And then she snaps her fingers. [[Claim second place->FD07A]] As you fumble for solutions, you get the idea that if Revissa were tightly tethered to the bunny-taur with a strong enough rope, she would essentially get pulled along by the ‘faster’ of the two mounts. But where can you find a sturdy rope on such short notice? Looking around, your eyes rest on the colorful banners flapping in the breeze on the outside of the ride, which are attached to the ‘tent’ portion with some thin wires. Maybe those will do the trick! Careful of the rotation of the ride beneath you, you reach out, grasping hold of a banner and tugging it down. To your satisfaction, it comes loose easily. Then as quick as you are able, you tear off the cloth banner to get to the binding beneath it, giving it a pull to test its strength. It’ll have to do. You’re no cowgirl, but you manage to form a passable loop from the metal cord, and then swing it over your head, taking careful aim. When it’s set loose from your grip, you hold your breath, carefully trying to use your wrist to maneuver it into place - and you’re rewarded by a tug as it finds purchase around the bunny-taur’s neck. Success! After that, it’s a simple process to tie the cord around Revissa’s own glossy midsection, tethering her and the lead rider together. You’re soon rewarded by a heavy creak as the line goes taut, forcing the outer circle to rotate faster to keep up with the inner one. The fae woman shifts in her seat, delicately twanging the cord with a finger. “How clever,” she says with a smile. But she takes no further action to impede your progress. [[Leap and tackle her off her mount->FD06C]] [[Try and pull Revissa ahead with brute strength->FD06G]] [[Jam the ride’s mechanisms->FD06H]] Your mind races for solutions to the problem, and eventually settles on a rather extreme one. If the ride is rigged to ensure Revissa falls behind, then you’ll just have to physically change it so that it doesn’t. The two rows of ‘horses’ are arranged on separate, concentrically rotating circles, so if you could somehow manage to jam up the one containing the fae woman’s mount then yours would be able to get ahead. Leaping from Revissa’s smooth, shiny back, you land on the surface of the ride itself, and pull out your sword from its place at your back. Getting down on all fours, you carefully study the seam between the two rotating circles, finding a spot that looks like it might be vulnerable to tampering. Then you jam the end of your blade into the gap, trying to dig it down as far as it can go to mess with whatever gears are turning beneath the surface. You’re rewarded with an ear-splitting screech as metal grinds against metal, and feel a jolt as half the ride grinds to a halt. The fae woman looks backwards from her position ahead of you, scowling in annoyance. You give her a winning smile back, prompting her to flick her finger upwards. Suddenly, your sword rises up into the air and then sails away into the forest, useless to you for the remainder of the race. The merry-go-round hums back into full operation, chugging along as not-Skadi continues on her merry way. But at least you gained some ground. [[Leap and tackle her off her mount->FD06C]] [[Lasso your mount to hers->FD06F]] [[Try and pull Revissa ahead with brute strength->FD06G]] Somehow, the swampy mire of sticky tar is gone. You’ve been taken back to where you first met the beguiling fae, transported so effortlessly you hadn’t even realized you were being moved. Everything around the clearing looks more or less the same, but now there is a large structure dominating its center. It’s some kind of brightly colored, open-air tent, circular in construction with strangely shaped seats arranged around its circumference. “Hopefully it wasn’t too bumpy a ride?” she asks sweetly. The woman who looks like Skadi sits on a tree stump at the edge of the clearing, crossing and uncrossing her legs alluringly. Your eyes, unbidden, trace the outline of her thighs, and the way her chest rises and falls with each breath. Sure, she’s just picking a woman from your memory to present herself as - but that woman is *hot*. If anything, it would be rude *not* to appreciate the aesthetics, as it were, of the situation. Though perhaps you appreciate them for a bit too long before you realize that something is missing. “Wait… where’s Revissa?” Not-Skadi smiles distantly. “Oh, she’s here. Already all set up for our little game.” Her eyes dart towards the tent-like structure. You follow where they are looking, and, after a moment of shocked revelation, have to stifle a gasp. (link:"Honestly, I quite think this is an improvement for her. Don't you, reader?")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1093432336177172610/F18_RevissaGoRound_by_Dreamons.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dreamons(click-replace: "Art by Dreamons")[https://www.deviantart.com/dreamons2]] (set: $picF18 to true) What you thought was a tent is actually an old-timey mechanized merry-go-round, the kind you might find at a carnival, or at Floofyland™. But the seats on the ride are all hybridized female figures, half animal, half person. Revissa, of course, often takes the form of what you lovingly call a deer-taur, a quadrupedal cervid with a humanoid torso. And she’s taking that form now, but her body is stiff and glossy, with a pole through her midsection and a saddle painted onto her back. “Wh… what the hell have you done to her!” you yell. Your clothing and equipment has all mysteriously returned to your body since the tar pit incident, almost like it was never removed in the first place. But you have more pressing matters on your mind at the time, as your arm subconsciously reaches for the sword on your back. The fae woman chuckles. I’ve done to her something I could just as easily could do to you, if I wanted. And something I *will* do if your hand gets any closer to that sword.” She vanishes in a puff of smoke, then reappears right beside you, pressing her bosom against your side. “Need I remind you, you *agreed* to play my game. So now you don’t get to protest the rules.” You let your hand go limp. “But there *are* rules, right? Rules that you’ll follow?” “Of course! I am a woman of my word, after all. The rules are even quite simple. We’re going to have a race! You and I choose a mount, and whichever one makes three laps around the merry-go-round first is the winner!” You narrow your eyes. “And if I win, you’ll restore Revissa and let us go?” “If you win you get a prize,” she says. “Getting your wife back can be that prize, if you wish.” This is why Revissa says not to trust the fae. You can *feel* the way she is arranging her words, deliberately leaving wiggle room in any condition she agrees to. If you were a smarter woman, you would try to parse where in her statement she might trip you up. But you’re no lawyer, and you were never particularly good at riddles. So all you can do is play along and hope your instincts kick in before you fall into one of her semantic traps. But there is at least one thing you can confirm. “Alright… so obviously I’m going to pick Revissa. But I’ll only agree if you play fair. Whichever mount you choose as your racer has to go at the same speed as Revissa does.” “Done!” the fae says quickly. *Too* quickly. If she’s planning on cheating, clearly altering the speed of the racers isn’t how she’s going to do it. But you can’t think of any more obvious hacks she could use. With no other ideas left, you trundle off to the merry-go-round and plop your butt down on Revissa’s smooth, glossy backside - something that requires a bit of maneuvering, given her long hair braid is stiffly protruding behind her, poking into your arm as you try to settle in. Clearly this ride wasn’t built for comfort. You wonder idly if she’s still conscious, if behind that placid smile frozen on her face she’s screaming at you to back out, or trying to tell you about the obvious trick you’re walking right into. But if there are any words on her mind, they don’t escape her lips. All you can do is wrap your arms around her smooth shoulders and hold on, as the ride whirs to life. [[Off to the races->FD06B]] ] You can do nothing as a loading arm picks up your container and carries you back to the factory floor, setting you down neatly against a wall. And through the plastic shielding in front of you, you can see as your allies are brought in, one by one, captured in identical manners. (link:"I do rather like redheads. Did you know, canonically, in this universe all red-heads are descended from a single common ancestor?")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1093436856433119282/F21_KrystaPackaged_by_Ankhrono.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Ankhrono(click-replace: "Art by Ankhrono")[https://www.deviantart.com/ankhrono https://twitter.com/ankhrono]] (set: $picF21 to true) Krysta is trapped with her arms at her sides, her hands balled up into fists as she tries to squirm against the restraints. Normally she’s a veritable escape artist, but nothing she does seems to loosen her bindings. Her gear is more leather armor, her weapons a pair of shortswords instead of her classic vibra-dagger and ice-blaster pistol.] |drink1)[(link:"Though I'm quite partial to purple as well. But Vhaja's more of a lavendar, wouldn't you say?")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1093436856940638218/F22_VhajaPackaged_by_Ankhrono.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Ankhrono(click-replace: "Art by Ankhrono")[https://www.deviantart.com/ankhrono https://twitter.com/ankhrono]] (set: $picF22 to true) Vhaja comes next, trapped in place with her arms out at her sides. Oddly, she doesn’t have a gag between her lips, something that would normally be a given for a magic-user - but instead she has little straps around each of her fingers, completely immobilizing her hands, preventing her from making any arcane gesture. Her kit is complete with a dark black robe and an actual bow-and-arrow combo, a physical weapon instead of the magical energy arrows she usually forms with her spellcraft.] |drink2)[(link:"By the way, have you noticed the puns on the packaging? I'm quite proud of them.")[(show:?drink3)]] |drink3)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1093436857402003557/F23_LuminaPackaged_by_Ankhrono.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Ankhrono(click-replace: "Art by Ankhrono")[https://www.deviantart.com/ankhrono https://twitter.com/ankhrono]] (set: $picF23 to true) Bringing up the rear is Lumina, her hands bound above her head, her wings spread out and fixed in place like she was a butterfly pinned and mounted to a collector’s display board. The outfit included in her display stand is the same teal-and-gold color as her normal fare, but looks more like traditional fantasy clerical robes than the tight shinium leotard she usually wears. She’s been physically gagged as well, a defeated look on her face as she is lowered down beside the rest of you. “And so, my collection is complete!” The fae woman appears in a puff of smoke to inspect her new trophies. All of you are completely helpless, able to do nothing but wiggle and squirm. Vhaja yells something out, but her voice is muffled by the plastic casing, making her words incomprehensible. The rest of you, being gagged, make even less sense as you try to voice your complaints at the situation you now find yourselves in. “So, let’s go over a few details of your situation,” not-Skadi says, walking down the line of her new prizes. “Firstly, these bindings are all magical in nature. Totally inescapable, so don’t bother trying - though I never mind watching you squirm. And, of course, they’ll keep you all hale and hearty for as long as you need to be. Which brings me to the second detail - yup, this situation is a permanent one. I’m keeping you all forever, and no one will ever be able to find you. So go ahead and dash any hopes of rescue from those pretty little heads of yours. And thirdly - don’t worry, it’s Game Over for your girlfriends, too. Just because they’re not part of your original crew doesn’t mean I won’t be keeping them forever in my collection.” [[Watch helplessly->FD05FB]] ] Your captor snaps a finger, and a spotlight appears over another section of the factory floor. Jyumon stands there, looking confused, as if she’s coming out of some kind of mental fog. Glancing around, she notices the four of you in your absurd display cases, and starts to react - but not before ghastly animated bindings begin to float in from behind her. (link:"I feel like there's a ghost pun to make here, but I can't think of any.")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1093436857792077824/F24_JyumonBondage1_by_Cangkulretak.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Cangkulretak(click-replace: "Art by Cangkulretak")[https://www.deviantart.com/cangkulretak https://twitter.com/dinnerhaver]] (set: $picF24 to true) A ballgag snaps itself over her lips, shiny tape wraps around her hands, just as a heavy armbinder snags her limbs and wrenches them behind her back. Invisible hands tear off her clothing, as belts appear from thin air to restrain her legs. By now, she realizes she’s been caught, but she still has enough mobility to hop lamely to the side. At least until the spectral arms start to drag her away.] |drink1)[(link:"Oh, wait, I've got it. Spirited away!")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1093436858106654760/F25_JyumonBondage2_by_Cangkulretak.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Cangkulretak(click-replace: "Art by Cangkulretak")[https://www.deviantart.com/cangkulretak https://twitter.com/dinnerhaver]] (set: $picF25 to true) A slap on the butt sends her tumbling to the ground, before she’s pulled a short distance to a waiting golden box. It’s almost coffin-shaped, and is the perfect size to fit her body as the lid is slammed closed and locked with a resounding snap. “There we are - snug as a bug in a rug. Or a fox in a box, as it were. But now we have one more special guest to add to my archive…” Another snap of her fingers, and another spotlight switches on. You see Revissa, arms bound behind her back and standing between two long poles, a piece of shiny tape slapped over her lips. She squirms helplessly in place as a device switches on, two rollers spinning along the poles to begin winding glossy lengths of plastic wrap around her body.] |drink2)[(link:"In the end, aren't you glad you walked in circles back there for a while? Look how much unique art you get as a reward!")[(show:?drink3)]] |drink3)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1093436858496716810/F26_RevissaWrapped_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF26 to true) The machine does not stop until she’s fully mummified, head to toe in the stuff, and a heat lamp runs over her to shrink-wrap the plastic into a full-on lamination. She can only writhe helplessly, trying to make eye contact with you through the opaque coverings, before more loading arms pick her up, drop her in a metal case, and lock it shut. “Oh, don’t look so broken up about it!” the fae woman says, walking over to gently jostle your packaging. “Surely you see what I mean, right? Her design is all wrong here - no horns, ears the wrong shape, and did you see how some of her face tattoos were lacking an outline? That’s because the person who drew the lineart forgot them in the sketch, and they were only added when someone else colored it in. Shameful.” Behind her, the two cases containing your captive lovers are loaded onto cranes and taken away to parts unknown, leaving the four of you alone with your tormentor. “Compare that to the four of you - your designs have been remarkably consistent ever since your first conception in that silly dress-up game program. Sure, hairstyles change up a bit, and sometimes artists forget the splash of brown at the tips of your ears and tail - and, okay, some people don’t draw you with as much muscle as they should –” she says, poking at the packaging around your belly area “-- but overall, your four have really wonderful designs. Obviously, Krysta being a squirrel is a new thing, but she’s still recognizable - though I’m gonna be honest, I actually prefer her as a human. It’s a classic, you know? And Vhaja, my dear, your chest has gotten larger over the years. You were supposed to be the short and thin one, but sometimes you’re as busty as dear Lumina. And, by the way, Lumina? No notes. Your design has always been perfect.” None of you are able to offer commentary on the woman’s incredibly bizarre and erratic monologue, only able to fruitlessly push against your bindings. “Anyway… I had my fun, messed around with you all a bit, and in the end decided you were worthwhile additions to my collection. And so, that’s where you’ll all stay - forever, of course. Now… let’s find someplace to put you on display…” (if: $candy is false)[[[Begin your new life->FD05FX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Begin your new life->FD05FY]]] ] It would be nice to say that life as a life-sized action figure on display in a capricious fae’s personal collection was exhilarating and full of surprises, but that would, of course, be a lie. You just stand there, totally restrained, looking out through your plastic case a world that hardly ever changes. You’re kept in a place akin to a curio shop, full of various knick-knacks and antiques. On one wall, a giant grandmother clock. Hanging from the ceiling, model airplanes suspended on strings. In the center of the floor, a marble birdbath. And yet, upon closer inspection, everything within the room has a macabre secret to it - because every single one hides the form of a helpless woman, trapped or transformed by the fae’s wicked magic. Behind the glass of the clock, a tsunojian is shackled in place, the pendulum tick-tocking between her two heaving breasts. And within the seats of the airplanes are tiny, glossy pilots, kemomi women shrunken and transformed to forever operate the controls. And the basin of the birdbath, of course, is clutched between the fingers of a petrified elvaan, the placid smile etched onto her face belying the terror she must have felt in the moment her fate was sealed. The four of you occupy one of the walls, lined up in a row, arranged in the same order as was the chain of command when you used to travel the stars together. Captain Melfy, First Mate Krysta, Science Officer Vhaja, and Medical Officer Lumina - silly titles, given that there was no one else on the crew to pull rank over. At least back in those first few years. But as the crew grew, positions changed. You’ll never forget the falling out you and Krysta had, prompting her to leave for a few weeks and become a Star Scout. After that Vhaja became First Mate. But still, Krysta eventually came back, and your crew expanded, and more ships joined the company, and you became heroes. Maybe not famous ones, but it’s impossible to deny the effect you had on the galaxy. And now… you’re here, locked away in a curio shop outside of time and space, trapped forever. If there is any silver lining, it’s that it’s easy to let your mind wander, to lose track of time, to tune out the universe and just *exist*, as a thing, and not a person. Every once in a while, your eyes rest on the corner where that big metal box is, and you wonder how Revissa is doing, locked away, out of sight. You wish more than anything that, at the very least, you could have been trapped together. And for a few days after that you’ll feel a pang of regret and sadness, a yearning for a different ending to your story, before your mind returns to its pleasant fog. But that’s all it is - a yearning. Not truth, not reality. Because the fact of the matter is, you’re here, you’re trapped, and you’re never, ever going to be anywhere else. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]] It would be nice to say that life as a life-sized action figure on display in a capricious fae’s personal collection was exhilarating and full of surprises, but that would, of course, be a lie. You just stand there, totally restrained, looking out through your plastic case a world that hardly ever changes. You’re kept in a place akin to a curio shop, full of various knick-knacks and antiques. On one wall, a giant grandmother clock. Hanging from the ceiling, model airplanes suspended on strings. In the center of the floor, a marble birdbath. And yet, upon closer inspection, everything within the room has a macabre secret to it - because every single one hides the form of a helpless woman, trapped or transformed by the fae’s wicked magic. Behind the glass of the clock, a tsunojian is shackled in place, the pendulum tick-tocking between her two heaving breasts. And within the seats of the airplanes are tiny, glossy pilots, kemomi women shrunken and transformed to forever operate the controls. And the basin of the birdbath, of course, is clutched between the fingers of a petrified elvaan, the placid smile etched onto her face belying the terror she must have felt in the moment her fate was sealed. The four of you occupy one of the walls, lined up in a row, arranged in the same order as was the chain of command when you used to travel the stars together. Captain Melfy, First Mate Krysta, Science Officer Vhaja, and Medical Officer Lumina - silly titles, given that there was no one else on the crew to pull rank over. At least back in those first few years. But as the crew grew, positions changed. You’ll never forget the falling out you and Krysta had, prompting her to leave for a few weeks and become a Star Scout. After that Vhaja became First Mate. But still, Krysta eventually came back, and your crew expanded, and more ships joined the company, and you became heroes. Maybe not famous ones, but it’s impossible to deny the effect you had on the galaxy. And now… you’re here, locked away in a curio shop outside of time and space, wishing for any fate other than this one. To your surprise, one day, you get your wish. Once she captured you, your fae captor mostly ignored you, occasionally taking some time out of her day to stare, maybe make a snide comment. But you start to notice that, as the ages flow by, every time she draws near you, she grows increasingly irate. Testy, irritable. You can’t for the life of you imagine why - it’s not like you have any agency at all to influence her mood. But one day she comes out and says it. What feels like a lifetime ago, you sucked down a Star Scout homing beacon, and ever since you’ve been captured it’s been sending out pulses into the void. Useless to attract help, but effective in creating an obnoxious ringing in her ear. Because the Scouts are formed around the tenets of love and happiness, even her fae magic can’t just undo the signal. So she just tries to live with it. But eventually, the benefit of keeping you outweighs the annoyance. All at once, you and your friends appear in a naked pile in the middle of a remote planet. No gear, no equipment, no idea how long you’ve been gone, or how you’ll make your way back to civilization. She doesn’t care - she just wants to put an end to the incessant ringing. Then she vanishes in her signature puff of smoke, leaving your party to their own devices. What follows is an exciting adventure in its own right, but it’s not the adventure we’re here to tell today. And, regardless, your actions have led to failing your original mission. Maybe next time you’ll think better about getting tangled up with a fae. GAME OVER [[Start Over->A0X]] Try as you might, you just couldn’t come out ahead. Part of you wonders if it was ever possible at all. “I must say, you made a good go of it. I could really feel the intensity and passion as you tried desperately to save your wife. You must really love her. I almost feel bad about how I treated your darling little deer - almost. Ho ho. But I must say, a tiny bit of guilt is worth it in exchange for the lovely little prize I won for myself today.” All you can do is glare at the languidly laughing. Literally. Because other than your eyes, you can’t move a muscle. At first, you have no idea why - at least, not until the beguiling villain snaps a finger to produce a mirror in front of you. (link:"Now don't be a grouch, my lovely Oscar")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1093718947792175114/F33_MelfySilver_by_Dreamons.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dreamons(click-replace: "Art by Dreamons")[https://www.deviantart.com/dreamons2]] (set: $picF33 to true) You’ve been stripped naked, forcibly posed in an at-attention position with your sword clutched between your hands. Your feet have become embedded in a large, round platform, holding you in place, and your body has been coated, head to toe, in gleaming silver paint that has hardened atop your bare skin. The end result is to transform you into the very thing you ‘won’ for your second-place finish - a silver trophy. “Now then… we established what would happen if *you* won the race, but we never hammered out the details if *I* won. But I suppose there’s no time like the present. So why don’t I propose some options. If you don’t like them, just say no and we’ll think of something else.” “....” With your lips frozen in place, you can’t make a sound, one way or another. “So, how about this? If the game ends with me as the winner, I’ll keep your lovely wife as part of my merry-go-round for the rest of eternity, and you as my lovely little trophy for the same duration. Neither of you will ever be freed without my express approval, and no one will ever be able to save you. How does that sound?” “...!” You try to yell out a protest, but the fae woman cannot hear you. She pokes your nose playfully. “Just say ‘no I do not accept these terms’ and I’ll come up with something better. But while we’re pitching ideas… how about I also track down your other friends and add them to my collection as well? Say something if you disagree.” “........!” “You’re sure? All you need to do is say the words – otherwise I’ll assume you accept my proposal.” “.......................!” “Well, if you insist… very well. The deal is agreed upon. You and your wife shall now belong to me for the rest of time. And I’ll go ahead and capture the rest of your merry crew as well!” A terrible dread sits in to the pit of your stomach as you can somehow *feel* the contract coming into effect. This is just about the worst outcome imaginable. You continue trying to catch her attention, blinking furiously, helplessly straining against the solid shell built around your body, but she ignores your continued protests as she looks towards the merry-go-round, still cheerily spinning along, even after the race has ended. And then she holds out her hand and, through a trick of visual perspective, picks it up and holds it in her palm. Now it’s the size of a snow globe, Revissa just one of many tiny figures trapped within its confines. “More portable this way,” she says with a grin. “The perfect size to sit on a shelf, right next to my sexy little bedroom award, wouldn’t you say?” You wouldn’t, but you can’t. All you can do is stand there in place as she takes a few steps back and does the same trick with you – and then, suddenly, you’re only ten inches tall, your metal body able to be snugly gripped in a single hand. Tears creep at the corners of your eyes as you realize just how helpless you are, just how completely you’ve been defeated. Revissa was right - never trust a fae. You’d have been better off being lost in that forest forever. But instead, now you’re both just two more playthings in the collection of an impossibly powerful being. And with another snap of her fingers, you vanish from the forest, never to return again. [[Begin your new life->FD07A1]] ] You’ve run out of better ideas to win the race, so you decide that in the end, you’re just going to stick with what you know best. You drop to the floor of the merry-go-round, then hop over the railing, standing on soft soil as you jog alongside Revissa’s cheerily bobbing figure. Up and down, up and down she goes, moving in time with the carnival music blaring from the speakers. In the end, the ride is just a machine, right? Powered by gears and pulleys and other mechanical apparatus. Well, you’re pretty strong. Maybe even strong enough to do it better. Reaching out, you clasp your hand around Revissa’s glossy fingers, holding on tight as you try to increase the pace of your movements. You pull her along behind you, muscles straining as you attempt to increase the rotation speed of the outer circle of the carnival attraction with pure force of muscle. And to your delight, it actually works. You start to gain ground, you and Revissa closing in on not-Skadi and her bunny-taur mount. And interestingly, as the rotation speed increases, so too does the tempo of the carnival music, as if the two were inexorably tied together. Not surprising, given fae magic is responsible for the whole thing. To be perfectly honest, it looks like it could have worked. *Could* have. If only you’d started a bit closer to your opponent. Because after a full circuit around the track, your strength begins to wane, your heart pounds in your chest, and your legs become sluggish, like you’re pulling yourself through an ocean of molasses. Eventually, you just can’t keep up, and your fingers slip from Revissa’s hands, even as you were only a few feet away from the rider ahead of you. The fae woman throws her head back and waves, hair whipping in the wind as she pulls ahead past the finish line. Her arrival is punctuated by a tinny fanfare from the ride’s speakers, declaring her the winner - and you, unfortunately, the loser. “Oh, my poor deer, it looks like you didn’t finish first. Though… you *are* finished.” And before you get a chance to respond, she snaps her fingers. [[Claim second place->FD07A]] Well, now you’ve at least stopped your opponent from gaining more ground, but that’s not enough, given she’s still ahead. You’re going to need to find some way to catch up now! Your mind races for solutions to the problem, and eventually settles on a rather extreme one. If the ride is rigged to ensure Revissa falls behind, then you’ll just have to physically change it so that it doesn’t. The two rows of ‘horses’ are arranged on separate, concentrically rotating circles, so if you could somehow manage to jam up the one containing the fae woman’s mount then yours would be able to get ahead. Leaping from Revissa’s smooth, shiny back, you land on the surface of the ride itself, and pull out your sword from its place at your back. Getting down on all fours, you carefully study the seam between the two rotating circles, finding a spot that looks like it might be vulnerable to tampering. Then you jam the end of your blade into the gap, trying to dig it down as far as it can go to mess with whatever gears are turning beneath the surface. You’re rewarded with an ear-splitting screech as metal grinds against metal, and feel a jolt as half the ride grinds to a halt. The fae woman looks backwards from her position ahead of you, scowling in annoyance. You give her a winning smile back, prompting her to flick her finger upwards. Suddenly, your sword rises up into the air and then sails away into the forest, useless to you for the remainder of the race. The merry-go-round hums back into full operation, chugging along as not-Skadi continues on her merry way. But now you’re neck-and-neck with her. [[Leap and tackle her off her mount->FD06C]] [[Lash your mounts together evenly->FD06I]] [[Try and pull Revissa ahead with brute strength->FD06J]] As you fumble for solutions, you get the idea that if Revissa were tightly tethered to the bunny-taur with a strong enough rope, Revissa would essentially get pulled along by the ‘faster’ of the two mounts. But where can you find a sturdy rope on such short notice? Looking around, your eyes rest on the colorful banners flapping in the breeze on the outside of the ride, which are attached to the ‘tent’ portion with some thin wires. Maybe those will do the trick! Careful of the rotation of the ride beneath you, you reach out, grasping hold of a banner and tugging it down. To your satisfaction, it comes loose easily. Then as quick as you are able, you tear off the cloth banner to get to the binding beneath it, giving it a pull to test its strength. It’ll have to do. You’re no cowgirl, but you manage to form a passable loop from the metal cord, and then swing it over your head, taking careful aim. When it’s set loose from your grip, you hold your breath, carefully trying to use your wrist to maneuver it into place - and you’re rewarded by a tug as it finds purchase around the bunny-taur’s neck. Success! …though it’s a fleeting one. Because despite getting it where it needed to be, you now realize that your opponent has already gotten too far ahead in the race, leaving you without enough slack to secure it around Revissa. Lamely, you try to hold on as tight as you can, but the wire soon slips from your grip, dragging uselessly around the circuit of the track. A few minutes later you hear the sound of a victory fanfare blaring from the merry-go-round’s tinny speakers, announcing that a winner has crossed the finish line first. Needless to say, it wasn’t you. The fae woman looks backwards from her mount, flashing you a victorious smile. “Oh, my poor deer, it looks like you didn’t finish. Though… you *are* finished.” And before you get a chance to respond, she snaps her fingers. [[Claim second place->FD07A]] Now that you’ve caught up, the lasso you’ve tied has fallen slack, no longer serving any purpose. But you can change that. If you tighten the tension between the two mounts and fully lash them together, your opponent won’t be able to gain any more distance. You’d finally be on even ground! The fae woman watches you with interest as you get to work, seemingly unperturbed by your plan. In fact, she even helpfully presses a finger against the rope at one point to make it easier to tie a knot. Her compliance is obviously unsettling. Why would she be helping you win? Are you making a mistake? Or is it some kind of reverse psychology, trying to trick you away from the best option by making it seem like that’s what she wants? In the end, you know you’re never going to outsmart a fae. So you just stick with the plan and hope it works. Before long, Revissa and the bunny mount are tightly connected, moving as one unit as the merry-go-round happily chugs along. It is only as the finish line approaches that you realize the issue – if they’re both neck and neck, that means they’ll end the race at the same time! You won’t lose, but you also won’t win. And you *need* to win if you want to make her honor her deal to turn Revissa back to normal. “Looks like you’ve figured it out,” the fae woman says with a chuckle. “Well, how about it? Do you have any more ideas? Or will you just accept a tie?” With the finish line looming, you only have a few moments to make a choice. [[Accept a tie->FD06O]] [[Cut the line and pull Revissa ahead->FD06P]] [[Try to slow down the other mount->FD06Q]] You’ve run out of better ideas to win the race, so you decide that in the end, you’re just going to stick with what you know best. You drop to the floor of the merry-go-round, then hop over the railing, standing on soft soil as you jog alongside Revissa’s cheerily bobbing figure. Up and down, up and down she goes, moving in time with the carnival music blaring from the speakers. In the end, the ride is just a machine, right? Powered by gears and pulleys and other mechanical apparatus. Well, you’re pretty strong. Maybe even strong enough to do it better. Reaching out, you clasp your hand around Revissa’s glossy fingers, holding on tight as you try to increase the pace of your movements. You pull her along behind you, muscles straining as you attempt to increase the rotation speed of the outer circle of the carnival attraction with pure force of muscle. And to your delight, it actually works. You start to pull ahead, you and Revissa slowly chugging past not-Skadi and her bunny-taur mount. And interestingly, as the rotation speed increases, so too does the tempo of the carnival music, as if the two were inexorably tied together. Not surprising, given fae magic is responsible for the whole thing. The soft sound of clapping hands pulls your attention behind you. “My oh my, what a show!” the fae woman says excitedly, watching intently as sweat pours down your brow, making your muscled physique glisten in the forest air. She snaps her fingers, and a gust of wind picks up, sending a refreshingly cool chill over your body, before, somehow, it picks up and slides all your clothes off your frame, sending boots and pants and shirts scattering every which way. It leaves you naked and exposed, every aspect of your anatomy on display for her enjoyment as you try to pull your wife across the finish line. [[Leap and tackle her from her mount->FD06K]] [[Ignore her and keep pulling->FD06L]] [[Use your lasso to tie her up->FD06M]] You look your opponent over, studying her features. It’s impressive enough that you’ve even managed to make it this far. Perhaps a tie is the best you can hope for. Trying anything more would just prompt her to negate your efforts and cause a loss. Negotiating with a fae is a fool’s errand at best, but at least trying it now you’d be at a place of parity, rather than from a disadvantage. “Fine,” you eventually say, unable to hide the resignation in your voice. “I guess I have no choice.” “So you accept the tie?” the woman chirps. “Yes, fine, I accept a tie!” Her face lights up. “Oh I *was* hoping you’d say that!” It is only after she snaps her finger that you realize just how foolish it was to let her phrase it like that. At the sound of her command, the metal wires you’d tied between the two mounts start to come to life, writing around like serpents with a mind of their own. You don’t even have a moment to react before they leap towards you, transforming into thick leather bands that shred your clothing to pieces as they start to wind themselves around your body. They curl around your ankles, shins and thighs, catching your arms and wrapping your wrists together behind your back, securing themselves below your breasts and around your shoulders to prevent any attempt at breaking free. Another snap of her fingers, and a rubber ball shoots forward and presses itself between your lips, more bands shooting out of it to form a tight and secure gag that cuts off any sounds from your mouth besides some plaintive grunts. Ahead of you, the two horses cross the finish line at exactly the same time, ending literally neck and neck. A tinny fanfare goes off from the merry-go-round’s loudspeaker, indicating that the race has ended in – you guessed it – a tie. [[End the race->FD07C]] You’re not looking for a stalemate here. You’re trying to win! And you aren’t going to do that by crossing the finish line together. So there’s nothing else to do but to cut the bonds you just made. Unfortunately, you don’t have your sword any more, but you do still have the enchanted dagger that Vhaja lent to you. You pull the blade from your belt and quickly work on severing the lines, pleased to find that the metal cables snap easily with only a slight bit of pressure. And once the two mounts are freed, you leap off of Revissa’s back to the ground, taking hold of her hand to start pulling her ahead, using your own speed to outrun the ‘faster’ mount on the inner circle of the ride. A surge of adrenaline rushes through you, strengthening your muscles as you burn every ounce of stamina to take you through the last leg of the race. To your delight, it actually works! You start to pull ahead, you and Revissa slowly chugging past not-Skadi and her bunny-taur mount. And interestingly, as the rotation speed increases, so too does the tempo of the carnival music, as if the two were inexorably tied together. Not surprising, given fae magic is responsible for the whole thing. Behind you, the fae woman does not seem to mind that you’re about to win. In fact, she’s rather enjoying the show. So much so that she snaps her fingers, causing a gust of wind to swirl around you that sends a refreshingly cool chill over your body, before, somehow, it picks up and slides all your clothes off your frame, sending boots and pants and shirts scattering every which way. It leaves you naked and exposed, every aspect of your anatomy on display for her enjoyment as you finally manage to pull your wife across the finish line. Your victory is announced with a tinny fanfare blasting from the merry-go-round’s loudspeakers, indicating that, against all odds, you actually managed to win the race. The fae woman simply smiles and claps her hands politely, her eyes darting up and down your naked, sweat-covered body. “Congratulations. You’ve impressed me with your ingenuity… and other assets. Now how about we throw you a victory party?” [[Claim your prize->FD07]] An idea strikes you as the racers inch towards the finish line - even if the two mounts are tied together, there’s still a tiny bit of wiggle room between them. And if you could just jam yourself between the mounts, maybe you could shift them just enough so that Revissa’s head nudges forwards, and the bunny-taur’s body falls backwards. To do so, however, requires you to brace yourself in between the two ‘horses’, your arms wrapped around Revissa’s neck and your legs anchored on the bunny’s bum. Luckily, your earlier rope-work has left the two in relatively stable balance, allowing you to span the distance between them without falling onto the track below. After that, it’s just a matter of applying the right force. Tensing your arms, bracing your legs, and heaving with all the strength your muscles can muster. You grunt in exertion as the ride nears the goal, barely managing to fight the tension in the ropes and the force of the merry-go-round itself to bend Revissa just a centimeter forward. Barely a difference, but winning by a nose is still winning. But… maybe you should have given the plan a bit more thought. Because, stretched as you are, your legs against not-Skadi’s mount, your taut rump is in open view of your opponent, presenting a tantalizing target. She takes the unintentionally offered bait, reaching out with two fingers to deliver a sharp, distracting pinch right onto your pert bottom. The sudden pressure makes you yelp in surprise, shifting the tension in your muscles to reverse the positions of the riders! It happens only for a moment, but it’s the only moment that matters, as when you finally cross the finish line it’s the bunny-taur’s nose that is ahead. A tinny fanfare from the merry-go-round’s loudspeaker announces the crowning of a winner. A winner that, sadly, is not you. “Oh… so close. A mishap right at the finish,” the fae woman says. “But sorry to say, now you *are* finished…” And then with a smile, she snaps her fingers. [[Claim second place->FD07A]] Well if she’s trying to distract you, that just means you need to distract her instead. Perching up on your seat, you spend a moment to calculate your trajectory, then make a diving lunge towards the shapely fae’s body. To be honest, it’s a fairly desperate ploy - which is why it surprises you when it works. You feel soft flesh against your skin as you collide with your opponent, knocking her from her perch and slamming her against the central rotating pillar. Now you have her pinned beneath you, your powerful arms pressed down on her shoulders to prevent her from regaining her position. And yet… she does not seem the least bit perturbed. “Oh… so forward. Are you trying to claim your prize early?” There’s only time for you to blink in confusion before she leans in against you and warmly locks lips. And then… your world falls into a pleasant blur. You have a vague recollection of hands and teeth and exposed nipples on milky white skin, of dark, silken hair swishing against your back, of hands roughly stroking the fur on your ears and tail. It feels like it lasts for an eternity, and yet, at the same time, that it is over too soon. What breaks the reverie is the sound of a victory fanfare blaring from the merry-go-round’s tinny speakers, announcing that a winner has crossed the finish line. You look at the fae woman in confusion as she lustily strokes the inner fuzz on your ear with a hand. “Don’t look so surprised. It’s not like this game was impossible or anything - there has to be *some* chance that you come ahead.” Sure enough, Revissa’s glossy figure is a few inches in front of the opposing mount, making her - and thus, you - the winner of the race. “It was a lot of fun, wasn’t it?” the fae woman says, lazily rolling out from beneath you and manifesting her clothing back onto her body with a snap of her fingers. “Now why don’t we throw you a little victory party.” Her eyes sparkle alluringly, and you find yourself nodding along in compliance at her words. (set: $faekiss to true) [[Claim your prize->FD07]] You’re not going to let her distract you from winning - not when you’ve finally managed to pull ahead! So, despite the sudden loss of clothing, you keep at what you were doing, holding on to Revissa for deer life as you pull her closer and closer to the goal. You can feel your strength starting to give out, your muscles screaming for relief, every inch of you slick and glistening with perspiration, but you push them onwards for just a little bit longer. A few seconds… that’s all you need! At this point, you’re pretty sure even if you ran out of steam you’d still have enough of a lead to pull out a win. But then… that wind picks up again. The same one that knocked off all your clothes. It’s stiff and bracing, sending a chill that creeps like icy tendrils along your body. You ignore it. No sexy fae is going to divert you from your goal! And yet… you *can’t* ignore it. Because as the cool breeze wraps around you, it starts to effect a change. All that sweat you’ve built up, that slick condensation on your skin, it begins to dry. No – dry isn’t the right word. Maybe it would be better to call it congeal. It *hardens*. All too late do you realize what your foe is trying to do. And by the time it occurs to you, she has already succeeded. Your perspiration forms a clear, glistening layer of your skin, almost like a lacquer, a shiny glaze, and as it cools, it also crackles and stiffens, traps and encases, freezing your muscles in place and preventing you from covering the last few feet to the goal. You finally let go of your grip, holding your hands out to your sides as a look of confusion spreads along your features. But there’s nothing you can do about it now. And with an ominous *shwing* sound that echoes through the clearing, you petrify completely, becoming a glossy and gleaming statue beneath a lacquer magically formed from your own sweat and start to tip over.
