BoundPretties(click-replace: "Art by BoundPretties")[https://www.deviantart.com/boundpretties https://www.patreon.com/boundpretties/overview]] ] (else: )[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1064714229631946833/A01_Lock.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">] Deer Solo (if: $picF38 is true)[ <img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1093718962530947122/F38_RevissaFreezium_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] ] (else: )[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1064714229631946833/A01_Lock.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">] If You Listen Closely You Can Hear Her Plastic Squeaking (if: $picF39 is true)[ <img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1093754166465265664/F39_JyumonVacbed_by_ZeroTwo9S.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] ] (else: )[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1064714229631946833/A01_Lock.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">] You Get a Prize for Scrolling this Far Down! (if: $picF40 is true)[ <img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1093738331965239326/F40_TrophyMelfy_by_Devga.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] ] (else: )[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1064714229631946833/A01_Lock.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">] [[Back to Art Gallery->AI00]] [[Back to Main Menu->A00]] [[Back to Forest Art->AIF]]Of course, you can’t go on a mission naked. Or at least, you can’t go on *this* mission naked. There’s been more than one occurrence where you and Revissa had to accomplish something entirely in the buff, but that usually only happened after you were kidnapped and needed to fight your way out of custody. Revissa gets dressed first. Her color scheme is a mixture of green, white and gold, a simple cloth shirt that shows off her cute tummy, a very low-cut skirt that would leave some sensitive areas exposed if not for the leaf adornment near the hips, some functional leg-wraps made of material harvested from plants, and a long scarf tied around the neck. The ensemble is completed with some beautifully lacquered wooden jewelry polished to a golden sheen, including a moth emblem meant to show her devotion to the ancient forest guardian Un-Rama, a powerful fae spirit that protects her people. Her long wooden staff bears the same symbol on its tip, making it the perfect conduit for her nature magic. (link:"Check her out")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1095746406565810246/P33_RevissaClothed_by_MuleExpress.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by MuleExpress(click-replace: "Art by MuleExpress")[https://twitter.com/alfiardyrulli]] (set: $picP33 to true) You take your time appreciating her before you bother getting your own outfit on. For years you used to prefer purely functional clothing, but a long time ago on a mission you had gone in disguise under the made-up persona of the Dread Captain Wolfe, notorious space pirate, and to be honest you had really dug the aesthetic. And so despite not actually having ever resorted to anything akin to piracy, you still like to sport the look, if for no other reason than as a personal ego boost.] |drink1)[(link:"Show off your bod")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1095746407018791074/P34_MelfyClothed_by_NaughtyAzima.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by NaughtyAzima(click-replace: "Art by NaughtyAzima")[https://www.deviantart.com/naughtyazima https://twitter.com/NaughtyAzima]] (set: $picP34 to true) The outfit consists of some form-fitting pants that really accentuate your shapely bum, complete with a slit at the back for your poofy tail to fit through, and an equally clingy top that highlights both your chest size and your toned and muscular abdomen. Belt buckles keep your tight leather boots firmly secured, while also providing a place to hang an equipment pouch and a blaster pistol on your hips. A dashingly heroic cape hangs from your shoulders, but it also serves to conceal the heavy sword you also keep fastened there in a sheath along your back. To be perfectly honest, you look damn good. You’ve still got it! Revissa rolls her eyes as you appreciate yourself in the mirror for a bit too long, before she finally grabs you by the arm and leads you out into the hallway so you can meet up with the rest of the crew. [[Head to the bridge-> P04]] ] You decide that it would be useful to investigate the potential of settlers or explorers here in the forest. Both because it would give Revissa someone to be angry at other than you for a change, but also because whoever’s here might have some useful information that could help you on your journey. Veering off from the river, you follow an easily visible trail into the trees, walking for only about five minutes until the path opens up into a large clearing. Here you find a half-dozen prefabricated living structures arranged in a semi-circle around a medium-sized cargo ship, maybe twice as big as your Lucky Break. The ship is parked with its landing struts out, and you get the sense that it’s been there for at least a week or so, based on little details like how the loading ramp is arranged. Off to one side you spy more of that resin that had been pooled up from the tree fitted with a faucet, though now it’s been hardened into huge chunks of opaque amber about as tall as a person, maybe six to ten of them all scattered around a massive flower. Near the tree line you see some kind of equipment set up, probably meant for harvesting and packaging resources being gathered from the forest, since there are also a good deal of shipping crates piled up next to it. Altogether, it does look very much like a smuggler’s camp. And you can guess at the culprits based on the model of the cargo ship - a Knottie design. From your briefing you know that the Knotties had established a camp near the ruins, but it looks like their operations have recently expanded towards the forest. (if: $sawbunny is true)[Thinking back on it, you *had* seen some Knottie women entrapped by the psychic bunny in the central part of the forest, so it stands to reason this outpost is where they originated from.] That said, you don’t see any of them currently milling about. Maybe they’re on the ship or in one of the buildings, or perhaps just out working in the woods. “I can’t believe they would treat this beautiful forest as nothing more than a source of raw materials!” Revissa says with an honestly kind of adorable pout. In your head, you take note that Revissa seemed entirely unconcerned with them gathering resources when it was near the ruins - she only cares about it when trees and plants and forests are involved. But you smartly bite your tongue, lest that pout be directed towards you, instead. “Well… I guess we should have expected it,” you say diplomatically. “There’s lots of stuff you can find in a forest to turn into bondage gear. Vines, plant fibers, spider silk… even animal leather. It was bound to happen sooner or later.” “We need to drive them out!” Revissa firmly declares. It takes you a few minutes to convince her that even if you *did* drive them out, it’s not like you’re planning on staying permanently on the planet to keep them away from the trees. Better to just take note of it, and maybe bring it up with Krysta later as a point of discussion during her negotiations at their main camp. Either way, now that you’re here, you may as well take a look around. The scent of pollen is thick in the air here, giving you a slight headache as you start to explore. At most, plants just react. Bending towards a patch of sunlight, dropping their leaves when the weather gets cold, spreading roots deeper and deeper into the soil in search of nutrients. Of course, as part of a plant, you are already helping fulfill one of those tasks. Because as it turns out, the body of an intelligent being is capable of providing many intangible benefits to a thriving floral ecosystem. It could be described as a symbiotic relationship. The plant matter encases your body, the nectar it provides regulates all your essential biological systems, keeps you functioning in all the ways that matter to it, even if your mind has been essentially dulled into sleepy compliance. In exchange, you provide a highly potent spiritual energy to your host, a form of nutrient that it couldn’t find anywhere else. Your very soul nourishes the forest around you, allows the plants to spread ever further, become even more resilient to external threats. You don’t age a day in your new, chlorophyll filled prisons, don’t grow sick or hungry or cold. To you, every day is the same, every moment an opportunity to provide more of yourself to your host. Her body starts to shrink, green fur sprouts from her skin, whiskers growing from her cheeks as her nose becomes all cute and twitchy. Just like that, she’s become an adorable little mouse, and immediately starts to scamper towards a deeper section of the forest. But you’re not a wolf for nothing. Predator instincts kick in, and you dive towards your transformed wife, catching her not with your hands but your jaws, chomping down on her soft green fur. Of course, you don’t actually bite down. For one, you have no desire to hurt her, but for two if you did too much damage the spell keeping her in this form would be broken and she’d revert to her natural state. So instead, you scoop her up into your arms, pulling the flailing mouse close to your chest. And then you turn and run, trying to make it back to the river before her addled mind realizes she can change into something bigger and stronger to escape your grip. Leaves and vines, thorns and brambles spring up around the ground to try and stop you, and branches of trees bend to block your path, but you barrel through all of them, intent only on protecting the woman you love. When you finally see the river you don’t stop running, instead diving straight in with a colossal splash. As the sound of rushing water fills your ears you pull your mouse-wife in even closer, just trying to keep both your heads above water as the current sweeps you downstream. Several minutes later, the two of you emerge, drenched and exhausted, and throw yourselves onto the shore. Revissa is back in humanoid form, and also seems to have regained control of her mind. Pulling out your holo-map, you find you’ve basically lost all the progress you’ve made up until this point, having been carried back nearly to the entrance of the forest. Revissa leans over and kisses you, thanking you for the rescue. And together you both decide mind-altering plants are not worth the trouble. Instead of following the river, you’ll double back to the start and find a different route to your destination. [[Return to the start->FA06]] “Hold on,” you say, pressing down firmly on her shoulders. “I’m gonna find whatever is controlling you and get rid of it! Just stay here.” Revissa looks at you with bleary eyes, but nods slowly. It’s clear it is taking all her willpower to resist whatever has its hold on her. After you help her sit down against a tree, you run off into the woods, searching for anything that looks out of place. Though… as you wander, you realize you don’t actually know what you’re looking for. After five minutes pass without you seeing anything noteworthy, panic starts to set in. What were you doing, leaving Revissa alone? So you turn and double back, looking for the tree where you left her. But try as you might, you don’t see her! Now fully frantic, you search the ground for tracks, finding evidence of her footsteps moving off in a direction opposite the one you had run down. Quick as you can, you follow them, finally catching sight of her silhouette walking in a hypnotic daze towards a clearing. [[Catch up with her->FC03BA]] The interior of the plant is warm and wet, filled with an indescribable sweetness. You put up no resistance as the fleshy stalk wraps ever more tightly around you, pressing you and your wife together into a deeply intimate embrace. Your lips encircle hers without any thought crossing your mind, and your legs spread open as the tips of the plant stalks insert themselves into your unprotesting nether regions. Both of you coo in delight as you’re brought to the first of many overpowering climaxes, kissing each other deeply as your new floral home keeps you happy and stimulated. You have no way of knowing what, exactly, the plant wants from you, but apparently you have something to offer it, because now that it has you, it folds up into itself to form a thick, bulb-like carapace that prevents anything outside from getting in. And then, the bulb digs itself into the ground, retreating beneath the soil so that nothing can get at the two bodies entwined in its symbiotic hold. Over the years, you and Revissa contribute to the plant’s growth, helping it to spread its roots far across the forest, allowing it to create a thriving network of interconnected organisms. The two of you, trapped in your subterranean bulb, are the nexus of all the new development, your mental energies somehow harvested to keep everything neatly organized. Of course, the two of you are never consciously aware of it. For the endless years ahead of you, you both experience nothing but happiness, awash with the constant stimulation your bodies provide to one another. You’ll never know fear, or pain, or hunger, or unhappiness again, nor will your bodies age or decay. In a way, you’ve become eternal, an unchanging fixture of the forest that will always be there for you. At this point, even if you could leave, you wouldn’t want to. But, of course, the fact remains that you *can’t* leave. And you never will. GAME OVER [[Start Over->A0X]]The interior of the plant is warm and wet, filled with an indescribable sweetness. You put up no resistance as the fleshy stalk wraps ever more tightly around you, pressing you and your wife together into a deeply intimate embrace. Your lips encircle hers without any thought crossing your mind, and your legs spread open as the tips of the plant stalks insert themselves into your unprotesting nether regions. Both of you coo in delight as you’re brought to the first of many overpowering climaxes, kissing each other deeply as your new floral home keeps you happy and stimulated. You have no way of knowing what, exactly, the plant wants from you, but apparently you have something to offer it, because now that it has you, it folds up into itself to form a thick, bulb-like carapace that prevents anything outside from getting in. And then, the bulb digs itself into the ground, retreating beneath the soil to stop anything from getting at the two bodies entwined in its symbiotic hold. Luckily for you, hiding itself is the only major defense it has. Because even though there’s no external indicator of where you’ve been buried, the Star Scout homing beacon candy you swallowed at the start of the mission still broadcasts your location to your allies. It takes several days, but they do eventually find you, and manage to dig you up from the ground - destroying the plant that caught you and many others in the forest in the meantime. When she wakes up, Revissa makes a token objection to the needless violence against nature, but even she has to admit it is preferable to spending the rest of her life as fertilizer. Unfortunately, the data collection device you were entrusted with was destroyed in the confusion, meaning your mission was ultimately a failure. But at least you’ve escaped with your body and mind intact. Though maybe from now on, you’ll be a bit more hesitant the next time your wife asks you to help her with the gardening. [[Start Over->A0X]]You lose track of time as the plant has its way with you. As far as you know, it could have been hours. Time loses all meaning in the face of the pleasure you’re being subjected to. But eventually the sensations subside, and suddenly you find yourself being ejected, spat out from the mouth of the plant like a cat coughing up a hairball. Now you’re splayed out on the forest floor, naked and exhausted, sitting in a pool of fragrant plant sap. Revissa is standing above you and quickly takes your hand, pulling you to your feet. She pops a berry between your lips, the kind she grows with her magic to restore stamina, and you feel a rush of strength return to your limbs. “Come on, we need to get out of here,” she says, tugging on your arm. You have just enough presence of mind to grab your pouch full of equipment before the two of you run back towards the river. Everything is still a blur, your body aching from all the stimulation, your mind in a euphoric fog, but the tightness of Revissa’s grip on your hand is something to focus on as you make your retreat. When you finally reach the river, the two of you collapse into each other’s arms, panting with both relief and fatigue. When you catch your breath, Revissa explains that she was able to use her nature magic to command the plants to release you - but she only had the time to focus thanks to you causing all that damage before you were captured. On the one hand, you’re glad your strength proved to be useful, though on the other, some small part of you wished you could have actually gotten to be the big hero for once. You never actually get to look cool on your adventures, and it kind of bums you out. But at least you’re both still alive and not trapped inside of a hungry plant. Though you both lost your clothing and gear, you at least managed to grab your supply pouch, so the data collection device you need for the mission is safe. And some of the matter resynthesizer capsules Jyumon provided you with allows you to provide replacements for everything else you lost. After a few minutes, you’re both equipped and ready to go - though now there’s the question of which direction to head in. Obviously, you could continue forward for your mission. But at this point, it might be worth doubling back to check out that settlement you passed. If the plants are this aggressive out here, it could be useful to find out how these other visitors managed to avoid getting caught by them. Alternatively, you could just give up on this route entirely and try a different path to get through the forest. (set: $plantcontact to true) [[Double back->FC02]] [[Keep heading forward->FC03D]] [[Return to the forest entrance->FC04]] (if: $leftoutpost is true)[](else: )[Ultimately, you’re just here to collect data. Learning about plants is secondary. And to be honest, at this point you’re anxious to get out of here anyway, lest you become a snack for another hungry flower. And so you push forward, continuing along the path of the river towards the destination on your map. Thankfully, you make it an hour without any further interruptions. Revissa is careful not to do any more communing with nature, and you keep your eyes peeled for any signs of creeping vines or pollen-spitting bulbs.] Eventually, you reach the point where you need to branch off from the river, and to your relief, the only thing in your way is a large, open, grassy patch of land, no trees, flowers, or bushes in sight - there’s not even any large rocks or other obstructions for a predator to hide behind. In such a wide, clear area, you feel like there’s no chance of getting taken by surprise. In retrospect, you should have foreseen the problem. Together, you and Revissa begin marching across the open plain, eyes darting warily back and forth - towards the distant trees, towards the river behind you, towards the sky above - everywhere but down at your feet. If you had looked that way, you might have noticed the ominous way the blades of grass shifted as you walked over them, swaying not in sync with the direction of the wind but their own internal chemistry. How every strand bent towards the intruders in their territory, how the two of you were not welcome, even here, in an open, unassuming stretch of land. The grass waits until the two of you are far into the center of the patch of green, when you stop for a moment to pull off your boot to shake out a pebble that had gotten stuck. It is the very moment that the rock strikes the ground that the grass begins to sway, suddenly growing in length and spooling outwards with a mind all its own. In an instant your legs have been wrenched together, throwing you off balance and making you drop your boot onto the ground. More blades of grass twirl upwards to ensnare and destroy the foreign object, turning it into tiny scraps that are swiftly buried beneath the soil. As if the grass wants to cover up any trace of your existence. Beside you, Revissa shrieks in surprise as she, too, is targeted, her staff yanked from her hand and dropped with a soft thunk onto the soft green surface beneath her. Your instinct is to reach out towards her, but the growing coils of flora capture your arm and pull it against your body, shredding any clothing it catches along the way. Now realizing the peril the two of you are in, your wife tries to close her eyes and use her magic to connect with the grass trying to entrap you, but all she gets is a terrifying, violent impulse to subjugate all that does not belong. She comes out of her trance with a gasp, just as the grass curls past her chin and over her mouth to seal away her voice. (link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1104532036691169444/F50_MelfyRevissaWrapGrass_by_Cangkulretak.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Cangkulretak(click-replace: "Art by Cangkulretak")[https://www.deviantart.com/cangkulretak https://twitter.com/dinnerhaver]] (set: $picF50 to true) And just like that, the two of you are caught. The grass blades form impossibly tight, intensely sturdy bands of material, wrapping you up like you were a pair of mummies. You can’t move a muscle, can’t make a noise, can’t possibly escape as it coils itself more and more firmly around your bodies. And once it is sure you’re completely at its mercy, the grass yanks you downwards, slamming your wrapped forms against the soil. Now you can only wriggle about like worms, but even that is taken away from you as additional tethers snake out to anchor you both in place, forcing you to look upwards towards the sky. The two of you make helpless, plaintive mewling noises into the gags that have covered your lips, but they are barely audible against the gentle sound of grass swaying in the wind. You’ve both been pulled down so low, restrained so snugly, that from a distance you wouldn’t even be visible against the endless sea of green, aside from maybe a tiny flash of yellow hair. Side by side the two of you lay, utterly immobilized, capable of doing nothing but staring upwards at the bright warm rays of a sun that seems to taunt you with its freedom. Paradoxically, despite the grass’s hatred of foreign intrusion, it seems that it has answered the problem by making sure the both of you stay here for a long, long time. And, trapped as you are, there’s nothing you can do but lay here and wait to see what happens next. (if: $candy is false)[[[Watch the clouds go by->FC03DX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Watch the clouds go by->FC03DY]]] ]Ultimately, you’re just here to collect data. Learning about plants is secondary. And to be honest, at this point you’re anxious to get out of here anyway, lest you become a snack for another hungry flower. Wary of any future problems, you opt to return to the entrance, figuring a different path might be safer for your health. For several minutes you walk, keeping your eyes peeled for any signs of danger, but it seems the plants are no longer calling out to your wife with their siren song of togetherness. And so, after a long stretch of tension, you finally let yourself relax, slowing your pace to normal and sparing a glance towards your map readout to figure out the next route you’ll try to take. Unfortunately, it is at the exact moment that you first let your guard down that you feel the rumble of movement from beneath the soil, followed by the eruption of several hidden creeper vines that dart upwards and wrap themselves around your limbs. [[Get tangled->FC04D]] There’s not really much else you can do but stare. Look up at the sky and imagine being as free as the clouds that lazily drift by on the wind. But instead you’re here, wrapped up in bandages made of grass and firmly tied to the earth. Escape is impossible, the prospect of rescue your only hope. But as the days go by, it becomes clear that no one is coming to save you. You’ll never know what happened to the rest of the crew. Maybe something else on this planet snatched them up. Or maybe they tried, and failed, to find the two of you, spent weeks searching before being forced to give up and leave in defeat. It’s impossible to tell one way or the other. Because the only information you have available to you is what you see in the sky above, and the clouds aren’t very talkative. And so the days pass, you and Revissa wrapped up side by side, held taut by the hateful strength of innumerable blades of grass. Because everything on this planet is made of ghost matter, there’s no need for the verdant tendrils to tend to your needs, to worry about giving you food or water. Though you get plenty of the latter whenever it happens to rain. You used to always wish you had more time to just sit back, relax, and enjoy the world moving on around you. Well, lucky for you, you’ve finally gotten that wish. And even better, you’ll continue to be able to live out that fantasy, now and forever. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]There’s not really much else you can do but stare. Look up at the sky and imagine being as free as the clouds that lazily drift by on the wind. But instead you’re here, wrapped up in bandages made of grass and firmly tied to the earth. Escape is impossible, the prospect of rescue your only hope. As the hours drift on by, you find your mind drifting away, lazily following the movements in the sky. Which is why you notice the familiar silhouette of your ship the Lucky Break coming in from the east. It lands on the wide patch of grass and lowers a loading ramp for your allies to come out in search for you. The grassy deathtrap tries its best to capture them all and consume the ship as well, but a fireball spell from Jyumon releases its hold on them and teaches the meadow there are worse things than unwanted feet trampling the grass. Unfortunately, even though they do manage to save you, the data collection device was destroyed in the scuffle. And without it, the mission is impossible to complete. So you are forced to leave the planet with your tail between your legs, free and healthy, but with a terrible fear of grass that will make you unable to ever mow a lawn again. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]You slide against a tree as you bring up the holo-map on your comm device, trying to figure out some other way to get to the other side of the forest. At this point, you’re half-considering heading back to your ship and seeing if you can’t rig up some kind of parachute system for a fly-over. Because no matter how you slice it, you can’t see another viable path. Eventually you groan in annoyance, flicking off the map display to see if Revissa has any other ideas. But as you look around, you’re surprised to find that she’s nowhere in sight. “Revissa?” You call out for her, hoping she’s just wandered off again to inspect some interesting flowers. But you don’t get any reply. Now your heart starts pounding in your chest. You were only distracted for a few minutes. There’s no way she’s gone so far in that short amount of time that she wouldn’t even be able to hear you. “Revissa!!” This time you yell as loudly as you can, scaring some birds away from branches on a nearby tree. Still nothing. Where could she have gone? Is she hurt? Is she hiding? Or worse, did one of the many terrible dangers you’ve encountered in these blasted woods snatch her up? Now you start moving frantically, poking your head between trees, searching the ground for tracks, checking for any snapped twigs that might indicate a path someone took to leave the area. But you can’t find anything. So you increase your search radius, moving out of the small clearing you’d been waiting in, checking for any signs of life at all. It’s only after a solid ten minutes that you finally notice something, not with your eyes, but your ears. It’s a soft sound, barely audible, hardly more than a whisper, but you hear it. It’s the sound of someone’s voice, grunting and moaning. As fast as you’re able, you rush towards the noise, pushing past a tight cluster of tangled brambles to emerge in front of a large tree. You’re sure the sound came from here. And in fact, you can still hear it. But where’s its source? Looking around, you eventually notice something out of place on the ground near the tree’s base, so you move over to look. What you find are torn bits of cloth. *Familiar* cloth. White and gold and green, and a little lacquered wooden moth emblem, the symbol of Un-Rama, the forest spirit Revissa worships. It’s your wife’s clothing! But if that’s here, then where is she? At this point, two things happen in quick succession. The first is that you look up, and finally discover the source of the noise. Your wife is there, suspended between the upper branches of the trees, completely naked, save for the tight reams of spider silk expertly woven around her shapely figure. It’s so snug it’s practically a second layer of skin, accenting her lovely curves in a way that would be deeply erotic if you had a chance to appreciate it. The reason her voice was so muffled was the ball-shaped gag of webbing forced between her lips, sealing off anything other than a few plaintive grunts. As you make eye contact with her, she looks down at you desperately, pupils darting furiously towards the second thing that happens. It’s over so quickly, you barely even have time to process it. All you see are four dark shapes creeping past your peripheral vision - a set of spindly black spider legs. Each of them has a stringy length of silk dangling from the tip, and as they curl around you in unison each of them finds a part of your body to expertly restrain. You’re captured in moments. You don’t even have time to reach for your sword before the weapon is pulled from your back. A moment later, the blaster on your belt is gone too, along with your pants, boots, shirt, and cape. Because in addition to the four silk-spinning legs wrapping you up, there are also four more legs armed with sharp pincers at the end of them, able to slice through your clothing like a hot knife through butter. In less than a second you’re naked, and a second after that every limb has been completely plastered with silk, cutting off even the most basic of movements. Then you’re spun around, so quickly you can’t even see what’s got you, other than a few flashes of red skin and black chiton. Before your head stops spinning, you feel something force your lips open and glue a gob of sticky webbing into your mouth, gumming up your tongue and making anything other than a helpless mewling wail impossible to vocalize. And once your voice is cut off, the gag is fixed in place around the back of your head, and you’re hoisted up into the air, suspended above your equally defeated wife. (link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1104539419848999012/F51_MelfyRevissaWebbed4_by_Kenogasa.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Kenogasa(click-replace: "Art by Kenogasa")[https://www.deviantart.com/kenogasa]] (set: $picF51 to true) In less than a minute, you’ve been transformed from capable explorer to utterly powerless damsel, as much a prisoner as Revissa. You can’t move a muscle, can’t make a sound, can’t even twitch your tail. You’re trapped, completely and utterly, and the culprit who so effortlessly defeated you is standing below you with a satisfied look on her face. [[See the face of your new owner->FA06B]] ]Thick, wavy black hair. Light, reddish skin, dotted with scale-like clumps of chitinous plating. A curvaceous body, an amazing figure, two arms, two legs, and eight spider-like appendages protruding from her back. Her eyes gleam with a predator’s intensity, fixed squarely on the two of you, appreciating the lovely flies who have wandered into the spider’s parlor. (link:"Check her out")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1093794121384198174/F46_SpiderPrincessTula_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF46 to true) “I knew there was something wandering all over my forest,” she says, lazily tugging on a silk line to make the two of you vibrate. “But if I’d known you were such cuties I’d have tracked you down much sooner. Just what *were* you doing, poking around in so many places?” You should have known better. Spending so much time without making any progress, it was only a matter of time before something took notice. That something is a gorgeous spider lady, and now the two of you are utterly helpless and completely at her mercy. You strain fruitlessly against the impossibly tight webbing, finding not even an iota of leeway to squirm out of it. There’s no escaping from this one. Idly, the spider-woman digs through the equipment she liberated from your body. She notices your comm device, and smashes it against a tree, making sure no one uses it to track you. Then she finds the data collection device, and, not knowing what it is, sets it down on the ground then vaporizes it with your hand-held blaster. So much for your mission. But that’s the least of your worries right now. “Hmm…” she says lazily, looking up towards are bundled up prizes once she’s finished combing through your stuff. “Now what to do with my new toys…” You make a plaintive mewling sound into your gag, but it does nothing towards convincing her to let you go. If anything, the absolute helplessness in your eyes only confirms the idea she has for your fate. “I know! You two love wandering around so much… so how would you like to tour the galaxy? As product demonstrations.” At the moment, it’s impossible to tell what she means by that. But as your new life starts to unfold, you’re about to find out. [[Go on tour->FA06C]] ] Over time, you come to know who your owner is, and what plans she has for Spectra I. Her name is Tula, and she’s a Spider Princess - a half-breed offshoot of the aggressively territorial Spider Queen race. The queens are powerful arachnid hybrids, bearing the upper torso of a beautiful woman and the lower body of a massive spider, and they love nothing more than to conquer isolated colonies or undefended planets and turn them into slave territories. Prisoners are kept in check with cocoons made of their natural silken fibers, wrapped up tight and either put on display or relegated to sex toys in their harem halls. But various complicated feats of chemistry, biology, and engineering are required to keep their cocooned captives fresh and enticing, forming a whole industry around the maintenance of permanently silk-bound prisoners. Tula is hoping to disrupt the whole market by introducing a new product. She’s tending to a fruit orchard here on the planet, fruits which, when consumed, confer the properties of ‘ghost matter’ to the silk produced by spider-kind. In other words, instead of all that intricate and messy science, spider queens can instead eat a piece of fruit once a day and their webbing will be strong and sturdy, and will keep those wrapped up in it stuck in indefinite stasis. No need to feed or care for them, no need to even worry about the frailties of old age - so long as they’re wrapped, the slaves won’t need any maintenance at all. To sell her product, she’ll have to attend some technology expos, and she’ll need some ‘floor models’ to show off the wondrous power of ‘ghost silk’, as she calls it. You and Revissa are going to be those models. And so, she bundles you up, nice and tight, and packs you away in some shipping crates, to only be brought out when you’re being used to hawk her merchandise. During sales events, you and Revissa are strung up in the middle of a show floor, where prospective buyers are encouraged to skitter up and examine you both to their heart’s content. Grope you, finger you, pleasure you, poke and prod you with scientific instruments, confirm the reality that so long as you’re cocooned, you won’t ever need any kind of medical attention. Suffice it to say, her product is a hit, sending her all over the galaxy on increasingly lucrative tours. Over time, her business grows and grows, such that after a year or so, she’s gained enough notoriety that she no longer needs to prove herself by utilizing product displays. And so you and Revissa spend longer and longer increments helplessly stuffed inside a shipping crate, as consistently helpless as the moment you were first caught. As the years go by, your days on showroom floors dwindle to barely nothing, making you wonder if you’re eventually just going to be confined to the back of some musty storage closet forever. But your fortunes finally turn on one of the rare days where you’re out on display. [[Discover a new routine->FA06D]] Spider Queen sales events are, naturally, mainly populated either by Spider Queens, or by their representatives, usually their slave race of Marsyhan foot soldiers. So it’s no surprise that you don’t encounter any familiar faces during your times on display. But one day, towards the end of a shift, one happens to show up. “Huh? Melfy? Is that you?” You’re currently wrapped up against a tall metal pole, arranged vertically, with Revissa wrapped on the other end behind you. You make a muffled ‘mmph’ of recognition as a woman from your past skitters into view. She’s a Spider Queen named Azkumo, and you used to date her, many years ago. Unlike most of her kind she was actually quite gentle and loving, but that wasn’t exactly what you wanted in an arachnid girlfriend, so you broke up with her. Last you’d heard, she’d gotten into the film business, trying to make it as a holo actress. Her eyes drift over your cocooned form, lingering on your bare breasts which are poking out from the silken wrapping. She gives them an idle squeeze as she flags down the sales representative. It’s been ages since Tula herself ran the booth at a convention; now she’s a big-time CEO, and she delegates responsibility to other Spider Princesses in her employ. The rep quickly skitters over, and immediately gets a star-struck look in her eye as she recognizes your ex. Apparently in the time since you’ve been captured, her film career has actually managed to take off. “How much for the model?” she asks, nodding in your direction. “O-oh… I’m terribly sorry ma’am… they’re not exactly for sale. The products are the ghost-silk fruits…” “Yes, but I want to buy her,” she insists, gently stroking your tail. “How much?” There’s a panicked grunt from behind you as Revissa voices her displeasure at the thought of being separated from you. Azkumo seems to pick up on it. “Fine, for both of them,” she continues, without missing a beat. When the sales rep remains flabbergasted, she waves a credit chip in front of her. “Let’s say 10,000 apiece. Deal?” She doesn’t wait for a reply, simply tapping her chip against the rep’s transaction pad and letting the payment go through. And then she hoists you down off the pole and cradles you lovingly in her arms. (link:"Snuggle")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1104539420222312468/F52_MelfyAzkumoSpiderSnuggles_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF52 to true) “What was it you said, all those years ago?” she says, with a devilish gleam in her eye. “I wasn’t aggressive enough? Too docile and loving?” Her finger slips itself past the webbing and between your thighs. “Well… I’ve learned a lot since then… and I’ll be happy to be every bit the domineering mistress you wanted from me.” Without another word to the rep, she slides you onto her back, then does the same for Revissa. You and your wife can only exchange panicked glances, unsure if this development is good or bad for your prospects of freedom. For her part, Azkumo doesn’t give you another word as she skitters back to the starship hangar and loads you both onto her personal space yacht. Being a holo-star has its perks, after all. (if: $candy is false)[[[Enter the lap of luxury->FD06X]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Enter the lap of luxury->FD06Y]]] ] Spider Queens, like Elvaans, have no upper limit on their lifespans. Especially ones like Azkumo, who clearly has some elvaan blood somewhere in her heritage, as evidenced by her dark gray skin tone (pureblooded Queens are a bright red). And so she remains a big-name holo star for a full century and a half before she finally retires, settling down in a palatial mansion on a small moon she owns herself. You and Revissa remain cocooned the entire time, never given even an ounce of freedom. But at least you’re treated better than you were before. You live out your days wrapped up in one of Azkumo’s bedrooms, your sexual needs tended to by her serving staff, who make sure to stimulate you both to completion at least five times a day. As for your mistress, she spends less than half her time at her home, though when she does she always makes sure to give you some attention. You’re not alone in that regard. It turns out she’s collected every single one of her exes (and their romantic partners, if they’d found one since breaking up with her), and each one gets a dedicated bedroom to spend their days in. Becoming a star also toughened her up, opened up the possessiveness her species is known for, though at least she is still loving and affectionate to her slaves rather than cruel. And that is what you are - a slave. It’s a step up from being a floor model for a line of silk products, but it doesn't give you any more freedom or agency in your life. As advertised, Tula’s ghost silk keeps you young, fresh, and healthy for as long as you remain wrapped in it, without even a single fiber ever getting severed or loosened. Which means, as the years stretch on endlessly, you’ll never have to worry about anything other than when the next time your owner will come in to give you some loving. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]Spider Queens, like Elvaans, have no upper limit on their lifespans. Especially ones like Azkumo, who cleary has some elvaan blood somewhere in her heritage, as evidenced by her dark gray skin tone (pureblooded Queens are a bright red). And so she remains a big-name holo star for a full century and a half before she finally retires, settling down in a palatial mansion on a small moon she owns herself. You and Revissa remain cocooned the entire time, never given even an ounce of freedom. But at least you’re treated better than you were before. You live out your days wrapped up in one of Azkumo’s bedrooms, your sexual needs tended to by her serving staff, who make sure to stimulate you both to completion at least five times a day. As for your mistress, she spends less than half her time at her home, though when she does she always makes sure to give you some attention. You’re not alone in that regard. It turns out she’s collected every single one of her exes (and their romantic partners, if they’d found one since breaking up with her), and each one gets a dedicated bedroom to spend their days in. Becoming a star also toughened her up, opened up the possessiveness her species is known for, though at least she is still loving and affectionate to her slaves rather than cruel. And if she’d had her way, that’s what you’d have remained for the rest of your lives. But thankfully, you finally get a reprieve after years of captivity. The Star Scout candy you swallowed so long ago proves to still be functional, sending out a distress call to the surrounding areas of space. A passing scout one day happens to pick up on it and land on the planet, and successfully manages to negotiate with Azkumo for your freedom. Though only on the condition you and Revissa volunteer as ‘background cocoons’ in independent holo-films for at least two weeks out of every year. Finally free, you find yourselves in an entirely unfamiliar galaxy that’s changed immeasurably since you were first captured. That’s a whole new story in and of itself, but, needless to say, you’ve both failed your original mission. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]](if: $inship is true)[You return to the ship, and see that the security drones are still deactivated, allowing you to head inside at your leisure.](else-if: $seenship is true)[You return to the ship, and find those security drones still patrolling around the cargo bay entrance. It doesn’t look like they are going to just let you pass.](else: )[Since you’re here to gather information, the ship seems like the best bet. Technically, it could be considered trespassing to just stroll onto another person’s vessel like this, but aren’t you all kind of trespassing on this planet already? Besides, the loading ramp is down, so it doesn’t look like they’re in high security mode or anything. As you approach the ship, you can’t help but be appreciative of its design. Unlike your Lucky Break, which has just an inelegant, boxy appearance, the Knottie craft is sleek and stylish, even for a cargo ship. Knottie vessels are known for their signature squid-like shape, with the main ‘head’ at the front where the cargo and crew sit, and the long, mobile ‘tendrils’ at the back. Though Knottie vessels are not the fastest or the strongest in the galaxy, they are absolutely the most maneuverable, thanks in no small part to the thruster arrays positioned all along the ‘tendrils’, each like the sucker on an octopus's arm. It makes sense that this would be their priority, since the signature weapon on Knottie starships are their ‘energy nets’. Basically, they fight by releasing long lines of electro-plasmic discharge in tight rings around enemy ships, literally tying them up with highly reactive material that fries propulsion, weapons, and guidance systems. Once a ship is disabled, they love to board the enemy vessel and tie up its crew the same way they did the ship. Well, let’s just hope that if you do get tied up here that it’s with some nice, soft ropes and not electro-plasma. Once you finish musing on the marvels of Knottie engineering, you begin to walk up the loading ramp. But as you do, you see several hovering security drones lying in wait just off to the side. They are small, flat devices, about the size of a fist, but you know that doesn’t mean they can’t swiftly incapacitate you if they set their programming to it. Which means that they likely aren’t going to be welcoming to visitors.] (if: $ros is true)[“Sorry, they’re programmed not to let in anything that doesn’t scan as a Knottie,” Ros’eela explains. “Hang tight and I’ll pop in and see if the ship’s security cameras didn’t pick anything up that could be useful.” You and Revissa nod, and let her head in, unmolested by the drones. And then you wait. For five minutes… ten minutes… and then a half hour. There’s no sign of her returning. Did something happen? Maybe you should go check on her…] (if: $ros is true)[(set: $ros to false)(set: $rosleft to true)](set: $seenship to true) (if: $inship is true)[[[Head inside->FC02H]]](else: )[[[Try to sneak past->FC02AA]] [[Try to destroy the drones->FC02AB]] (if: $dronetalk is true)[](else: )[[[Announce yourself to the drones->FC02AC]]] (if: $rosleft is true)[[[Keep waiting for Roseela->FC02AE]]]] [[Turn back->FC02E]] You head over to the living structures to see if you can’t find anyone to chat with. There’s plenty you want to know about this place that can only be answered by the people who set it up. The pre-fab buildings were clearly built for efficiency rather than aesthetics, made out of interchangeable parts that look as if they snap together like children’s building blocks. Unlike the spaceship, which clearly has a Knottie design, the buildings have no distinctive style markings to them and could just have easily housed orcs, kemomi, or elvaans (okay, maybe not elvaans. Most wouldn’t be caught dead living somewhere so drab). Peering through a window, you find a barracks-like bedroom that could probably house four women at a time, though currently there’s no one visible living inside of it. It honestly does look like the whole place is deserted. If you wanted, you could spend the time to search each building individually - it doesn’t look like the doors are locked at all. Or if you think there’s nothing more useful to be gained here, you could check out someplace else in the outpost. (set: $seenbuildings to true) [[Explore the first building->FC02BA]] [[Explore the second building->FC02BB]] [[Explore the third building->FC02BC]] [[Explore the fourth building->FC02BD]] [[Explore the fifth building->FC02BE]] [[Explore the sixth building->FC02BF]] [[Look someplace else->FC02E]] Given the reason why Revissa wanted to come here in the first place, it seems prudent to take a look at the giant flower. Presumably, those amber chunks scattered around it are related to the sticky resin you saw coming from the tree near the river. However, as the two of you get closer, the truth of those glistening golden rocks becomes apparent. (link:"Look inside")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[(if: $rosamber is true)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1104996719499952190/F56_AmberTrio_by_ZeroTwo95.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF56 to true)](else: )[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1104996719172800522/F55_AmberDuo_by_ZeroTwo95.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF55 to true)] You have to stifle a gasp when you notice it. Though the hardened chunks of sap are mostly opaque, when you get close enough you can see past the surface to what lies inside. Each piece of resin holds a woman trapped inside of it, all of them bearing the distinctive head tendrils of the Knottie species. The women are nude, and have expressions on their faces ranging from surprised, to relaxed, to aroused. None of them are moving, which isn’t surprising, though at least they don’t appear to be in any immediate danger. (if: $rosamber is true)[However, among them is Ros’eela, you can’t help but notice. Which means that something must have trapped her here immediately after she left.] (if: $ros is true)[ “These… are my co-workers,” Ros’eela says, walking up in front of the amber hunk and looking inside. “This one is Nabri. And that’s In’Deliab. Crap, we were training together just the other day!” You put a hand on her shoulder. “I’m sure there’s some way to get them out of there,” you say quietly, glancing towards your wife for her input. ] “They’re alive,” Revissa confirms, laying her hand on the smooth surface of one of the amber stones. “This is made of the same Ghost Matter as the rest of the stuff on this planet, so they’ll be safe and healthy for as long as they’re in there.” That’s a relief. Though it doesn’t answer the question of how they got trapped in the first place. Was it some kind of industrial accident? Or… is there something more sinister at play here… “Can they be freed?” you ask, casting a suspicious eye around the area for any signs of danger. Revissa shakes her head. “It’s… really strong stuff, I am pretty sure. Conventional weapons would be useless against it. But maybe the Squira priestesses of Del Thora would be able to do something. They make use of a Sacred Sap in their rituals that has similar properties.” On the one hand, they’re not stuck forever. On the other, it means that there’s probably no tools you have in your arsenal here that can rescue anyone caught in the stuff. So you definitely need to be diligent about finding what did this. “Any clues about how this happened to them?” you ask. “If there were any storage jugs around or something I would maybe guess there was some kind of industrial accident, but there’s nothing here… other than this giant flower…” Too late do you realize the source of the threat, before it already starts to reveal itself. You hear the rustle of leaves, smell the sweet scent of potent pollen, and see the massive leaves unfurl to reveal the culprit of the Knotties’ entrapment. (if: $ros is true)[[[Meet Petal->FC02CC]]](else: )[[[Meet Petal->FC02CA]]] ] (if: $knottiedata is true)[You return to the site of the construction equipment. Revissa still seems mad about it, but she’s all dino’d out for the time being.](else-if: $seenharvesting is true)[You return to the site of the construction equipment. It’s still here, and Revissa still seems mad about it. If you don’t step in, she’s probably going to start smashing it.](else: )[The harvesting equipment seems worth investigating. Maybe by looking it over, you’ll get a better idea about how the Knotties are running their operation. You and Revissa move through the camp towards the work site, trying to remain silent, even though there doesn’t seem to be any activity or movement. As you get closer, the nature of the equipment becomes more apparent. There’s some kind of saw apparatus that looks to be purposed for cutting down trees and shaping them into uniformly sized logs. Another device is processing and purifying the tree sap you had seen earlier, pushing it through large vats that filter out any excess material from the liquid. Yet another machine makes your skin crawl, since it features a conveyor that seems purposed for sending animal carcasses into a chamber that cleans and tans the material into usable leather. With each machine you examine, Revissa grows more and more upset, until she comes to the last one in the line and points at it accusingly. “I don’t even know what this one does, but whatever it is, I’m sure it’s disrespectful!” she yells. “Think of all those poor animals!” You do your best to keep your mouth shut. After all, as a kemomi, meat is an important part of your diet, and you never think too hard about where the stuff you buy comes from. Sure, most of it is probably lab-grown, but you’ve been known to splurge every once in a while after a nice payday on a big, juicy, naturally-made steak. Either way, it looks like Revissa is about to start getting violent with this equipment. If you don’t lead her away now, she’s probably going to cause some property damage. (set: $seenharvesting to true)] (if: $knottiedata is true)[[[Head back->FC02E]]](else-if: $ros is true)[[[Revissa Smash!->FC02DE]] [[Gently convince her to reconsider->FC02DD]] ](else: )[[[Revissa Smash!->FC02DA]] [[Gently convince her to reconsider->FC02DC]] ] You know better than to get between your wife and a self-righteous rampage. And so you stand aside as she waves her staff around and channels her nature magic into a transformation with incredible destructive force! Before your eyes, you see her body shift, growing to a massive size as powerful scales ripple along her skin and a fearsome roar echoes from her throat. She’s pulled out the big guns this time, changing herself into a mighty T-Rex! As a terrible thunder lizard, she is almost twelve feet tall, all sense of humanoid attractiveness abandoned in exchange for the capacity to wreak massive property damage. Unlike some of her other transformations, this one comes with some significant drawbacks. Namely, that she does not retain her intelligence when she is a dino, nor is it easy for her to keep hold on the structure of the spell. Despite her size, a single strong hit can break her concentration and cause her to turn back into a lovely deer - though luckily for her, there doesn’t appear to be anything nearby that can cause her any damage. And so, she gets to work. If you had popcorn, you would start munching on it. Standing a good deal away from the carnage, you watch as she stomps and chomps, slices and dices, grinding all the machines to dust over the course of about ten minutes. Only once everything is reduced to scrap and slag does she finally return to her adorable normal self, coming out of the transformation both exhausted yet exhilarated. “Take that!” she yells, kicking a piece of sparking machinery off into the forest. On its way, however, it clunks loudly against one final device that hitherto had escaped her wrath. “Looks like you missed one,” you say, looking the equipment over. Unlike the other things, the purpose of this last gizmo is not immediately evident. All it looks like is a small circular platform, maybe three feet wide, with two long metal poles sticking up from the sides. She smirks as she sizes it up. “Seems pretty flimsy,” she concludes. “What do you say? Wanna put those muscles to use and help me smash it with our own two hands?” How could you say no to a smile like that? And so you join her in walking up onto the platform. You’re about to take hold of one of the metal poles to try prying it off when a loud robotic voice suddenly echoes from the machine’s base. “PRESSURE PLATE ACTIVATED,” it drones. “ANALYZING MATERIAL. DESIGNATION - HUMANOID. TWO SUBJECTS. BEGINNING PACKAGING PROCESS.” Wait… packaging? Does that mean this device is used to bundle up the harvested materials and place them into containers for shipping. Oh crap, that means– “ACTIVATING PARALYSIS CHARGE,” the machine announces, before the base you are both standing on begins to vibrate with electricity. You both only have just enough time to realize the grave error you have made before it becomes entirely too late to avert it. A powerful surge of energy rushes through both of your bodies, completely cutting off any motor functions. The result is the two of you trapped in place, quivering from electric shock, unable to move, speak, or escape what is about to come. “BEGINNING PACKAGING PROCESS. REMOVING EXCESS OBSTRUCTIONS.” A laser shines from the tip of the two poles, moving in an arc over your helpless figures. And wherever it touches, clothing vaporizes, destroying all your weapons and gear. You’re both left naked and exposed on the platform as it enters the next phase of your folly. “ADJUSTING POSITIONING FOR LONG-TERM STORAGE.” The platform vibrates again, delivering a surge of energy that jump-starts your muscles, forcing the two of you to take jerky steps closer to one another. You press against each other tightly, arms shakily shifting so that you are intimately holding hands. “LOADING ORGANIC CONTAINMENT TAPE. BEGIN SPOOLING.” There is a whir from beneath you as the platform starts to rotate, at the same time that several rolls of black duct tape are loaded onto the long poles. The adhesive ends are stuck onto your skin, causing the tape to wind around you over and over, moving up and down to bind you up like a couple of love-struck mummies. (link:"Get wrapped")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1104947564635242617/F54_MelfyRevissaTapeMachine_by_ZeroTwo95.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF54 to true) You can’t even make a sound of protest as the machine does its work, a single coil looping around your heads to force your lips together. Tighter and tighter it presses, squishing your breasts into each other, covering up your face, your tail, your legs, your feet, concealing every inch of your naked skin as it finishes up the first layer and gets started on the second. At this point you’re entirely cut off from the outside world, shrouded in complete darkness, unable to even effectively hear since your floppy ears have been pressed down against the top of your head. Mostly you just feel the vibrations as a third, then a fourth layer of tape is wound up around you, followed after that by some kind of spray that seems to be forming a lacquer-like seal over your impromptu prison. Knotties are known for being fastidious when it comes to bondage, always going the extra mile to ensure the utter impossibility of escape of those subjected to their cultural forte, and it would seem their technology shares that attention to detail. When the machine stops spinning the two of you are so firmly bound up that the very idea of getting out of it is laughable. Instead, you just get released from the device’s grip and tip over helplessly, dropping into a waiting storage crate that is perfectly sized to fit your expertly packaged bodies. [[Get shipped->FC02DB]] ] It takes some doing, but eventually you talk your wife down from going on a rampage. Or rather, you promise her that you *will* allow her to smash things up… later. Better to take your time understanding the intricacies of what is going on in this camp, really get to the bottom of everything before making your move. And besides, you still don’t know what happened to the workers here. And so, that crisis averted… at least for now, you resolve to explore elsewhere in search of answers. [[Check out another part of the outpost->FC02E]] It takes some doing, but eventually you talk your wife down from going on a rampage. Or rather, you promise her that you *will* allow her to smash things up… later. Better to take your time understanding the intricacies of what is going on in this camp, really get to the bottom of everything before making your move. And besides, you still don’t know what happened to the workers here. For a moment, you think that things are settled now. But then Revissa just can’t help herself but to aim a snarky quick Ros’eela’s way. “Maybe to your people, the only spirituality is found in bondage,” she grumbles. “But for me, I find meaning in nature itself.” That, unfortunately, gets the two of them going into a heated debate about the virtues of each of their cultures, an argument that, after the first ten minutes, you realize isn’t going to end anytime soon. And so, with a sigh, you flop down against the side of one of the machines and keep yourself out of it, taking a moment to appreciate the sights and sounds of the forest around you. After all, you owe it to Revissa to take in that thing which she wants to protect. It is, admittedly, very beautiful. The color of the trees, the sound of scurrying animals, the feel of the grass against your feet, and the sweet, cloying smell of pollen wafting through the air. Actually… that last one really is quite engrossing. A thick, invigorating scent, one that seems to linger in your nostrils when you breathe it in, that flows through your body and fills you with a strange sense of warmth. No… more than warmth. It’s more like… a desire. An imperative. Yes, that’s what it is. It grips you with a surprising amount of power, forces you into a dreamy daze of contentment and arousal. And it seems the others felt it too. Revissa and Ros’eela have stopped arguing and started kissing, falling on top of each other and rolling in the grass as they furiously make out. Full of desire, you can’t help but throw yourself into the fray as well, knocking Ros’eela aside to monopolize Revissa for yourself. The pink Knottie seems upset at first, but eventually allows herself to relax and wander off in a daze, heading towards the source of that alluring smell. You and Revissa spend a good five minutes necking before you, too, find yourselves drawn in the same direction, walking in a dreamy stupor towards the intoxicating aroma. (set: $rosamber to true) [[Find the source->FC02G]] You know better than to get between your wife and a self-righteous rampage. And so you stand aside as she waves her staff around and channels her nature magic into a transformation with incredible destructive force! Before your eyes, you see her body shift, growing to a massive size as powerful scales ripple along her skin and a fearsome roar echoes from her throat. She’s pulled out the big guns this time, changing herself into a mighty T-Rex! As a terrible thunder lizard, she is almost twelve feet tall, all sense of humanoid attractiveness abandoned in exchange for the capacity to wreak massive property damage. Unlike some of her other transformations, this one comes with some significant drawbacks. Namely, that she does not retain her intelligence when she is a dino, nor is it easy for her to keep hold on the structure of the spell. Despite her size, a single strong hit can break her concentration and cause her to turn back into a lovely deer - and unluckily for her, Ros’eela seems none to keen about standing by while she wrecks her people’s equipment. “Woah… hey, calm down there!” she yells, making what you would have thought to have been a rather foolish gambit, running right in front of the rampaging dino as she starts chomping at one of the machines. But it seems you underestimated the resourceful Knottie, because she manages to divert Revissa’s destructive tantrum with the use of a sturdy piece of wire, using her acrobatic skills honed as a slave dancer to leap and tumble around her legs without getting smushed. As she goes she wraps the wire around Revissa’s monstrous limbs, pulling taut in such a way to send her tumbling to the ground. When she impacts she loses her concentration on her spell, re-forming into her normal lovely self, albeit now she’s on her back and bundled up in an awkward hog-tie. Honestly… you’re more impressed than upset. You’ve never seen anyone incapacitate Revissa so quickly once she’d gone into dino mode. But you’re not about to let the pink lady get the last word in over your wife, so you helpfully draw your sword and sever the ropes keeping her bound. “Why’d you stop me!” Revissa snarls. You halfway think she’s going to cast the same spell again to resume her rampage. “Are you forgetting that I work here!” Ros’eela yells back. “If I just stood by and watched I’d get chewed out by my boss… err… not that she seems to be around here right now.” Sure enough, the camp remains totally empty. “It… really is weird,” the Knottie continues. “She was always standing around here, overseeing the machinery and updating inventory logs on her data pad. But now she’s… woah hey, wait.” She notices something in the grass and picks it up. “This… *is* her data pad,” she muses. “That lady was practically glued to this thing. Something crazy must have happened if she just dropped it like that.” And so the mystery deepens. But it doesn’t seem like you’ll find any more clues in this area, so it’s best to keep looking elsewhere. Revissa seems to have calmed down a bit now… though as you double back you see her turn around and eye that equipment with a ferocious gleam in her eye… (set: $knottiedata to true) [[Look someplace else->FC02E]] You and Revissa are so tightly bundled up that any form of movement is flatly impossible. The most you can do is vibrate helplessly as your mummified forms are fitted into the storage crate, squirming pointlessly as some metal clamps shut down around your figure to prevent any future shifting of position. This leaves you with nothing to do but wonder how the hell you could possibly get out of this. Though, now that you think about it, doesn’t the tape smell a bit like the tree resin you found on your way over here? Is the adhesive locally sourced? That would mean the tape has the properties of the planet’s unique Ghost Matter - namely, that you could be kept wrapped up indefinitely without the need of food, water, or other health services. You wouldn’t even age a day! “HEALTH SCAN COMPLETE. SUBJECTS ONE AND TWO, GHOST MATTER PROTOCOLS CONFIRMED. NO FURTHER INTERACTION NECESSARY. INFORMING COMMAND OF PACKAGING STATUS… Well, that confirms what you had just figured out all on your own. And at least someone is being informed of what’s happened here. Hopefully the Knotties won’t be too upset with Revissa destroying all their equipment… “....ORDERS RECEIVED. COMMAND DECISION: INITIATE MAXIMUM PUNISHMENT PROTOCOLS. LOCKING CONTAINMENT UNIT. LOCK UNLEASH METHODS: NONE. CONTAINMENT DURATION: PERMANENT. NEXT OBJECTIVE: RELOCATE CONTAINMENT UNIT TO PLACE IT WILL NEVER BE FOUND. Wait… what? A little bit of property damage and they’re going to lock you away… forever? And hide you someplace no one will ever find you? You’d love to voice your opinion on that matter to the packaging machine, but you’re not capable of making any sounds at all. So all the two of you can do is wriggle and moan uselessly as some hovering drones appear in the air and float down, inserting a data transfer wire into your storage container to inform it what needs to be done next. The lid snaps shut, and you hear a series of powerful locks snap into place. The two of you are thus plunged into absolute darkness, with no way to communicate other than plaintive grunts and groans. Then you feel the box rumble and shake, presumably being lifted off the ground by those same droids, as it gets carried through the air to places unknown. (if: $candy is false)[[[INITIATE PROTOCOL: ETERNAL IMPRISONMENT->FC02AX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[INITIATE PROTOCOL: ETERNAL IMPRISONMENT->FC02AY]]] You have no idea where you’re being taken, other than that it is, presumably, someplace on the same planet. There’s no way to tell, since you’re unable to see outside your storage container, nor can you really hear anything beyond your own voices. All you have to go on is the various vibrations and shifts in positioning the box goes through as it is loaded up onto some kind of transport and taken far, far away. It’s only when you feel yourself being dropped, then a sense of bobbing up and down for a moment before you feel downwards descent that you figure it out. All of that would be consistent with… water? Your heart sinks just like your body as you realize the drones have decided to secure your captivity by dropping your prison into the deep ocean. You feel yourself sinking for what feels like an hour before the box finally comes to a halt, resting at a slightly skewed angle from what must be the uneven ground at the very bottom of the sea. This is absurd. Why would the drones be programmed to dispose of you in this way? You at least deserve a trial, or a chance to make your case in front of someone! But you get no more input, no response to your helpless moans of protest. There’s nothing the two of you can do but settle into your new, unending life of captivity. You’re not sure if you should be thankful or upset that the cargo container you’ve been sealed in is so incredibly sturdy. It seems totally resilient to the intense pressures of the deep ocean, not springing any leaks or bending or buckling in the slightest. Under normal circumstances, if it ruptured while you were this deep you’d either drown or be crushed by the water pressure - probably both. But considering the properties of ghost matter, maybe your life would be preserved until you naturally floated back up to the surface. But that is a moot point, since the case remains firm. With bindings made of ghost matter, you’ll never need food or water, never age a day. Meaning that the two of you can persist here in utter helplessness for the rest of your long, long lives. No one ever comes to save you - how could they? How could they possibly locate you when you’ve been dumped to the bottom of the ocean. So all that’s left is to live out the ages in total darkness, with nothing but the occasional thump of a passing fish against your container as entertainment. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]You have no idea where you’re being taken, other than that it is, presumably, someplace on the same planet. There’s no way to tell, since you’re unable to see outside your storage container, nor can you really hear anything beyond your own voices. All you have to go on is the various vibrations and shifts in positioning the box goes through as it is loaded up onto some kind of transport and taken far, far away. It’s only when you feel yourself being dropped, then a sense of bobbing up and down for a moment before you feel downwards descent that you figure it out. All of that would be consistent with… water? Your heart sinks just like your body as you realize the drones have decided to secure your captivity by dropping your prison into the deep ocean. You feel yourself sinking for what feels like an hour before the box finally comes to a halt, resting at a slightly skewed angle from what must be the uneven ground at the very bottom of the sea. Thankfully, you swallowed that Star Scout homing beacon at the start of your adventure. Without it, your allies would never have been able to find you. As it stands, it still takes them three weeks of searching, moving in wider and wider arcs around the planet, before they finally get a strong enough signal to lock onto your location. And then it takes another month of negotiations and requisitions to acquire the proper equipment to dig you up from the bottom of the sea. Of course, the whole time you’re trapped, you have no idea there’s any rescue coming, so after the first few days you had settled into the prospect of this being the end for you. Lucky for you it isn’t - though sadly your mission has ended in a resounding failure. The data collection device is destroyed, and Vhaja had to pull every string she had to get someone to come to restricted space to save you - greatly damaging her career in the process. Needless to say, she won’t be asking you to go on any more missions any time soon. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]](if: $pollenlust is > 8)[In the end, it’s too much. That smell, that heavenly, bewitching smell! There’s nothing you’d rather do than be close to it, no danger too great to keep you away. A massive flower sits in the middle of the clearing, and around it are scattered several chunks of hardened resin. As you draw closer, trapped in your dreamy torpor, you get a glimpse inside the clusters, finding they each contain the frozen form of a Knottie woman.
