(if: $candy is false)[[[Relax peacefully->FC02CX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Relax peacefully->FC02CY]]] ] After losing contact with the harvesting team in the forest, the Knotties from the main camp make the understandable decision not to send any more workers to what must certainly be a highly dangerous and hazardous area. And so, all that is done is for the ship in the center of the area to be activated via remote guidance and instructed to take off, cutting the losses of all the amber-trapped victims on display around the loving and nurturing flower. Not that any of them consider this a loss. You, like all the others, are blissfully happy. The sun is shining, the grass is growing, and your life essence is nurturing it all to ensure that it continues to bloom and to thrive. You’re only vaguely conscious inside your heavy hunk of hardened honey, trapped in a dreamy, pleasant daze, satisfied just to exist. And with the ship taken off and the site abandoned, you’ll have plenty of time to enjoy it. The days pass by in a blur, soon becoming years, decades, and centuries, the forest treating you and the others like nothing more than inert rocks. You don’t mind one bit. You’ll never know what happened to the rest of your crew - maybe they got caught by something else on the planet, or maybe they searched for you but could never find you. It hardly seems to matter. After all, you’ve got everything you want right here. No pain, no worries, no stress, no conflict, just warm sunlight and fresh pollen. The lovely Petal who put you here is long gone, spreading her roots to other parts of the forest that need nutrients like you to keep it flourishing. She leaves you and the others behind, so that you can keep protecting your new home, maintain order and balance and harmony, from now until the end of your days. You wouldn’t have it any other way. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]After losing contact with the harvesting team in the forest, the Knotties from the main camp make the understandable decision not to send any more workers to what must certainly be a highly dangerous and hazardous area. And so, all that is done is for the ship in the center of the area to be activated via remote guidance and instructed to take off, cutting the losses of all the amber-trapped victims on display around the loving and nurturing flower. Not that any of them consider this a loss. You, like all the others, are blissfully happy. The sun is shining, the grass is growing, and your life essence is nurturing it all to ensure that it continues to bloom and to thrive. You’re only vaguely conscious inside your heavy hunk of hardened honey, trapped in a dreamy, pleasant daze, satisfied just to exist. And with the ship taken off and the site abandoned, you’ll have plenty of time to enjoy it. It is only many months later when you finally awaken from your torpor. As it turns out, the rest of your crew were able to track you down thanks to your Star Scout homing beacon, extracted your amber shells and kept you in storage on your starship until a solution could be found. That answer, like Revissa expected, resided on Del Thora, where the Squira priestesses were able to use techniques they had mastered with their native sacred sap to thaw you both out. After you recover, you’ll be thankful for the rescue. But for now all you have to look forward to are weeks of convalescence, both physical and mental, as you slowly regain the ability to treat yourself as a discrete entity and not just another part of the forest. Someday, you’ll travel the galaxy again, but even if you do, you’ll never get another chance to complete this particular mission. Maybe next time, you’ll be more careful about smelling the roses. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]You turn to Revissa and give her a nudge with your arm. “Hey, don’t you have some magic that works like active camouflage?” She nods. “Yes, it was very helpful during my days in the resistance.” Well, she’s not exactly fighting for the freedom of her homeworld right now, but she’s still trying to save a forest. So it’s kind of the same thing. With a wave of her staff, she shrouds the two of you in a magical aura that causes you both to take on the chameleon-like property of blending in with anything you press your body up against. Yeah, this should work! Together, you creep up the loading ramp and then press against the back wall of the cargo bay, letting the magic change your skin to the same metallic color of the wall behind you. So far, so good. And then you begin to shimmy along the edge of the bay, trying not to upset the small squadron of drones keeping watch. Unfortunately… “HEAT SOURCE DETECTED” one of the tiny drones announces in a loud robotic voice. And then a half-dozen of them break off and zoom right towards you! Well, crap. It figures they would have ways of detecting enemies rather than just visual scanners. You and Revissa both reach for your weapons, but before you get that chance, the drones are upon you. A bright red light emits from their center, sending a laser pulse up and down your bodies. “DISINTEGRATION BEAMS ACTIVATED!” they helpfully announce, just as every scrap of clothing is instantly eradicated from your bodies. That includes your sword and Revissa’s staff, making both of you sitting ducks as they continue to operate according to their programming. “CAPTURE PROTOCOLS INITIATED” they say next, whizzing around you as they begin to dispense some sort of sticky spools of tape from their bodies. The material proves to be quite adhesive and frustratingly sturdy, wrapping around your arms, legs, and lips in no time flat. (if: $rosleft is true)[[[Wait for rescue->FC02AF]]] (else: )[[[Get caught->FC02AD]]] ] Figuring that honesty is the best policy, you opt to walk right up to the top of the loading ramp and loudly make your presence known. “Hello!” you yell. “Is there anybody on the ship that is available to talk?” As expected, the security drones whizz out and begin to circle around you, flashing red lights on their surface indicating they have detected a potential threat. But thankfully, they do not immediately attack. “STATE PURPOSE OF VISIT” one announces with a prerecorded message, the robotic voice much louder than one might suspect from such a small device. You glance at Revissa, and then shrug. “We’re like to discuss your operations here in this forest, and, uh, politely suggest you reconsider your tactics so that you can, uh, be working in better harmony with the local ecosystem?” There is a long pause. “PURPOSE IRRELEVANT”, the drone eventually announces. “DEPART AT ONCE.” Well, that settles that. Maybe if you had done some recon at the main Knottie camp at the ruins, you’d have an idea of something you could say that would convince them to let you in. But as it stands you’ve got nothing. (set: $dronetalk to true) [[Try to sneak past->FC02AA]] [[Try to destroy the drones->FC02AB]] [[Turn back->FC02E]] You stand around waiting for Ros’eela to show up. Up until now, you had been able to ignore it, but staying so stationary here, with nothing else to do, that scent permeates your being, clouds your mind. And eventually, you find yourselves unable to do anything else but turn around and head towards its source, leaving the Knottie ship behind. [[Find the source->FC02G]] You’ve fought all kinds of terrible enemies throughout your career - giant monsters, wicked warlords, evil space wizards, and a good deal of murderous robots. What are a few security drones in comparison to that? Making eye contact with Revissa, you hold up three fingers for a countdown, both of you preparing your weapons for a fight. Three, two, one… go! And then you leap out together and rush to the top of the loading ramp. You have your sword drawn, and swing it in a wide arc to slice one of the security drones apart in a single sweep, while Revissa conjures a torrent of razor-sharp leaves to shred up another. Yes, it’s working! No trouble at all. “INTRUDERS DETECTED,” one of the tiny drones announces in a loud robotic voice. And then a half-dozen more of them suddenly fly out from a dark corner of the cargo bay, reinforcing the numbers of the ones you had already destroyed. There’s… a *lot* of them. They fall into formation to surround you, and a bright red light emits from their center, sending a laser pulse up and down your bodies. “DISINTEGRATION BEAMS ACTIVATED!” they helpfully announce, just as every scrap of clothing is instantly eradicated from your bodies. That includes your sword and Revissa’s staff, making both of you sitting ducks as they continue to operate according to their programming. “CAPTURE PROTOCOLS INITIATED” they say next, whizzing around you as they begin to dispense some sort of sticky spools of tape from their bodies. The material proves to be quite adhesive and frustratingly sturdy, wrapping around your arms, legs, and lips in no time flat. (link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1104947564228399135/F53_MelfyRevissaTapeBots_by_ZeroTwo95.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF53 to true) And just like that, it seems like the fight is over. (if: $rosleft is true)[[[Wait for rescue->FC02AF]]] (else: )[[[Get caught->FC02AD]]]]Well this is embarrassing. You and Revissa were both quickly and easily defeated by the security drones, stripped and bound up in no time flat. All you can do is squirm against the powerful grip of the adhesive tape, finding it impossible to sunder with brute strength alone. If only you had something sharp to cut it with! You recall the runic dagger Vhaja entrusted you with. That would do the trick! But all your gear was evaporated… or was it? Glancing to the side, you find that out of pure luck, your pack where you keep all your important adventuring supplies survived disintegration, probably because the strap holding it was vaporized before the main pouch, causing it to fall away from your body. That’s good, since the data collection device needed for the mission is in there. Along with the knife! Slowly, you start to wiggle along the ground towards your bag, wondering why the drones are letting you make it this far. Though to your surprise, when you glance upwards, you see that they appear to have gone inert. Did something switch them off? You can’t be sure, but it’s a fortunate stroke of luck that you won’t waste. Moving like a wriggling worm, you reach the bag and manage to get it open with your chin, finding the knife inside and dropping it down onto the floor. “Hrmmphhfggh?” you mutter into the tape gag over your lips, glancing at Revissa. “Hey can you help me with this?” helpfully translates the gag-talk device. With a nod, your wife squirms over as well, and together you manage to use your bodies to manipulate the knife’s blade towards the silvery tape and slice your wrists free from the bonds. The rest is simple, and soon you’ve managed to escape, though your clothing is gone. Good thing you have those matter synthesizer capsules Jyumon gave you in your bag as well. After another ten minutes you’re both dressed back up again and ready for action. Though there’s still no sign of Ros’eela. Did something happen to her? It looks like you’ll have to explore the ship to find out. ESTIMATED PROBABILITY OF ESCAPE: 0%.” (link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1105011998485401640/F62_MelfyTaped_by_StickyDuct.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by StickyDuct(click-replace: "Art by StickyDuct")[https://www.deviantart.com/stickyduct - Account deactivated]] (set: $picF62 to true) You hate to admit it, but the drone is right. Like you, she’s mummified from the feet up to the lips, with only a little window for chest and tail to poke out of. Is the adhesive locally sourced? You wouldn’t even age a day! “HEALTH SCAN COMPLETE. TARGETS ONE AND TWO, GHOST MATTER PROTOCOLS CONFIRMED. NO FURTHER INTERACTION NECESSARY. TRANSFERRING TARGETS TO LONG-TERM STORAGE UNITS.” Well, that confirms what you had just figured out all on your own. But wait… what’s this about long term storage? With surprising power for such little droids, the robots spool out one last length of tape to stick to your bodies, and then use that to hoist you both up and carry you off to a remote corner of the cargo hold. You and Revissa struggle and squirm with all your might, of course, but you make no progress at all of even loosening their hold on you. It’s abundantly clear that both of you are well and truly helpless. INFORMING COMMAND OF CAPTURE STATUS… … … ERROR. COMMUNICATIONS FAILURE. DEFAULTING TO BACKUP CONTAINMENT SUBROUTINE. LOCKING CONTAINMENT UNIT. LOCK UNLEASH METHODS: NONE. CONTAINMENT DURATION: PERMANENT. NEXT OBJECTIVE: RELOCATE CONTAINMENT UNIT TO PLACE IT WILL NEVER BE FOUND. Wait… what? One little communication error and they’re going to lock you away… forever? So all the two of you can do is wriggle and moan uselessly as the lid of the storage container snaps shut, and you hear a series of powerful locks snap into place. The two of you are thus plunged into absolute darkness, with no way to communicate other than plaintive grunts and groans. Then you feel the box rumble and shake, and get lifted up off the ground, carried through the air to places unknown. (link:"Check her out")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1105361719074750505/F65_RoseelaCarbonite_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF65 to true) Ros’eela is frozen solid, naked body nicely mounted on a rectangular frame, completely embedded into the thick mass of mottled metal. Satisfied with your ingenuity, you affix a hover-pad to Ros’eela’s body to move her, and hang her up on the wall beside the other one already there. Definitely a useful thing to have in your back pocket. And so you slip the last remaining capsule from the crate into your pouch and return to the mission. (set: $rosfreeze to true)(set: $roslatex to false)(set: $freezebomb to true) (if: $pollenlust is >= 5)[[[Make sure you installed the capsule correctly->FC02KB]]](else: )[[[Make sure you installed the capsule correctly->FC02KA]]] [[Head back->FC02E]] ]In a rare act of diligence, you decide to be extra sure you properly serviced the machine. If or when the Knotties are saved, you wouldn’t want them to be upset with you for using their equipment improperly. And so, you bring up the manual for the device on its control console and look over the maintenance protocols listed. It only takes a few minutes to go down the checklist, but the last bullet point requires you to head inside and ensure all the spray nozzles are properly cleaned of metal residue from their icy discharge. And so you pop inside and get to scrubbing, really getting in there to make sure everything is in top working order. But as you work, your foot happens to bump into something hard lodged in the back of the chamber, causing it to roll backwards and klunk against the inner wall. “Hrmm?” You put down the tool you were using to clean, bending down to pick up the offending object. It appears to be a small metal orb, about three inches in diameter, almost perfectly smooth and spherical. Puzzled, you show it to Revissa, who lays a hand on it as well. “Wait… whatever this is, it’s alive!” she exclaims. “Alive? But what could – wait! Do you think… is this the slime symbiote?!” Of course, it all makes sense. While Ros’eela was getting frozen, it must have sloughed off her body, trying to escape the grip of the icy vapors. But there was nowhere to run in the airtight capsule, so it collapsed in on itself and was encased in hardened metal, just like the Knottie. Though… as you run your fingers along it more closely, you get the sense that the coating is rather thin. A heavy impact would probably sunder the casing and free the slime monster, causing trouble for anyone nearby. That makes it a useful, albeit dangerous, tool. You stow it in your pack along with the freezium canister and head back out into the camp. (set: $frozenslime to true) [[Head back->FC02E]] As you look at the defective bondage material here in this room, a thought occurs to you. The only reason Ros’eela escaped capture by the pollen spitting plant was because she was unable to act on the impulses to head towards it while she was in the midst of her bondage training. If she had been fully mobile when her arousal was at its highest, she’d have been helpless to resist its allure, and would have ended up like all the rest of the workers at the outpost. You could activate the ropes and restrain yourselves, working through your sexual tension until you’re no longer unbearably horny, and then escape from the bindings with some of your equipment, since these malfunctioning ropes won’t destroy your gear. It’s an odd plan… but not totally insane. [[On second thought, just head back->FC02E]] [[Tie yourselves up->FC02JA]] “I just want to put it on the record that I think this is an insane idea,” Revissa offers, as you pull the bondage gear out of the sealed container. “Oh, I agree,” you say, “but some of the best ideas are the insane ones.” Your wife just rolls her eyes as you inspect the equipment. Some ropes, ball gags, and leather collars - pretty standard stuff, as far as bondage material goes. From the look of it, you can’t see any obvious flaws in the design or anything, but then again, you’re no expert in the field. “Welp, here goes nothing.” You find a button and press down on it, and immediately, the gear all springs to life. More of them catch your arms, forcing them behind your back one over the other then anchoring them to a loop secured around your waist in a box tie position. Though when you reach to remove her gag, she shakes her head and glares at you, tilting the angle of spin on her pulley to allow her to nod at the holographically projected number that illustrates the remaining time she has on her training. (if: $candy is false)[[[Continue your training->FC02FX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Continue your training->FC02FY]]] If there’s one thing this situation has going for it, it’s the crotch rope. Because it provides much-needed stimulation to your hopelessly bound body whenever you strain against the restraints, a blissful diversion from what is otherwise a long, featureless stretch of helplessness. Though at least the restraints seem to be made out of the planet’s Ghost Matter, meaning your physical needs are taken care of as you sit around in captivity. It’s hard to tell time, locked in a storage closet, but after what you estimate to be a week of useless struggling, the door eventually opens to reveal a hovering security druid. After scanning the room, it detects the three of you here, and makes an announcement in a loud, robotic voice. “COMMAND HAS DECIDED TO ABANDON THIS OUTPOST,” it communicates with machine-like impassivity. “ALL RESOURCES WILL THUS BE PUT INTO PERMANENT LOCK-DOWN.” Wait… lock-down? It’s an ignominious end to an adventure that was already rather questionable in terms of the choices you made. Because now you, your wife, and an old friend are locked away forever in a closet in an abandoned outpost, with no hope of escaping. For the first few weeks, you hold out hope that maybe the rest of your crew would somehow track you down. But as the time passes, no one ever comes. Maybe they got captured elsewhere by some other peril on this planet, or maybe they simply weren’t able to find you and were forced to leave. Either way, it seems like a single poor decision is going to be the last one you ever make, because now the rest of your life is going to be spent here, bundled up and forgotten. Of course, if you *had* known about that lever, you might have been able to muster up enough self-restraint to avoid it, but instead when Revissa starts nibbling on your ear you reach up for something to wrap your fingers around and accidentally give it a tug. And then there’s only an immense feeling of cold, the sound of clothing becoming brittle and flaking away, the hiss of steam and the hum of electronics, and then nothing at all as you’re locked into a state of suspended animation. (if: $candy is false)[[[Chill out->FC02KX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Chill out->FC02KY]]] ] Frozen as you are, you have no awareness of the passing of time. It takes another week without contact from the outpost before the main Knottie camp decides to cut its losses, activating the autopilot on the cargo ship and remotely guiding it back to their home base. The pre-fab buildings are left behind, abandoned to the elements to slowly decay over time. Your remaining crew never comes for you. Maybe they got caught by some other peril on the planet, or maybe they searched for as long as they could before eventually giving up. You’ll never know. It’s several hundred years before you’re discovered by chance by a passing explorer. The prefab buildings have mostly crumbled and withered away, reclaimed by the elements, only a few vine-choked walls remaining of the doomed outpost. But freezium doesn’t decay, so you and Revissa and the two helpless Knotties are as solid as the day you were first preserved, inert slabs of metal caked in dirt and moss. Had you been lucky, you’d have been found by a kind soul. But luck was never your strong suit. You’re found by a pirate, who sells you and the others to a private collector, where you’re mounted on the walls of her private gallery. She has no intention of ever letting you go, so she removes the display frame from the freezium slab, which also has the mechanism to thaw you out, and also coats you in some glossy sealant that makes restoration significantly more difficult. And so begins your new life as nothing but a bauble in someone’s collection, put on display without any knowledge of who you were or what you had done. In the end, one thoughtless mistake ended your entire career, erased your mark on history, and doomed you and your wife to an eternity of suspended animation. Maybe next time you’ll be more careful. In the end, one thoughtless mistake screwed up everything, though at least you avoided an eternity of suspended animation in your freezium shell. Maybe next time you’ll be more careful. From the look of it, the lab was repurposed from crew quarters, given the alcoves in the wall that look like they were once bunk beds. You think that there must have been containment fields set up to keep samples in those alcoves, but thanks to your earlier security reboot, all those fields are down. Which means the various living critters that had been kept inside are free and skittering around like wild, small animals darting every which way and clusters of bugs scurrying towards dark corners. And all of them seem to be trying to escape from one thing in particular.] At first you just think it’s some kind of puddle of oil or tar that has spilled out onto the floor. But then you see that the puddle of black gunk isn’t remaining stationary. It’s moving, flowing around the room, oozing in directions that aren’t randomly determined, but chosen with deadly purpose. A small, fuzzy woodland creature gets overtaken by the blob and coated with the thick tar, which clings to the critter like glue and forms a firm rubber shell around its body. And then the critter falls to the floor and writhes, completely encased and immobilized by the goopy menace. Not good. This thing must be some kind of slime-like predator! Leave it to the Knotties to keep something so dangerous locked up in a lab that could be released with a single accidental press of a button. “We need to do something!” Revissa yells, pulling out her staff and preparing a spell. You nod at her, attempting to draw your sword. But before your hand even curls around the hilt, the ooze monster suddenly changes direction, perhaps picking up on the sound of your voices. It flows with terrifying quickness towards the two of you, even somehow ejecting some globs of itself from its main mass at high velocity towards your bodies. You don’t even have time to process what’s happening before a gob of rubbery sludge catches you by the wrist, preventing you from getting a hold of your weapon. “Wha — grrmmphg!” Revissa yells in surprise, as a similar projectile gloms over her lips, cutting off her ability to finish casting her spell. Crap, there’s no explanation for why it targeted the two of you that way other than that this black puddle of moving tar is somehow intelligent! And that it sees the two of you as potential prey. “We need to get out of here!” you tell, using your good hand to take Revissa by the wrist and pull her back towards the door you came in through. But the slime monster is faster. It races ahead of you, sloshing its way between you and the exit, cutting off your retreat. Not good at all. Your mind races, wondering whether it would be smarter to make a run for it and try to barge past it, or back away and try to find something in the lab to help you fight it. Sadly, it becomes a moot point. Because once it has limited your movement, the slime goes in for the kill. It oozes upwards, forming itself into a kind of thin, rectangular sheet of dribbling rubber, high enough to stretch itself fully between the floor and ceiling, and then it rushes forwards. There’s nowhere to run. The room is too cramped to avoid it. It forms itself into a barrier of goop and advances, forcing both of you back against the wall. All you can do is hold your hands up in a pathetic attempt at resistance before it melds itself over you, gluing you and your wife firmly against the surface behind you. You feel a sickening splort as it molds itself in place, locking both of you inside of it and lifting you off your feet. (link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1106087800899653632/F79_MelfyRevissaWallLatex_by_ZeroTwo9S.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF79 to true) And just like that… you’ve been completely and utterly incapacitated. Your clothing and gear melt away against the monster’s rubbery grip, leaving you naked as it flows between every nook and cranny of your now-exposed bodies. You can’t move, can’t speak, can’t even see as your vision gives way to a churning black tar that blots out all light from the room around you. Now there’s absolutely nothing you can do but squirm and writhe impotently against your captor’s rubbery body, held fast and firm with no possible way to escape. (if: $candy is false)[[[Begin symbiosis->FC02IX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Begin symbiosis->FC02IY]]] ] At first, the recordings just show life as usual at the outpost. Knotties working with the heavy equipment to cut down and process the raw materials of the forest to be stored, shipped, and repurposed into bondage equipment. Revissa seethes with annoyance as she watches the trees collapse, and as captured animals are taken to the slaughter, but manages to control herself enough to not turn into a dinosaur again. Though you can tell that she’s really close to it. After a while, you notice one of the workers suddenly just put down her tools and wander off, not saying a word to her compatriots, so you ask Ros’eela to change to a different camera log to follow her path. She ends up wandering into the middle of the clearing, to the spot where you saw that giant flower surrounded by hunks of amber. However, in the recording, there’s no amber. At least… not yet. Before your eyes, you see the hapless Knottie start to disrobe, her body moving in a lethargic daze, and then stand there as coiling vines emerge from the flower and wrap around her. She’s lifted up into the air, her eyes rolled back, her lips pursed in pleasure, as a slick nectar flows from the vines and coats her body. After several minutes, that nectar hardens into a solid cluster of pure amber, fully encasing the woman inside of it like a prehistoric fly. “Well… that explains what happened to everyone…” Ros’eela says with a frown. “I guess everyone was charmed by that plant and got gooped. We’ve got to do something about this! This is unforgivable - how dare those plants trap them without tying them up first” Revissa grumbles. “*That’s* what you’re upset about?” “Look, I might not be the best example of my species, but even I have standards,” the Knottie replies. You just shake your head in exasperation as you watch the video. “So it looks like the plants control people with their pollen. That would explain why I’ve been so horny ever since I entered the area, even from a distance that pollen is affecting us. And I guess that explains why Ros’eela was fine - she was tied up the whole time so she couldn’t get drugged into going towards the plant, even if she wanted to.” “See? My bondage training paid off!” Ros’eela says proudly. “Anyway, it looks like if we get too close we’ll totally lose our minds, but we can’t save everyone if we don’t get close. I wonder if there’s some way around that. If you girls have any ideas, I’m all ears. But for now I think I am going to hang back here and see if I can’t contact HQ for some help.” That seems reasonable. At this point, you could consider the mystery no longer your problem, since Ros’eela is calling it in to her bosses, though it would probably be the heroic thing to do to keep poking around. And though she’s going to stay on the ship for the time being, Ros’eela would probably be willing to at least accompany you to the science lab before you head outside. (set: $selfbind to true)(set: $pollentruth to true)(set: $rosawake to true) [[Investigate the science lab->FC02I]] [[Exit the ship->FC02E]] (if: $seenlab is true)[You decide to head back to the science lab, retracing your steps from earlier. But it is only as you step through the door that you realize the terrible mistake you made with your previous decisions. By deactivating the security protocols to get into the captain’s quarters, you also lowered the containment fields here in the lab, meaning that all the various living critters here being held in stasis are now free. As you step in, you see small animals darting every which way, clusters of bugs scurrying around trying to find a dark corner to hide in. But worst of all, you realize that the creatures are moving so frantically because they’re trying to escape from one thing in particular.](else: )[You decide to head down to the science lab. Considering the size of the ship, it’s pretty unusual there would even be a lab here in the first place, so you decide that it’s worth checking out. The door is unlocked, and no security gets in your way as you step inside. What you’re met with is a scene of complete chaos. From the look of it, the lab was repurposed from crew quarters, given the alcoves in the wall that look like they were once bunk beds. You think that there must have been containment fields set up to keep samples in those alcoves, but thanks to your earlier security reboot, all those fields are down. Which means the various living critters that had been kept inside are free and skittering around like wild, small animals darting every which way and clusters of bugs scurrying towards dark corners. And all of them seem to be trying to escape from one thing in particular.] At first you just think it’s some kind of puddle of oil or tar that has spilled out onto the floor. But then you see that the puddle of black gunk isn’t remaining stationary. It’s moving, flowing around the room, oozing in directions that aren’t randomly determined, but chosen with deadly purpose. A small, fuzzy woodland creature gets overtaken by the blob and coated with the thick tar, which clings to the critter like glue and forms a firm rubber shell around its body. And then the critter falls to the floor and writhes, completely encased and immobilized by the goopy menace. Not good. This thing must be some kind of slime-like predator! Leave it to the Knotties to keep something so dangerous locked up in a lab that could be released with a single accidental press of a button. Ros’eela steps forward as the gooey monster starts sloshing forward. “Ah… crap, this thing got out? I read about it in the logs… apparently half a dozen workers got gunked up and dragged away by it before they were able to get a sample of it. It turns out its weakness was —- grrmphh!” (link:"Oh no!")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1106087801717526609/F80_RoseelaLatex_by_MilkGoblin.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by MilkGoblin(click-replace: "Art by MilkGoblin")[https://www.deviantart.com/milkgoblinnsfw https://twitter.com/MilkGoblinNSFW]] (set: $picF80 to true) But of course she doesn’t get to finish her thought before the slime monster throws itself against her body and adheres tightly to her skin, clinging to her in a tight sheathe that cuts off any chance of movement. You’re no expert, but you’re pretty sure even the best escape artist in the galaxy wouldn’t be able to just wriggle out of that. Which means she won’t be able to help you now. You watch as the monster completely envelops her, covering her face and head tendrils and dropping her to the floor as a squirming, writhing, latex-bound mummy. Even with her caught, however, the monster doesn’t seem content to stop there. Some of it sloshes off away from the cocooned Knottie, ready to snare you and your wife if you don’t act fast! (set: $roslatex to true)(set: $rosawake to false) [[Make a run for it->FC02IC]] [[Try to lure it into a containment cell->FC02ID]] [[Attempt to find its weakness->FC02IE]] ] It’s impossible to gauge how much time has passed since you were first captured. It could be days, it could be weeks, or even years. There’s just no way to know without any external stimuli to judge your surroundings with. The only thing you know is the impossibly taut touch of the living rubber slime, the way it cradles every inch of your body, stimulates every nerve ending, works its way over every sensitive spot. Your sealed-away mouth can’t utter a sound, but if it could, the only noise it would make is a constant moan of pure pleasure, as you are driven over the edge again and again in a never-ending parade of powerful, mind-numbing orgasms. If you could see outside your new existence, you would maybe be aware that eventually the Knottie ship’s auto-pilot systems kicked into gear and flew itself back to the main outpost, called there remotely by settlers curious why the workers from the outpost had fallen out of contact. What they find is a (if: $roslatex is true)[trio](else: )[duo] of women completely overwhelmed by a very curious organism, with a host of fascinating properties worthy of further study. For example, they quickly determine that it thrives off a kind of symbiotic relationship with its host. It siphons body heat for nourishment, which it obtains by eliciting a constant state of arousal and release in the entity it has bonded with. Considering this worthy of further study, the slime creature and its (if: $roslatex is true)[three](else: )[two] captive hosts are shipped off to a remote research colony, filed away among many other interesting experiments so that the weird goo might eventually be harnessed into new forms of bondage technology. At no point does anyone, anywhere in the command chain think to release the (if: $roslatex is true)[trio](else: )[duo] of constantly orgasming prisoners locked within the goop. In fact, explicit orders are given to ensure they are *never* set free. After all, medical and scientific ethics prohibit the mistreatment of intelligent laboratory specimens, so it would be cruel to deprive the slime entity of its source of nourishment. Over the years, the discovery of the slime will open up entire new disciplines of engineering, and samples will be cultivated into a variety of useful strains. Eventually, the original creature and its hosts will have exhausted their novelty, and as such will be locked away securely in some specimen containment capsules and filed away in a distant warehouse, never to be opened again. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]] It’s impossible to gauge how much time has passed since you were first captured. It could be days, it could be weeks, or even years. There’s just no way to know without any external stimuli to judge your surroundings with. The only thing you know is the impossibly taut touch of the living rubber slime, the way it cradles every inch of your body, stimulates every nerve ending, works its way over every sensitive spot. Your sealed-away mouth can’t utter a sound, but if it could, the only noise it would make is a constant moan of pure pleasure, as you are driven over the edge again and again in a never-ending parade of powerful, mind-numbing orgasms. If you could see outside your new existence, you would maybe be aware that eventually the Knottie ship’s auto-pilot systems kicked into gear and flew itself back to the main outpost, called there remotely by settlers curious why the workers from the outpost had fallen out of contact. What they find is a (if: $roslatex is true)[trio](else: )[duo] of women completely overwhelmed by a very curious organism, with a host of fascinating properties worthy of further study. For example, they quickly determine that it thrives off a kind of symbiotic relationship with its host. It siphons body heat for nourishment, which it obtains by eliciting a constant state of arousal and release in the entity it has bonded with. Considering this worthy of further study, the slime creature and its (if: $roslatex is true)[three](else: )[two] captive hosts are shipped off to a remote research colony, filed away among many other interesting experiments so that the weird goo might eventually be harnessed into new forms of bondage technology. It’s purely by chance that a passing Star Scout happened to pick up on the distress beacon being emitted by the candy you swallowed at the start of the adventure. Because if she hadn’t, she would not have intercepted your shipping crate before it reached its destination. Luckily, she managed to bargain for your freedom and release you from your bondage, and was even kind enough to reunite you with your remaining crew who had been searching for months to figure out what happened to you. And so you narrowly avoid the fate of permanent captivity… though sadly you failed your original mission quite spectacularly. GAME OVER [Start over->A0X]] There’s no way you’re going to be able to overcome some weird alien symbiote. Just look at how it instantly caught Ros’eela like that! Better to escape for now and figure out a better plan when you’re not in immediate danger. “We need to get out of here!” you yell to your wife, grabbing her by the wrist to pull her back towards the door you came in through. But the slime monster is faster. It races ahead of you, sloshing its way between you and the exit, cutting off your retreat. Not good at all. Your mind races, wondering whether at this point you should switch towards fighting, since it seems clear it has no intention of letting you escape. Sadly, it becomes a moot point. Because once it has limited your movement, the slime goes in for the kill. It oozes upwards, forming itself into a kind of thin, rectangular sheet of dribbling rubber, high enough to stretch itself fully between the floor and ceiling, and then it rushes forwards. There’s nowhere to run. The room is too cramped to avoid it. It forms itself into a barrier of goop and advances, forcing both of you back against the wall. All you can do is hold your hands up in a pathetic attempt at resistance before it melds itself over you, gluing you and your wife firmly in place. You feel a sickening splort as it molds itself to the surface, locking both of you inside of it and lifting you off your feet. (link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1106087800899653632/F79_MelfyRevissaWallLatex_by_ZeroTwo9S.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF79 to true) And just like that… you’ve been completely and utterly incapacitated. Your clothing and gear melt away against the monster’s rubbery grip, leaving you naked as it flows between every nook and cranny of your now-exposed bodies. You can’t move, can’t speak, can’t even see as your vision gives way to a churning black tar that blots out all light from the room around you. Now there’s absolutely nothing you can do but squirm and writhe impotently against your captor’s rubbery body, held fast and firm with no possible way to escape. (if: $candy is false)[[[Begin symbiosis->FC02IX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Begin symbiosis->FC02IY]]] ]There’s no way you’re going to be able to overcome some weird alien symbiote. Just look at how it instantly caught Ros’eela like that! Better to keep it contained for now, at least until you can figure out a better plan. Of course, actually accomplishing that is easier said than done. But after you share your thoughts, Revissa comes up with a plan. Breaking away from you, she transforms herself into an adorable green monkey, only about two feet tall, and begins leaping around the tables and equipment in the room, making a raucous shrieking sound and throwing random objects into the slimy creature’s body. And that seems to have the intended effect of drawing its attention towards her, causing the monster to keep spitting goopy blasts of liquid rubber in her direction. But as a monkey, she is faster. She always manages to leap to the side at the very last minute, frustrating the relentless monster and making it reckless. Until finally, the creature launches its entire gelatinous form at her, hoping by sheer volume it will be able to connect with her. And it might have, had you not grabbed her by the tail and yanked her away right before it hit her, causing the monster to instead fly right into one of the containment cells. Quickly you pull out the tablet and re-activate security protocols, once again trapping it inside an energy barrier. Success! Though that doesn’t help at all with rescuing Ros’eela. Your pink friend is still entirely encased in a sheathe of latex, squirming helplessly in the creature’s grasp. Sadly, you have no better ideas on how to proceed, so for the time being you have Revissa turn back to humanoid form and load the Knottie up into an air-tight storage crate, locking the lid shut with a hiss of steam. Not the best solution, but the only one you can come up with at the moment. And now it’s just the two of you again. The question remains what to do about the pollen-spitting plant and the rest of the Knotties in the outpost, not to mention Ros’eela who is still helplessly writhing in the storage container. [[Head back->FC02E]] Before she got gunked, Ros’eela had said the slime creature had some kind of weakness. Well, it would stand to reason that if it did, the people holding it here would have a way to target its weakness somewhere in the room. Now if you could just find it, maybe you could get out of here. “Revissa… try dumping some of these random containers on it and see if it reacts to anything!” you yell. Your wife nods, conjuring plant vines to sprout up from the ground and grab onto various test tubes full of chemicals and crates with harvested materials, overturning them and dumping them into the gooey creature’s sticky mass. As each object drops in, it gets absorbed with a sickening *splort*. Some wood chip samples dissolve uselessly, as do several strips of dried and cured leather. A vial of river water does nothing, nor does a hunk of amber. Just when it seems like you’re out of luck, Revissa knocks over a small refrigeration unit onto the slime which, much to your delight, causes it to suddenly slow down in its movement. “Wait… cold!” you yell. Of course! You vaguely recall a story from years ago about a slime symbiote that was weak to low temperatures. This thing must work the same way. Looking around, you see a feed line for some industrial coolant gas on the wall. And you’re just about to point it out when something among the cocktail of chemicals within the slime creature causes it to violently erupt. You and Revissa have only a moment to hold up your hands in surprise before a wave of sticky slime slams into you both and shoves you up against the wall, pinning you there beneath a thin but taut rubbery sheathe. It holds fast, completely cutting off your movement, vacuum sealing you to the spot with no way to get out. (link:"Mmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1106087800899653632/F79_MelfyRevissaWallLatex_by_ZeroTwo9S.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF79 to true) And just like that… you’ve been completely and utterly incapacitated. Your clothing and gear melt away against the monster’s rubbery grip, leaving you naked as it flows between every nook and cranny of your now-exposed bodies. You can’t move, can’t speak, can’t even see as your vision gives way to a churning black tar that blots out all light from the room around you. Now there’s absolutely nothing you can do but squirm and writhe impotently against your captor’s rubbery body, held fast and firm with no possible way to escape. (if: $candy is false)[[[Begin symbiosis->FC02IX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Begin symbiosis->FC02IY]]] ]You’ve been poking around the outpost for hours now, checking every building, examining every machine. But up until now, you’ve ignored the giant flower in the center, surrounded by hunks of amber resin. Maybe it was just some kind of sixth sense that warned you away from it, some deep-seated knowledge born from the many adventures you’ve survived up until now. But whatever it is, after seeing the recorded footage on the ship, you know it was the right call. If you got too close, you’d be overwhelmed by the scent of pollen and doused in quick-drying nectar, frozen in place with no chance of getting out on your own. So given all that, one might find it rather puzzling why you would now choose to approach the giant flower. But there’s nothing strange about it. Despite everything, you do somewhat fashion yourself as a hero. When push comes to shove, you try to do the right thing. Revissa might not be happy with what these Knotties are doing to the forest, but they don’t deserve to be trapped forever like flies in amber. So you’ve decided the only thing to do is to rescue them. At least you know about the pollen, and that you need to keep your wits about you when the plant starts to try and lure you in. “Hold on a moment,” Revissa says, lightly grabbing your wrist as you approach. “Let me do a quick spell.” She rifles through her bag for some bright red berries, then crushes them between her finger, reaching out to lightly brush some of the pulp on each of your foreheads. “It only lasts for a few minutes, but it should make us a bit more resistant to mind-altering effects,” she explains. “But *not* immune… so please try to keep your libido in check.” “No promises,” you say with a smile, before you strut towards the center of the clearing towards the hunks of amber. You knew what to expect, but you still have to stifle a gasp when you notice it. Though the hardened chunks of sap are mostly opaque, when you get close enough you can see past the surface to what lies inside. Each piece of resin holds a woman trapped inside of it, all of them bearing the distinctive head tendrils of the Knottie species. The women are nude, and have expressions on their faces ranging from surprised, to relaxed, to aroused. None of them are moving, which isn’t surprising, though at least they don’t appear to be in any immediate danger. “They’re alive,” Revissa confirms, laying her hand on the smooth surface of one of the amber stones. “This is made of the same Ghost Matter as the rest of the stuff on this planet, so they’ll be safe and healthy for as long as they’re in there.” “Can they be freed?” you ask, casting a suspicious eye around the area for any signs of movement from the flower that did this to them. Revissa shakes her head. “It’s… really strong stuff, I am pretty sure. Conventional weapons would be useless against it. But maybe the Squira priestesses of Del Thora would be able to do something. They make use of a Sacred Sap in their rituals that has similar properties.” On the one hand, they’re not stuck forever. On the other, it means that there’s probably no tools you have in your arsenal here that can rescue anyone caught in the stuff. Which means your best bet to finding out how to free them would be examining the flower itself. It is exactly when that thought crosses your mind that you hear the rustle of leaves from behind you. The sweet scent of pollen grows thicker and stronger, filling your nostrils with a fragrant aroma that sends your mind reeling - though Revissa’s blessing helps you resist the worst of it for now. Turning around, you see the massive flower fronds start to unfurl from the center of the giant plant, revealing an unexpected sight at their center. [[Meet Petal->FC02LA]] “Why, hello there…” says a voice as sweet as honey, deep and rich and almost hypnotic in its melodious tones. You feel the hair on your tail start to stand on end. Despite the sensuality in the words, you can feel the threat posed by the voice. Ahead of you, the giant flower fully unfurls, and within it you can see the body of the painfully beautiful woman that was hidden inside. (link:"Feast your eyes")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1104996719839694869/F57_Petal_by_TunaTeluna.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by TunaTeluna(click-replace: "Art by TunaTeluna")[https://www.deviantart.com/tunateluna https://twitter.com/TelunaTuna]] (set: $picF57 to true) She has rich green skin, short, fluffy hair with the texture of leaves, and a curvaceous figure that extends down to the thighs before it vanishes into the center of the petals of the giant flower. The interior of her flower is filled with more of that amber liquid, the same as the stuff all the Knotties are encased in, sloshing around whenever she moves, creating a powerful, honey-sweet scent even more overwhelming than the airborne pollen. Despite everything, you still find yourself speechless before her. Every fiber of your being is telling you to submit, to surrender, to give yourself over to the bewitching plant woman. Revissa seems a bit more equipped to answer, stepping forward with her arms held up diplomatically. “Greetings, noble protector of the forest,” your wife says. “We apologize for the intrusion. And… I just want to let you know that we – that I, sympathize with your plight. I know these women–” and here, she gestures vaguely towards the amber-trapped Knotties “--have caused harm to your home. They have cut down trees, they have slain animals, they have disrupted the natural ecosystem. They have intruded in a place where they do not belong–” “Hrmm…” the plant woman says with a frown, interrupting her. “It’s true… they didn’t belong here. But it’s okay! Now they do! They’re part of the forest now, and they’ll stay that way forever!” The use of the word ‘forever’ certainly sets off alarm bells. Yet even still, you find yourself transfixed by her beauty. Revissa, too, is struggling to maintain her composure. “My name is Petal,” the woman says after a moment, reaching down to brush a hand over each of your cheeks. “What are your names?” “Melfy,” you murmur weakly. You stare up, transfixed by the intensity of her eyes, the softness of her skin. “Revissa Bloomtender,” your wife says more firmly. She steps forward to interpose herself between you and the plant woman. Petal tilts her head curiously to the side. “Are you upset with me?” she asks, her voice dripping with what seems like sincere concern. “No… not exactly,” Revissa murmurs, though even her voice is starting to waver. Being this close to the source of that pollen is intoxicating. “But… these women… you can’t just… keep them here.” “Oh, is that all?” Petal says, relief evident in her voice. “Don’t worry! I completely can! They won’t be going anywhere, but they’ll be safe, and happy, and useful! Here, I’ll show you.” You feel leafy vines begin to curl around your body, and you have just enough presence of mind to realize what she is saying. She thought Revissa’s complaint was a question of practicality - that she couldn’t physically contain all those women safely - rather than a moral one. And she’s about to prove it by doing the same to both of you! (if: $pollenlust is >6)[[[Surrender->FC02LC]]](else: )[[[Try to fight her off->FC02M]] [[Try to reason with her->FC02LB]]] ] “Why, hello there…” says a voice as sweet as honey, deep and rich and almost hypnotic in its melodious tones. Normally, your first instinct would be to prepare for battle, reach for your sword or blaster pistol, maybe snarl and bare your teeth in challenge. But you do none of those things. Instead, you just turn around, a placid smile on your face as your nostrils fill with a saccharine scent that dulls your senses and lulls you into a placid, compliant daze. And you look up into a pair of beautiful, nurturing eyes. A single wrong move and you’ll be just as helpless as Revissa is. But you’ve got to take it. The leaves covering her generous bosom harden and crack away, and all that fragrant nectar pooled up in her lap dissolves. No more enchanting pollen spreads from her leaves, and no more vines curl up from the ground to protect her. She’s been completely defeated. You fall to the ground in relief, finally able to think clearly. And beside you, you see the tendrils that had been binding up Revissa go slack, letting her pull herself free and slump down at your side. For a while, you both just lay there, but eventually you wrap your arms around each other and work off the arousal that had been building up since you first set eyes on the gorgeous plant woman. When you’re finished, you put your clothes back on and return to the outpost, leaving the inert plant sculpture behind. (set: $frozenslime to false)(set: $petalfreeze to true) [[Finish up your business here->FC02NB]] ] You’re not going to get another chance if you want to defeat her. And so you decide to take the initiative and rush towards her, sword drawn. The freezium metal will only be keeping her in check for a few moments, but you’ve turned the tides of a battle in less time than that. Based on your observations, it looks like Petal is both the gorgeous woman and the flower her body is extending out of. And though it pains you to hurt her, you think that if you manage to cut the stem out from beneath the flower, you may be able to sever her connection to the earth and ground. Considering how quickly she caught Revissa with subterranean vines, you know that in an extended fight, she’ll just catch you too. So the best time to act is now, while she’s still incapacitated. With a deep breath and a steeling battle cry you swing your blade with all the force you can muster, striking the stem of her flower strong and true. *Thunk.* Your blade finds home, embedding itself into the sturdy stem of plant flesh, doing a bit of damage… but not nearly enough to cleave itself all the way through. It was foolish to think that you could defeat her with a single blow. And even worse, the ringing impact from your sword strike seems to have accelerated the process of her cracking out of the freezium shell. You see it flake off, bits of metal dropping to the ground, revealing the gorgeous woman beneath it … as well as the snarl of rage on her face over the wound you had inflicted on her. “Owwww!” screeches Petal, voice filled with pain and regret. “Why… *why* would you do that?! Realizing you’re going to need another swing to finish severing the stem, you try to pull your sword away, but find that it is firmly stuck. You get two solid tugs at it before you’re given no more, and powerful loops of vines wrap around your body and pull you away. “You people… all you people are *just the worst*!” Petal yells, tears forming in her eyes. “First they come and cut down trees and hurt the animals… and now this? I thought if I was nice and gave them a home here, they would stop causing so much trouble, but I guess you’re *neve*r going to stop, are you?” You try to pull free, but she’s angry now, and her vines prove to be much stronger than you are. They wrap around you, pull away your clothing, extract your sword from her stem and toss it away into the woods, never to be seen again. “How many more of you annoying… *pests* are there?” she demands. “I… I don’t…” you start to say, but she’s having none of it. “Tell me!” she demands, twisting you upside down then dunking your face into the nectar pooling up around her thighs. And then she pulls you in close, cupping your face and bringing it in for a sap-filled kiss. “Tell me,” she says again, softer, cloyingly. (link:"Kiiiissss")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1108262207541743616/F86_MelfyPetalKiss_by_Dvega.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Dvega(click-replace: "Art by Dvega")[https://www.deviantart.com/dvega https://picarto.tv/Tek]] (set: $picF86 to true) The nectar is so sweet, so wonderful, it washes away any fear or doubts. Of course you’ll tell her. After all… she asked you so nicely. And it’s only fair after what you’ve done to her. “We came… on a starship. There were… six of us. You already have… me and Revissa…” “And the others?” Petal asks. “Can you call them? Bring them here?” You nod, glancing towards your comm device which was pulled from your arm when she stripped you. A vine snatches it up and brings it close to your face. “Then call them. Get them all in one place. And then we’ll end this infestation once and for all!” [[Call your crew->FC02MBA]] ]There’s no way you’re going to be able to come out on top in a fair fight. The freezium bought you a chance to prove discretion is the better part of valor, and you’d be a fool not to take it. So instead of rushing at the plant woman, you instead attack the vines she had used to snare your wife, severing the leafy tendrils with a few well-placed sword slashes. Once Revissa is free, you quickly take her by the hand and pull her away, fleeing the clearing where the beguiling plant woman has made her home. Though as you leave, you can’t help but remember Ros’eela. You’d left her mounted on the wall of one of the buildings in the living quarters. The right thing to do would be to go back and thaw her out… though the more time you waste here, the more opportunity Petal will have to catch you. [[Go back and save her->FC02NE]] [[Prioritize escaping->FC02NF]] With the lovely plant woman now an equally lovely piece of metal artwork, you are free to return to the center of the outpost unmolested. As you walk, Revissa closes her eyes for a moment, sensing some kind of change in the texture of the forest around you. “I think… that Petal was some kind of… hub, I guess you could call it. She connected with the plants in the nearby area, gave them an intelligence and willpower that they would have otherwise lacked.” You nod your head, remembering how she was able to conjure up vines that seemed unrelated to her own main body. Maybe now that she’s been rendered inert, you’ll have an easier time moving through the forest. Though before that, you have something else you need to do. Heading back to the buildings of the living quarters, you locate the room with the freezium chamber, finding Ros’eela and the other Knottie right where you left them, mounted on the wall. Enough time passed during the encounter with Petal that it should be safe to thaw Ros’eela out from her metal prison, should you so desire. Though… it’s not like you *have* to unfreeze her just yet. If you do, she would probably report what happened to the main encampment, which would take away a potential trump card that could be used in future negotiations. Maybe you could keep her on ice at least until you’re done with what you need to do on the planet. Surely she’d understand; freezium is a part of Knottie culture after all, though to a lesser degree than bondage. Besides… she’d look rather fetching on the wall of your quarters… [[Thaw her out->FC02NC]] [[Keep her as a trophy. Just for a little while, honest!->FC02ND]] (if: $rosawake is true)[It’s a short trip back into the ship, and you find Ros’eela relaxing in some light bondage (which is a relative term, since she’s practically mummified in tight leather straps) when you arrive. She takes a few minutes to untie herself, which is incredibly impressive, since you or Revissa would have had no chance of getting out of the same situation.](else: )[With a whoosh and a hiss, the frame around her freezium slab initiates the thawing process, using a special combination of chemicals to return the metal coating back into a gaseous form. It dissipates from her body, leaving her naked and disoriented as she tumbles from the display frame. You’re helpful enough to catch her, then carry her back to the captain’s quarters in the Knottie cargo ship to fill her in on everything that happened. (set: $rosfreeze to false)(set: $rosawake to true)] You go over with her in detail about your encounter with Petal. After what happened, Revissa feels like there should be no further threats to the camp, ensuring that Ros’eela and the rest of her people are free to restore the amber-encased workers at their leisure. Ros’eela expresses her thanks, and promises to help you out however she can in the future, should you need it. Though of course… Knotties have quite an usual way of expressing their gratitude. (link:"Mmmph")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1108995609937051748/F88_MelfyRevissaSuspended_by_Swarm108.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by Swarm108(click-replace: "Art by Swarm108")[https://www.deviantart.com/swarm108 https://twitter.com/FreakghostA]] (set: $picF88 to true) You’d like to tell yourself that if you didn’t trust her already, you’d have been able to fight her off. But… that’s probably not accurate. Her mastery of bondage martial arts is unparalleled, and before you know you and your wife have been trussed up in ropes and placed entirely at her mercy. She has the gall to call it a ‘simple tie’, as she rigs up some kind of pulley system to suspend the two of you from the ceiling, looking you over with satisfaction as you wriggle and squirm against the taut restraints. Simple or not, you’re pretty sure you wouldn’t be able to escape at all, even if you had days to work at it. Luckily, Ros’eela only wants you for an hour or two. She puts those head tendrils of hers to good work, pressing her face between your writhing bodies and inserting the tips of them past the crotch ropes and into the slits between your legs, massaging you both to a warm and wet orgasm while you moan into your gags.
