Then she ties herself up again and nuzzles in between you, letting you all take a refreshing bondage nap together. After an hour she finally decides she is done repaying you, undoing your bonds and allowing you to take a quick shower and get dressed. Despite the unusual nature of the rest, you have to admit it does leave you feeling recharged. She gives you each one final affectionate kiss before sending you on your way back into the forest, opting to stay behind to finish up the work that needs doing at the outpost. So with all of that taken care of, you feel you are now ready to continue on with your original mission. Revissa was pretty confident that there would be no more threats from the local flora, meaning it should be a straight shot to the deepest part of the forest where you need to set up the data collection device. Though of course it’s always possible Revissa made a mistake. If you’re not feeling confident about your chances, you could always double back and try a different route through the forest. [[Continue onwards->FC03DB]] [[Double back->FC04A]] ] Revissa gives you the stink eye as you start fiddling with the controls of the outpost captain’s datapad, commanding some of the security drones to pick up the freezium slab and lift it from the wall. “What are you doing?” she asks suspiciously. You give her a fumbling explanation about your idea, worried that Ros’eela notifying her home base about your activities here would jeopardize the mission. “It would just be until we leave the planet,” you promise. She doesn’t fully believe you, but also doesn’t stop you as you finish inputting coordinates. And then the drones fly outside, carrying the metal-encased Knottie back to the landing site to be loaded up onto your ship the next time it touches down.(set: $roscollect to true) (if: $petalfreeze is true)[As you watch her fly through the air, your eyes can’t help resting on the other frozen figure nearby - Petal, helplessly encased in metal. Well… in for a credit, in for a standard galactic weight unit, as they say (though you think there might be something lost in translation in the idiom), so when the drones return you tell them to do the same with the lovely flower woman as well. Honestly, you don’t really have a good excuse for why you’re taking her… other than you think she’d look wonderful stationed in the little hydroponic garden Revissa has in Cargo Bay 3.(set: $petalcollect to true) ]So with all of that taken care of, you feel you are now ready to continue on with your original mission. Revissa was pretty confident that there would be no more threats from the local flora, meaning it should be a straight shot to the deepest part of the forest where you need to set up the data collection device. Though of course it’s always possible Revissa made a mistake. If you’re not feeling confident about your chances, you could always double back and try a different route through the forest. [[Continue onwards->FC03DB]] [[Double back->FC04A]] If it was any other Knottie, you’d be willing to leave without them, but Ros’eela is an old friend. So you swerve back to the living quarters, barging through the door and heading inside to the building that had the freezing chamber. Ros’eela is right where you left her, encased in metal and hanging on a wall, but now that some time has passed it should be safe to thaw her out. You spend a moment fiddling with the controls, sweating nervously since you know Petal might be right behind you with more pollen to drive you crazy. With a whoosh and a hiss, the frame around her freezium slab initiates the thawing process, using a special combination of chemicals to return the metal coating back into a gaseous form. It dissipates from her body, leaving her naked and disoriented as she tumbles from the display frame. You’re helpful enough to catch her, then help her sit down as she recovers from her bout of inactivity. “Oof… thanks,” she says, doing some stretches to restore the mobility to her limbs. She seems quite familiar with what to do after waking from a freezium nap, you can’t help but notice. You quickly explain the situation with Petal, letting her know the danger you’re all in by sticking around here. But despite your worries, Ros’eela decides that the right thing to do would be to return to the cargo ship and keep trying to get in touch with the main camp. After all, a bunch of her co-workers are still here, waiting to be rescued. Unable to convince her otherwise, you part with a promise from her to be careful, then continue to flee the camp. (set: $rosawake to true) [[Get out of here->FC02NF]] Leaving Ros’eela behind, you flee from the outpost, running down the path that you know will take you back to the side of the river. As you go, Revissa becomes increasingly agitated, looking around her frantically at the trees and bushes to the sides. “I… can feel it,” she says. “A malice, an urgency in everything around us. She doesn’t want to let us go, and this whole area of forest is willing to help her stop us.” That’s not good at all. Her prediction immediately comes true as a thick tree root suddenly bursts out of the ground to try and trip you up, followed by a heavy branch swinging across the path in front of you. But you’re fast enough to push past them, emerging back at the riverbank where you first spotted the tree with the faucet on it. That same tree starts to erupt, spilling glossy sap on the forest floor, forcing you to dodge to the side lest you get coated in quick-drying amber. With everything against you, you’re going to have to act quick if you want to escape successfully. [[Jump into the river->FC02NG]] [[Run back along the riverside->FC04B]] Things got thorny for a bit there, but in the end you solved the mystery of the Knottie outpost, and ended the threat that Petal had posed. At this point, you’re confident there won’t be any more obstructions on your quest, so you’re free to head back to the side of the river and follow it the rest of the way towards the heart of the forest. Eventually, you reach the point where you need to branch off from the river, and to your relief, the only thing in your way is a large, open, grassy patch of land, no trees, flowers, or bushes in sight - there’s not even any large rocks or other obstructions for a predator to hide behind. In such a wide, clear area, you feel like there’s no chance of getting taken by surprise. Though as you walk over it, Revissa pauses for a moment, frowning, before she kneels down and brushes her fingers through the blades of grass. “The grass… does not appreciate being walked on,” she says slowly. “It’s quite angry with us.” You raise an eyebrow. Trees and flowers, sure, you can see them having some degree of emotions, but *grass*? Though you can tell Revissa is serious. So with a sigh, you abandon the safety of the wide-open field and double back to the treeline, keeping to the rough, root-strewn patches of soil beneath the shade of the branches. You feel rather silly about it, but luckily there’s nothing lurking in the shadows of the overhead boughs, and so you eventually advance to the center of the forest with only a slight delay thanks to the detour. [[Head into the deep woods->FE01]] In the end, you just can’t be sure that you’re not gonna get attacked again by any hungry flowers on your way forward. Sure, Petal might not be a threat anymore, but that doesn’t mean there aren’t any other gorgeous plant gals that want to have their way with you lurking beneath the next tree. Revissa listens as you express your fears, and eventually agrees to double back with you. “If I had to guess, it’s the proximity to the river that has made the plants in this particular stretch so exceedingly active” she muses, sparing a glance towards the water as you make your retreat. “So the farther away from it we get, the less likely we’ll meet anyone else like Petal.” That makes sense to you. Though even if you avoid any horny plants, that doesn’t mean there won’t be some other dangers awaiting you. Hopefully you’ll have what it takes to escape those ones, too. [[Return to the start->FA06]] There’s no time to waste - every minute you remain here is another opportunity for one of these plants to catch you! And so, as you approach the river, you decide your best bet is to grab Revissa by the hand and leap together with her into the water. As soon as you breach the surface, you feel the pull of the current take hold of you, carrying you backwards through the forest back towards the entrance. Even here in the water, you can see various plants bordering the river trying to turn against you, springing up from the riverbed or springing downwards from overhanging branches. But you manage to evade them, in no small part thanks to Revissa’s nature magic, keeping the aggressive flora at bay until you have put considerable distance between yourselves and the Knottie outpost. Eventually you feel you have gone far enough and pull yourselves out of the water, finding on your map that you’re a short distance away from where you started. “Hmm…” Revissa says, closing her eyes and feeling the pulse of nature around her. “I think Petal’s range is limited. We’ve gone far enough away from her that I don’t think we’ll be in any more danger from her influence.” Well, that’s a relief. Though it also means that, for all your efforts, you’re right back at square one. It looks like you’ve got no choice but to find another path through the forest if you want to complete your mission. (set: $petalescape to true) [[Head back to the start->FA06]] You briefly consider jumping into the river, but think better of it, knowing that there’s just as many plants near the water than there are away from it. Better to stay on land where your strength and mobility are at their best. And so the two of you make your escape, charging back along the side of the stream as branches swing down to block your way, and random creeper vines attempt to snag your ankles. But you fight through them. Between your swordplay and Revissa’s nature magic, they aren’t able to hold you down, and eventually you feel that you’ve gotten far enough away that you’re in the clear. Revissa warns you to still be wary, of course, but for now you stop running and slow your pace, finally allowing yourself to breathe normally again. It’s still a bit of a walk to return to the entrance, so you’d best get moving. Unfortunately, it is at the exact moment that you first let your guard down that you feel the rumble of movement from beneath the soil, followed by the eruption of several hidden creeper vines that dart upwards and wrap themselves around your limbs. [[Get tangled->FC04D]] Eventually, you reach the point where you need to branch off from the river, and to your relief, the only thing in your way is a large, open, grassy patch of land with no trees, flowers, or bushes in sight - there’s not even any large rocks or other obstructions for a predator to hide behind. In such a wide, clear area, you feel like there’s no chance of getting taken by surprise. In retrospect, you should have foreseen the problem. Together, you and Revissa begin marching across the open plain, eyes darting warily back and forth - towards the distant trees, towards the river behind you, towards the sky above - everywhere but down at your feet. If you had looked that way, you might have noticed the ominous way the blades of grass shifted as you walked over them, swaying not in sync with the direction of the wind but their own internal chemistry. How every strand bent towards the intruders in their territory, how the two of you were not welcome, even here, in an open, unassuming stretch of land. The grass waits until the two of you are far into the center of the patch of green, when you stop for a moment to pull off your boot to shake out a pebble that had gotten stuck. It is the very moment that the rock strikes the ground that the grass begins to sway, suddenly growing in length and spooling outwards with a mind all its own. In an instant your legs have been wrenched together, throwing you off balance and making you drop your boot onto the ground. More blades of grass twirl upwards to ensnare and destroy the foreign object, turning it into tiny scraps that are swiftly buried beneath the soil. As if the grass wants to cover up any trace of your existence. Beside you, Revissa shrieks in surprise as she, too, is targeted, her staff yanked from her hand and dropped with a soft thunk onto the soft green surface beneath her. Your instinct is to reach out towards her, but the growing coils of flora capture your arm and pull it against your body, shredding any clothing it catches along the way. Now realizing the peril the two of you are in, your wife tries to close her eyes and use her magic to connect with the grass attempting to entrap you, but all she senses is a terrifying, violent impulse to subjugate all that does not belong. She comes out of her trance with a gasp, just as the grass curls past her chin and over her mouth to seal away her voice. With only a moment before you, too, are fully restrained, you recall the freezium gas capsule you had liberated from the chamber back at the outpost. You manage to pull it out of your bag at the last possible moment with your one free arm, just as the grass snags your wrist. The capsule drops to the ground, but you manage to catch the edge of it with your teeth and yank open the release valve, causing super-chilled metallic gas to spray outwards all around you. Propelled by the expelled vapor, the capsule shoots around randomly, icing over the thin fibers of grass and causing it to shatter away, but never expelling enough over you or Revissa’s body to fully encase you. This gives you the opportunity you need to escape the grip of the plants, scooping up your wife and making a run for the trees as flakes of hardened metal crackle away from your body. The grass is not done trying to catch you, but now that you’re expecting it you manage to wrench it off of your ankles before it wraps you up, and then with one final leap you dive beneath the cover of the trees, outside of the range the probing tendrils can reach. You and Revissa lay there panting for a good while, looking fearfully towards what had seemed to just be an unassuming patch of greenery. “I think… this particular field of grass very much does not like to be stepped on,” Revissa murmurs after a moment. “Maybe ask it to put up a ‘keep off the grass sign’ next time?” you suggest, getting just a roll of her eyes in response. Your clothing and weapons were all destroyed by the attack, but luckily you managed to hold on to your satchel containing the data device for the mission, as well as the synthesizer capsules Jyumon provided you to create duplicates of your outfits. So after a few minutes the two of you are dressed up again and ready to continue towards the heart of the forest – though this time you make sure to avoid any patches of grass along the way. (set: $clothingrespawn to it + 1)(set: $freezebomb to false) [[Head to the deep woods->FE01]] You decide to leave the outpost area, even though there’s unfinished business here. In the end, it’s just not worth the risk. (if: $ros is true)[Ros’eela is disappointed that she won’t have your help in figuring things out, but she understands. She thanks you for your time and promises to keep in touch, parting ways with you as you head back down the path to the riverside.(set: $rosawake to true)](else-if: $rosawake is true)[Though you do feel really bad about leaving Ros’eela behind. Hopefully she’ll be able to handle things on her own, or at least get help from the main camp that she said she was going to get in touch with.](else-if: $rosfreeze is true)[Though you do feel really bad about leaving Ros’eela behind. She’s not going to be able to help anyone while hanging on a wall encased in solid metal, but at least this way she’s not in any *other* kind of danger. Presumably her people will drop by eventually and thaw her out.](else: )[You still don’t know why it’s been abandoned, but that was never part of your mission. Let it be somebody else’s problem, you figure.] Once you get far enough away from the camp, the cloying scent of sweet pollen finally fades away, allowing you to think clearly once again. It was starting to get hard to concentrate. Regardless, you double back to the edge of the path leading to the outpost, finding yourself once more at the side of the river. And now you turn back the way you came, returning to the entrance of the forest to hopefully find a safer path to the heart of the woods. Unfortunately, it turns out that in the end, nothing in this part of the forest is truly safe. For no sooner do you let your mind wander and glance towards the readout on your holo-map than you feel the rumble of movement from beneath the soil, followed by the eruption of several hidden creeper vines that dart upwards and wrap themselves around your limbs. [[Get tangled->FC04D]] You grunt in surprise as the vines wrap around your legs, pulling themselves taut to anchor you to the spot. “Grah! I’ve had enough of these damn plants!” you yell, trying to reach for your sword. But they seem to have predicted that, as several more green tendrils emerge from a tree branch above you, snagging your wrist before you can get a grip on the weapon. “It’s like… they don’t want to let us leave,” Revissa says nervously, clutching her staff firmly as she tries to connect with the natural world around you. “They… they see us as a source of nourishment. They want our life energy to… to fertilize the forest!” “Well tell them my energy is reserved for other things!” you yell, tugging at the vine that caught your arm. But no sooner do you sever it than another one springs up to catch it again. And then the ones at your legs creep higher, climbing up your body and beneath your clothes, bursting outwards to shred your outfit into tattered scraps. Revissa begins to panic as she gets targeted as well. Leafy tendrils snare her legs, pressing them together firmly. “Maybe if I… use a Plant Growth spell I can convince them we’re more useful to them active than tied up,” she reasons, working on an incantation for just that. But even after the nature energy spools outwards from her staff and into the ground beneath you, the vines don’t stop probing. In fact, they just climb higher, binding Revissa’s arms to her sides and ruining her clothing as well. Seeing it didn’t help, you redouble your efforts against the vines, but they are ruthlessly persistent, growing tighter and stronger with every passing second. You only manage to free your arm for a moment before it’s snatched up once again. And now you’re somehow feeling a strange tingling sensation down towards your legs. “What… why is it… my legs feel… weak,” you murmur, glancing downwards. And then your eyes widen in fear as you see a brown, barky texture beginning to spread along your skin. “Revissa! It’s… transforming me…” She notices it on you as well, and a look of regret flashes across her face. “No… I… my spell only empowered them. Unlocked… new abilities. They were just trying to catch us before… but now… they are trying to… to convert us into a part of the forest!” You give one last tug against the restraints, but your strength is waning. “Can you… do something else?” “I… I didn’t want to hurt them… but maybe… a withering spell will — mmphh!” But her words are cut off as more vines snake around her lips. Did the plants *know* she was planning on harming them? You try to call out to give her encouragement, but feel the same tendrils snaking around your mouth as well. This is bad, really bad. You don’t have the energy to keep resisting. And your body is growing more and more numb as the transformation creeps higher. Up your legs, over your hips, around your breasts, down your arms to the tips of your fingers. Your limbs lock in place, sensation flees your body, the sound of crackling bark fills your ears as it reaches your neck. “Mmmpphh…” You can only make one last plaintive grunt of helplessness towards Revissa, sparing her a pleading glance before wood grain washes over your face and everything goes black. She only lasts a few minutes longer than you do before she suffers the same fate, converted into a wooden statue that is unable to voice any more opinions on the matter. (link:"....")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1110372405802704957/F89_MelfyRevissaWooden_by_MoaiHero.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by MoaiHero(click-replace: "Art by MoaiHero")[https://twitter.com/MOWwitchblade https://www.deviantart.com/witchbladeproyect]] (set: $picF89 to true) And so you stand there, frozen and inert, as the forest continues to thrive around you, happy for the two new additions to its splendor. (if: $rosawake is true)[[[Wait for rescue->FC04E]]](else: )[(if: $candy is true)[[[Take root->FC04DX]]] (if: $candy is false)[[[Take root->FC04DY]]]] ]Deep in the forest, the trees grow tall and strong. Their branches spread wide, hungrily drinking in the sunlight, eagerly collecting its energy which will filter through their roots into the soil below. Here in this part of the forest, everything is interconnected. Not quite a single organism, more like a community, a network of individuals who all eagerly share their resources with one another to ensure that everyone can thrive. You and Revissa are now a part of that community. Long ago, your bodies were converted into sculptures made of wood. The vines have long since unfurled from your inert bodies, which proceeded to topple over onto the dirt with a soft thud the next time a strong gust of wind washed over them. Neither of you are aware of this, of course - you’re just statues, after all. But statues that are full of life and potential. When the rain washes over you, trace elements of that energy wash off your bodies and filter into the soil. When animals rest on you, that energy flows into them through their feet, and when moss grows in the little cracks on your wooden bodies, it eventually releases spores that carry through the air to the rest of the forest. Though neither of you think, feel, or move anymore, you’re still very much alive, still a source of nourishment, still a valued member of the thriving forest ecosystem. No one ever finds the two of you. You’ll never know what happened to the rest of your crew, both because they never pass by where the two of you lay, and also because you’re no longer capable of thinking about them. Just two hunks of wood, as inert as logs floating in the river. When you tried to leave, the forest said no, decided you were too precious a resource to be allowed to leave. The forest got its way. And so, here you both will stay. Forever. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]Deep in the forest, the trees grow tall and strong. Their branches spread wide, hungrily drinking in the sunlight, eagerly collecting its energy which will filter through their roots into the soil below. Here in this part of the forest, everything is interconnected. Not quite a single organism, more like a community, a network of individuals who all eagerly share their resources with one another to ensure that everyone can thrive. You and Revissa are now a part of that community. Several days ago, your bodies were converted into sculptures made of wood. The vines have since unfurled from your inert bodies, which proceeded to topple over onto the dirt with a soft thud the next time a strong gust of wind washed over them. Neither of you are aware of this, of course - you’re just statues, after all. But statues that are full of life and potential. Lucky for you that one element of that potential is contained in the Star Scout homing beacon you swallowed at the start of the adventure. It allowed your crew to track you down and recover your wooden bodies from the ground. After some effort, Lumina is able to use her healing magic to restore you both back to flesh, and you awaken with a start on a bed back on your ship. Unfortunately, though they managed to save your lives, the data collection device was destroyed by the elements while you were petrified. And so you manage to escape being a permanent resident of the forest, though your mission is, sadly, a complete failure. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]][[Back to Art Gallery->AI00]] [[Back to Main Menu->A00]] [[Back to Forest Art->AIF]] Amber Loving (if: $picF47 is true)[ <img Art->AIF]](set: $DPassword to (prompt: "Please enter the password", "")) (if: $DPassword is "Banana")[Password accepted!(set: $debug to true)](else: )[Password incorrect] [[Back to Main Menu->A00]](link-goto: "Resume Game", $lastPassage) **DEBUG MENU** Activate all progress markers (link: "Do it")[(set: $forestboss to true)(set: $racewin to true)(set: $merryround to true)(set: $foreststart to true)(set: $ProgressLevelSelect to true)(set: $ProgressHoloChamber to true)(set: $ProgressGameStart to true)(set: $forestoutpost to true) ] Deactivate all progress markers (link: "Do it")[(set: $forestboss to false)(set: $racewin to false)(set: $merryround to false)(set: $foreststart to false)(set: $ProgressLevelSelect to false)(set: $ProgressHoloChamber to false)(set: $ProgressGameStart to false)(set: $forestoutpost to false) ] [[Back to main menu->A00]] **In-Game Triggers** Warning: Using this menu may break the game's sequencing, resulting in non-sensical outcomes or making progress impossible. Use at your own risk. By default, all triggers are "false", and will be set that way any time a new game is started. forestfae *Activates when you first meet the fae woman in the forest.* Current status: (print: $forestfae) (link: "Turn on")[ (set: $forestfae to true) ] (link: "Turn off")[ (set: $forestfae to false) ] faewin *Activates when you survive the merry-go-round battle with the fae.* Current status: (print: $faewin) (link: "Turn on")[ (set: $faewin to true) ] (link: "Turn off")[ (set: $faewin to false) ] sawbunny *Activates if you've seen the bunny predator in the forest.* Current status: (print: $sawbunny) (link: "Turn on")[ (set: $sawbunny to true) ] (link: "Turn off")[ (set: $sawbunny to false) ] ros *Activates when Ros'eela is actively following you in the outpost* Current status: (print: $ros) (link: "Turn on")[ (set: $ros to true) ] (link: "Turn off")[ (set: $ros to false) ] inship *Activates when you make it inside the Knottie cargo ship at the outpost.* Current status: (print: $inship) (link: "Turn on")[ (set: $inship to true) ] (link: "Turn off")[ (set: $inship to false) ] gagtalk *Activates if you've found the gag-talk translator in the outpost* Current status: (print: $gagtalk) (link: "Turn on")[ (set: $gagtalk to true) ] (link: "Turn off")[ (set: $gagtalk to false) ] rosamber *Activates if you've caused a trigger that leads to Ros'eela running off and getting caught by Petal* Current status: (print: $rosamber) (link: "Turn on")[ (set: $rosamber to true) ] (link: "Turn off")[ (set: $rosamber to false) ] rosfreeze *Activates when Ros'eela gets carbon frozen.* Current status: (print: $rosfreeze) (link: "Turn on")[ (set: $rosfreeze to true) ] (link: "Turn off")[ (set: $rosfreeze to false) ] rosawake *Activates if Ros'eela is active when you leave the outpost area.* Current status: (print: $rosawake) (link: "Turn on")[ (set: $rosawake to true) ] (link: "Turn off")[ (set: $rosawake to false) ] frozenslime *Activates if you get the frozen slime symbiote in your inventory.* Current status: (print: $frozenslime) (link: "Turn on")[ (set: $frozenslime to true) ] (link: "Turn off")[ (set: $frozenslime to false) ] freezebomb *Activates if you get the freezium capsule in your inventory.* Current status: (print: $freezebomb) (link: "Turn on")[ (set: $freezebomb to true) ] (link: "Turn off")[ (set: $freezebomb to false) ] pollentruth *Activates when you learn the source of the pollen. The trigger for the true boss fight against Petal.* Current status: (print: $pollentruth) (link: "Turn on")[ (set: $pollentruth to true) ] (link: "Turn off")[ (set: $pollentruth to false) ] petalfreeze *Activates when Petal gets frozen.* Current status: (print: $petalfreeze) (link: "Turn on")[ (set: $petalfreeze to true) ] (link: "Turn off")[ (set: $petalfreeze to false) ] petalfriend *Activates when you befriend Petal.* Current status: (print: $petalfriend) (link: "Turn on")[ (set: $petalfriend to true) ] (link: "Turn off")[ (set: $petalfriend to false) ] petalescape *Activates when you escape from Petal successfully.* Current status: (print: $petalescape) (link: "Turn on")[ (set: $petalescape to true) ] (link: "Turn off")[ (set: $petalescape to false) ] petalcollect *Activates if you collect Petal's statue.* Current status: (print: $petalcollect) (link: "Turn on")[ (set: $petalcollect to true) ] (link: "Turn off")[ (set: $petalcollect to false) ] roscollect *Activates if you collect the frozen Ros'eela.* Current status: (print: $roscollect) (link: "Turn on")[ (set: $roscollect to true) ] (link: "Turn off")[ (set: $roscollect to false) ] plantcontact *Activates when you survive the plant attack in the low path in the forest. Required to befriend Petal.* Current status: (print: $plantcontact) (link: "Turn on")[ (set: $plantcontact to true) ] (link: "Turn off")[ (set: $plantcontact to false) ] [[Back to main menu->A00]]With a whoosh of its landing thrusters, the Lucky Break sets down in the center of the clearing, taking up the exact same spot that the Knottie cargo ship had been in. But that ship had already left days ago, piloted remotely to return to the central camp near the ruins. Your crew is here because of a message Ros’eela sent them. While monitoring the footage from security drones circling the outpost, she happened to spy a pair of wooden statues abandoned in the forest - bearing the familiar likeness of two people she’d met not very long ago. Anxious about their safety, she sent a message to the Lucky Break - but she used an old comm channel she remembered from years ago to send it, one which your crew had not been monitoring on account of the secrecy of the current mission. It was only after they had given up on the search for the two of you and were about to take off that they happened to check it and find out the truth. So now they are here, spreading out to try and find that same security footage so that they can pinpoint where it was you were caught. Krysta is the first one to find a clue. “Ah crap. You’d better come take a look at this,” she says, directing everyone towards one of the large amber hunks that litter the field. (link:"Discover her fate")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1104996719499952190/F56_AmberTrio_by_ZeroTwo95.png" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by ZeroTwo9S(click-replace: "Art by ZeroTwo9S")[https://www.deviantart.com/zerotwo9s https://twitter.com/Zerotwo9S]] (set: $picF56 to true) “Oh no!” says Lumina. “Something must have happened to her after she sent us that message!” She runs up and places a hand on the chunk of resin, closing her eyes to sense the life energy emanating from it. “I think… she is okay in there. All of them are. But I have no idea how we would get her out.” Jyumon waves a hand for a quick scrying spell, viewing the scene through the magical spectrum. “Hrm. This reminds me of the sacred sap used by the Squira on Del Thora. I suspect they might have an idea how to undo it.” “An unfortunate development,” says Vhaja. “And certainly something to pursue once we leave the planet. But it does not help us in discerning Melfy’s location.” She turns to Krysta. “I see a disabled drone on the floor there. Do you think you can hack into it and access the security footage?” “On it!” says the red-head. The excitement of going on a hunt in the forest causes her latent lycanthropy to manifest, making a bushy squirrel tail poof out from her backside. In the end, Krysta’s talents prove to be reliable. It only takes her a few minutes to find the data, and then after cross-referencing it with a topological map of the forest they have a good idea of where you ended up. Another hour of walking and something comes into view ahead of them.] |drink1)[(link:"Be seen")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1111497775461449728/F90_WoodTPK1_by_TheEasyRider.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by TheEasyRider(click-replace: "Art by TheEasyRider")[https://www.deviantart.com/theeasyraider https://twitter.com/EasyriderThe]] (set: $picF90 to true) By now, the vines that had snared you have receded back into the earth, leaving behind nothing but a pair of wood grain statues, trapped in awkward poses. You and Revissa, of course, are unable to speak a word, to offer any explanation as to how you ended up in this embarrassing position. Vhaja sighs. “I’d have expected as much from Melfy, but I had hoped Revissa would have been able to prevent this from happening.” “Especially since this is all nature-y stuff,” says Krysta. “Woulda thought she’d be immune or something.” Lumina spreads her wings and starts to glide towards the two wooden sculptures. “I will see if I can restore them,” she says. But she never gets that chance. Because as soon as she starts to approach, a gust of wind blows a cloud of seed spores from some flowering branches off a nearby tree, tripping her up in a fragrant dust storm that brings her down to the ground in a sneezing fit. The others come up to assist her, getting themselves coated in the same clingy bits of pollen, sticking to their hair, fur, and clothes. It’s Vhaja who realizes the danger first – but by then, it’s already too late. [[Gain some company->FC04F]] ]“These spores – they’re full of magic. Powerful life energy!” Vhaja yells. But already the seeds are erupting, causing spirals of creeper vines to splay out from within, growing at an impossible rate to encircle your four would-be rescuers in a moment. Their clothing is shorn from their body as the vines cling to their skin, digging in deep enough to send paralytic toxins into their bloodstreams. (link:"Get tangled")[(show:?drink1)] |drink1)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1111497775855706112/F91_WoodTPK2_by_TheEasyRider.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by TheEasyRider(click-replace: "Art by TheEasyRider")[https://www.deviantart.com/theeasyraider https://twitter.com/EasyriderThe]] (set: $picF91 to true) “Crap! No! I… c-can’t… move!” yells Krysta. “N-no! What is… this! I… I… my arms… won’t….” Lumina squeals, before it becomes too difficult to speak. Jyumon mutters the first few syllables of a fire spell to try and burn away the creeping vines, but her body freezes before she can finish the incantation. “We… we must! Try… try and… f-fight… it…” Vhaja begins, but her strength gives out from her and she falls to the ground weakly, legs splayed apart in an embarrassing display of helplessness.] |drink1)[(link:"Get frozen")[(show:?drink2)]] |drink2)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1111497776275128390/F92_WoodTPK3_by_TheEasyRider.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by TheEasyRider(click-replace: "Art by TheEasyRider")[https://www.deviantart.com/theeasyraider https://twitter.com/EasyriderThe]] (set: $picF92 to true) And just like that, they are caught. No more words escape from their lips, as the powerful toxins get to work. They do more than arrest your friends’ movement. They poison them, transform them, convert them into plant matter, just like they did for you and your wife. With unseeing wooden eyes, you can only stare ahead lifelessly as your crew succumbs to the very same trap that ended your adventure, transforming them all into motionless sculptures of carved wood. “....” “....” “....” “....” Bound in vines, robbed of mobility, of sight, of their very consciousness, your beloved friends join you as more mute fixtures of the forest, unable to help you, or anyone else, escape from the fate that was decided for them.] |drink2)[(link:"Get forgotten")[(show:?drink3)]] |drink3)[<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1064706245363236936/1111497776694566982/F93_WoodTPK4_by_TheEasyRider.jpg" style="max-width: 100%;">(css: "font-size: 60%")[Art by TheEasyRider(click-replace: "Art by TheEasyRider")[https://www.deviantart.com/theeasyraider https://twitter.com/EasyriderThe]] (set: $picF93 to true) Eventually the vines recede, their work done, leaving behind six frozen victims, who will now become permanent additions to the scenery. None of you move an inch, none of you speak a word. And this time, there’s no one to send a distress call to ask for more help. Everyone who could possibly have come to your aid is trapped, ensuring you and your crew will be here for a long, long time. (if: $candy is false)[[[Take root->FC04FX]]] (if: $candy is true)[[[Take root->FC04FY]]] ] Deep in the forest, the trees grow tall and strong. Their branches spread wide, hungrily drinking in the sunlight, eagerly collecting its energy which will filter through their roots into the soil below. Here in this part of the forest, everything is interconnected. Not quite a single organism, more like a community, a network of individuals who all eagerly share their resources with one another to ensure that everyone can thrive. You, Revissa, and the rest of your friends are now a part of that community. Long ago, your bodies were converted into sculptures made of wood. The vines have long since unfurled from your inert bodies, which proceeded to topple over onto the dirt with a soft thud the next time a strong gust of wind washed over them. None of you are aware of this, of course - you’re just statues, after all. But statues that are full of life and potential. When the rain washes over you, trace elements of that energy wash off your bodies and filter into the soil. When animals rest on you, that energy flows into them through their feet, and when moss grows in the little cracks on your wooden bodies, it eventually releases spores that carry through the air to the rest of the forest. Though none of you think, feel, or move anymore, you’re still very much alive, still a source of nourishment, still a valued member of the thriving forest ecosystem. No one ever finds you. The Knottie outpost you came from becomes lost to the elements, the amber-encased women left behind by their kin to spend eternity as glistening trophies that send dappled waves of gold onto the ground when the sunlight filters through them. All Ros’eela’s message accomplished was ensuring that your friends rejoined you in the worst way possible, the six of you now laying inertly on the ground, doing nothing but melding in with nature. No intelligent eyes will ever gaze upon you again. And though the forest knows you are here, it’s in the same way it knows about rocks, and leaves, of twigs and berries and old, forgotten logs. You’re a part of nature, but not in any way important to it. Just six hunks of wood, and nothing more. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]]Deep in the forest, the trees grow tall and strong. Their branches spread wide, hungrily drinking in the sunlight, eagerly collecting its energy which will filter through their roots into the soil below. Here in this part of the forest, everything is interconnected. Not quite a single organism, more like a community, a network of individuals who all eagerly share their resources with one another to ensure that everyone can thrive. You, Revissa, and the rest of your friends are now a part of that community. Long ago, your bodies were converted into sculptures made of wood. The vines have long since unfurled from your inert bodies, which proceeded to topple over onto the dirt with a soft thud the next time a strong gust of wind washed over them. None of you are aware of this, of course - you’re just statues, after all. But statues that are full of life and potential. When the rain washes over you, trace elements of that energy wash off your bodies and filter into the soil. When animals rest on you, that energy flows into them through their feet, and when moss grows in the little cracks on your wooden bodies, it eventually releases spores that carry through the air to the rest of the forest. Though none of you think, feel, or move anymore, you’re still very much alive, still a source of nourishment, still a valued member of the thriving forest ecosystem. Though there is still one thing about you that stands out. A long, long time ago, you swallowed a candy capable of sending out a distress beacon on a Star Scout frequency. And though it takes many decades, that message does eventually find a receiver. A passing Scout tracks you down and recovers your inert bodies, brings you onto her ship and brings you to a recovery center, where, eventually, someone will find the time to restore you and your friends to flesh. But by the time that happens, it will be nearly a hundred years since you first fell into that trap. The galaxy will be much changed in that time, leading to a whole new set of adventures for your faithful crew. But that’s a story for another day, and irrelevant to this one, to this mission. A mission which, of course, has ended in abject failure. GAME OVER [[Start over->A0X]](if: (saved-games: ) contains "Slot A")[(load-game:"Slot A")](set: $lastPassage to "") (if: not ((passage:)'s tags contains "menu"))[==============================] (if: not ((passage:)'s tags contains "menu"))[[[Go to Main Menu->A00]]] (if: not ((passage:)'s tags contains "menu"))[(if: $debug is true)[[[Debug Menu->A05]]]]**Display Chapter Codes** *Explanation:* If this option is turned on, a small string of text will appear at the top every page. This is the internal naming system used to keep track of chapters. This can be useful if you want to report a bug or ask a question about a specific section. (link: "Yes")[ (set: $chapter to true) ] (link: "No")[ (set: $fchapter to false) ] **Star Scout Candy** *Explanation:* Early in the game, players have the option to swallow a Star Scout candy. This is a trigger that determines the exact ending you get when you Game Over. If Yes, endings are less severe, and the heroines are eventually rescued (though it may take a long time). If No, endings are more grim and permanent. (link: "Yes")[ (set: $candy to true) ] (link: "No")[ (set: $candy to false) ] [[Back to main menu->A00]]
